title: Analyst, Business Strategy & Analytics

description:
Ando is looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our mobile-first food delivery brand. Our company sits at the intersection of culinary arts and technology. We are looking for someone that can help unleash the creative potential of our world-class culinary team by leveraging data and strategic analysis. This role reports to the Head of Business Operations

We’re a multidisciplinary team aiming to change the way food is designed, curated and delivered using a data-driven approach. As our first Data Scientist, you will be on the cutting edge of analysis, leveraging our data sources to propose new ideas, run and analyze experiments, create dashboards, build predictive models, and facilitate market-moving insights in order to drive key strategic decisions across the organization.

The ideal candidate should love doing everything from coming up with questions to ask, to conceptualizing balanced metrics, to actually constructing the code to pull those metrics out of databases and big data stores alike. You love learning, data, scale and agility.

Responsibilities
----------------

  • Perform intensive analysis across all areas of our business to drive continuous improvement, operational efficiency, and product development
  • Build user, courier, and kitchen behavioral models
  • Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
  • Generate ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions
  • Perform time-series analyses, hypothesis testing, and causal analyses to statistically assess relative impact and extract trends
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as culinary, product, engineering, operations, and marketing
Qualifications
--------------

  • Ph.D. or Master’s Degree in operations research, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, computer science, physics or a related quantitative discipline, OR equivalent work experience
  • Deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms
  • Ability to conceptualize business issues, formulate hypotheses, gather results, analyze data, and make appropriate recommendations for change
  • Expert in the use of statistical analysis environments such as R, MATLAB, SPSS or SAS
  • Experience with BI tools. You’re as comfortable with relational databases as you are with Hadoop-based data mining frameworks. You are familiar with SQL. Bonus points for Python, JavaScript, and writing scripts to massage data
  • Our stack: Metabase on Postgres for BI dashboards, MongoDB for production data
Benefits
--------

This is a full-time role with comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance. We offer pre-tax flexible spending accounts for both health and transportation.

About Ando
----------

Ando is a new online restaurant from Momofuku and Expa, serving food specifically made for delivery.

We have offices in the SOMA district of San Francisco and in Soho New York City. Both offices are absolutely stunning, with fun atmospheres and amazing, brilliant people.
title: Data Scientist

description:
Here at Daybreak, we make games that bring people together: to build them and to play them. Together we have built and introduced some of the most famed and beloved gaming franchises to millions of players worldwide including H1Z1®, DC Universe™ Online, PlanetSide®, and EverQuest®. Daybreakers are obsessed with the entire creation process and passion for play is what makes us one with our players. From group raiding epics in Norrath to watching our favorite streamers ravage zombies in the post-apocalypse, we are devoted to delivering the ultimate gaming experience to our communities.

Let’s make games better together. Are you up for the challenge? Here’s some specifics on what we’re looking for…Daybreak Games is seeking an experienced, well-versed Vice President, Data & Analytics to lead a talented, best in class team towards the next evolution of our data efforts. A critical thinker with a focus on data management, governance, risk control, process improvement and performance enhancement; combined with proven methodologies to create business value through leveraging data.

This critical role will oversee the vision and strategy for enabling our robust data pipelines to become an asset through seamless accessibility and end-to-end mapping creating actionable insights as well as fulfill our games as a service business model.YOU WILL: Develop a comprehensive enterprise-wide data management framework, including baseline architecture that scales as the player base grows.Manage many diverse sets of inputs, applications, software and cloud solutions to create a robust, efficient, and cost effective pipeline.Oversee a companywide effort to connect data sources end to end from web based marketing analytics to accounts & commerce and game telemetry.Partner with stakeholders and business units to create scalable dashboards and custom analysis to dissect player behavior, gain deeper insights, embed that knowledge into models, and share new discoveries across the business.Educate business units to establish data-driven and highly informed decision-making capabilities, including analysis of and insight into player acquisition, engagement & monetization.Develop a deep bench of analytics & data science capabilities to take our data into the realm of being highly actionable, predictive and serving the needs of our player base.Collaborate with other departments including game teams to create an ingestion system for the game engines/clients to be able to receive data to enable A/B testing and serve curated, targeted end user messaging.Be responsible for enterprise wide data governance. Organize and implement policies, procedures, structures, roles & responsibilities that outline and enforce rules of engagement, decision rights, and accountabilities for the effective collection, management and maintenance of informational assets.YOU ARE: College educated, a Bachelor’s degree required, Masters or Doctorate a plus (advanced degree in a quantitative discipline e.g. statistics, mathematics, economics, finance, physics, etc.).A seasoned pro, you have done this before and you are bringing best practices that can be applied immediately.Well versed in SQL, PL/SQL or other related database programming language.You have strong knowledge of data warehousing best practices and experience with databases technologies like Oracle, Teradata and Vertica.You have practical, applied experience in building Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools & systems.A great leader and communicator and know how to navigate cross-departmental waters to articulate a vision and bring it to life.You love getting your hands dirty and mentor through leading by example, resolving problems, and making critical decisions.You appreciate gaming, even if it’s not through industry experience. You understand how a gamer thinks and what types of information would be critical to a gaming company.You are well versed in many 3rd party services, applications, cloud data solutions and can bring with you a network of potential solutions.You have at least 10 years of experience in data management/business intelligence and 3+ as a leader.Think you’re Daybreaker material?

Send us your resume and cover letter. Make sure to include your Twitch/YouTube channel (if you have one), social media handles, and/or link to your portfolio. We are looking for people who don’t just upload their basic resume, but rather, are looking to get noticed. So, go ahead, impress us!

Daybreak Game Company LLC is a recognized worldwide leader in massively multiplayer online games. Best known for blockbuster hits and franchises such as H1Z1®, DC Universe™ Online, PlanetSide®, and EverQuest®, Daybreak creates, develops, and provides compelling online entertainment for millions of gamers worldwide. To top it off, we are making games in two of the coolest cities in the United States: San Diego, California, and Austin, Texas.Daybreak Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to Diversity in the Workplace.ABOUT DAYBREAK SAN DIEGO: Our headquarters is where gaming culture and the So Cal vibe collide; creating a vibrant work environment that epitomizes our belief that every day should be well played. From our four-legged canine friends who can accompany us to work each day to company movie viewings, the perks of working at Daybreak San Diego extend well beyond the beautiful weather in this prime location.

Access to the local gym, as well as on-site fitness classes, board game nights, and a strong appreciation for the local craft brew scene (we even turned one of our original game servers into an on-site kegerator) are just some of the ways that working at Daybreak San Diego isn’t just about having job; it’s about being part of a community.

title: Research Intern

description:
The City of Monrovia invites your application for the position of...
MANAGEMENT ANALYST
(Public Services / Public Works Division)

Located 20 miles northeast of Los Angeles and nestled at the base of the San Gabriel Mountains, Monrovia is home to nearly 40,000 active and engaged residents who enjoy a premier quality of life in a charismatic City that blends small-town charm with big-city amenities.

The City of Monrovia is engaged in an exciting process of renewal to enhance its position as one of the premier municipalities in the nation. We are seeking a unique individual to serve as a Management Analyst in the Public Works Division within the Public Services Department. Currently, our Public Works Division is in the midst of the most remarkable capital project undertaking in the City's history. In 2015, the City Council approved Monrovia Renewal, a $52 million collection of projects to renew the City's water, sewer, and street infrastructure over the next five years. In addition to Monrovia Renewal, the City has another 60 capital improvement projects related to parks, facilities, and streets in the current budget. This person will be a critical part of the team that is making this happen!
Are you ready to help shape the image of a dynamic foothills community?

The City of Monrovia is looking for an individual to serve as its next Management Analyst in the Public Works Division. The position will appeal to individuals who are inspired by the challenges and opportunities presented in working with a dynamic and fast-paced team. Monrovia Renewal is not just a concept â it's a city-wide face-lift and we need a team oriented Management Analyst to help us accomplish these projects and change the Monrovia world and organization for the better.

In Monrovia, we believe that the way in which projects are accomplished is just as important as the end result. An individual who is committed to serving with humility, and who can demonstrate high emotional intelligence, will be successful in the role. Competitive candidates will have a hunger to continually search out ways to improve and should also be able to demonstrate loyalty to the organization and community. The selected individual will also need to be a smart, creative, and intuitive thinker and decision maker.

Functionally, the successful candidate will be responsible for a variety of ongoing operational responsibilities and projects, including:
  • Provide administrative and technical support to the City's robust capital improvement program
  • Prepare and administer requests for proposals, administer construction bids, and prepare necessary reports for council
  • Oversee contracts management for these projects
  • Communicate and coordinate with contractors and vendors for project related needs
  • Coordinate with utility providers related to construction
  • Provide financial management support and prepare budgets

It is important to note that in addition to these functional areas of responsibility, the successful candidate will also have the opportunity to design and shape his / her role within the organization in a manner that will accentuate his / her specific talents.

IDEAL CANDIDATE:

KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES AND SKILLS
Knowledge of:

Principles of public administration, budget preparation and analysis, human resources, management, organizational development, systems and procedures.

Principles of economics.

Federal and State legislative process and procedures.

Federal, state and local laws, ordinances, policies and procedures.

Survey techniques, statistics and report writing.

Ability and Skill to:

Plan, coordinate and perform complex surveys, analysis and prepare complex reports.

Collect and analyze data, present findings objectively, clearly and concisely and prepare reports with conclusions and recommendations.

Follow direction and polices with minimal supervision.

Communicate clearly both orally and in writing.

Establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff, Commissions, the City Council, City Manager and the public.

Perform duties of an emergency worker in the event of a natural or other disaster.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Any combination of education and experience that would provide the required knowledge, abilities and skills is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the qualifications would be:

BA/BS in public administration, business administration or related field and one (1) year experience in project management, or public works administration. Bi-lingual skills desirable.

description: We are looking for a data savvy analyst with experience in business and performance, quantitative analysis with the ability to translate the data to valuable business insights and action items. This market is super dynamic and holds a variety of challenges and opportunities.
title: Performance & Data analyst - Digital Solution

description:
Under general supervision, the incumbent will extract, compile, analyze and report data on students, academic and co-curricular programs, personnel, and any other aspects of the university as requested. Responsibilities include querying large-scale institutional databases; troubleshooting and manipulating data; creating reports; filling cyclical and ad-hoc data requests and reporting requirements; designing and conducting analytical, research and evaluation studies including preparing interpretive analyses and presenting findings in narrative and graphic forms; and effectively interacting with the university community and external constituencies in carrying out these responsibilities. A strong customer service orientation is essential, as is the ability to work both independently and as part of a team, meet deadlines and accurately handle details. The ability to think in a logical, sequential manner is essential and may be demonstrated through experience such as computer programming; i.e., writing code, scripts, or syntax. This position supports the activities of a Title V post-baccalaureate grant.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Surveys and Questionnaires
    • Complete federal, state, local, and institutional surveys and questionnaires, such as U.S. News and World Report, Petersons, College Board, IPEDS, etc.Ensure that data and information supplied in surveys and questionnaires are accurate, consistent, and timely. Maintain strong professional working relationships with campus academic and administrative offices, departments, and programs, as necessary to obtain needed data and information. Coordinate the completion and publication of the annual Common Data Set and maintain it on the university's web site.
    • Coordinate the university's cyclical participation in national surveys of students by identifying intended survey participants, distributing surveys, synthesizing delivered reports and conducting custom analyses and reports as necessary.
    • Develop and conduct surveys of students, employees, and other constituents to gather quantitative and qualitative information on topics such as satisfaction with services, impact of programs, etc.Analyze results and present them in a clear and concise manner to campus leaders.
    2. Reporting
    • Develop and deliver cyclical reports of student characteristics (academic, demographic, and socio-economic), and student achievement (GPA, units completed, retention, graduation, and time-to-degree).
    • Develop and implement reports to effectively and efficiently support enrollment management (student headcounts, unit load, and FTE) and academic affairs (e.g., majors, sections, degrees, faculty-student ratios, faculty workload).
    3. Accreditation Support
    • Provide data and analytic support for the university and specific graduate departments in compliance with accreditation studies at the university and discipline level.
    4. Grant Support
    • Provide data and analytic support for large scale, multi-year grants. Collaborate with grant project directors and external evaluators as appropriate.
    5 . Institutional Planning and Research Web and Portal Sites
    • On an on-going basis, ensure that the office web and portal sites up-to-date, web content is expanded as needed, and web format complies with campus design and technology standards. Collaborate with Public Relations and other campus offices to ensure that the office portal and web site content meets the campus's internal and external needs.
    6. Training and Professional Development
    • Research and gain expertise on software products and report development methodologies, as assigned.

    Requirements:
    Knowledge:
    • Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices
    • One or more of the following: Banner, PeopleSoft, or - preferably ? Ellucian's Colleague, especially academic / student modules
    • Good knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
    • Coursework or demonstrated experience in the use of statistics and relevant applications, research methodologies, and sound survey research practices.
    • Familiarity with common institutional research and effectiveness measures (e.g., retention, graduation rates, etc.) is preferred.
    • Familiarity with data visualization software (e.g., Tableau) is preferred.
    Abilities and Skills:
    • Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
    • Work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment as a participant and a leader.
    • Prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
    • Clearly communicate technical information to colleagues, including those who do not have a technical background.
    • Strong written and oral communication skills
    • Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
    • Travel occasionally as needed for professional development / training.
    Education:
    • Master's degree from an accredited college or university, preferably in a social science field, with coursework in statistics and research methodology, or any combination of training and experience that could likely provide the desired knowledge, abilities and skills.
    Experience:
    • Minimum of 2 years direct work experience.
    • Professional experience in a higher education setting preferred.
    • Experience in supporting graduate programs is desirable.

    Additional Information:
    Work Location: Doheny Campus (Downtown Los Angeles)

    Start Date: Immediately

    Applications Deadline: Open until filled

    The University is committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse student population and workforce as a reflection of our commitment to maintain the excellence of the University, and to offer our students richly varied disciplines, perspectives and ways of learning. In compliance with applicable laws and in furtherance of its commitment to fostering an environment that welcomes and embraces diversity, the University does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and parenting status), disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status or genetic information in its programs or activities, including employment, admissions, and educational programs. We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply to be a student or to work for the University.

    Application Instructions:
    Please submit cover letter, resume and salary history.
title: Research Analyst, Institutional Planning and Research

description: JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
title: Data and Quality Assurance Analyst

description:
The R&D; group at Centrillion is a multidisciplinary team of biologists, engineers, chemists, and computational biologists developing new genomics technologies, applications and products that will advance research and healthcare. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing Product Science Group. The new team member will work with Centrillion scientists to support development efforts, contributing to experimental design and analysis of large data sets.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work collaboratively with members of the Product Science team to develop and execute analysis methods.
  • Be data driven with strong data analysis skills.
  • Develop and implement appropriate statistical controls and analyses.
  • Independent management of analysis needs for multiple parallel projects.
  • Coordinate with algorithm, pipeline and software development efforts.
  • Communicate results with internal stakeholders and R&D; management. Integrate observations and feedback and execute follow-up analyses.
  • Keep detailed records and summarize work in research reports and team meeting presentations.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
  • MS or PhD in Statistics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics or similar field.
Requirements:
  • Experience in the genomics/biotechnology industry a plus.
  • Significant experience working with large data sets in Python, R or MATLAB and familiarity with core statistical concepts.
  • Experience with C/C++ is a plus.
  • Understanding of nucleotide sequence alignment is desirable.
  • Experience with Next Generation Sequencing and microarray analysis tools a plus.
  • Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to proactively identify issues and address with solutions-oriented approach.
  • Self-starter who is innovative and willing to explore new methodologies.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment; capable of managing competing priorities.
  • Proven interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills; excellent time management skills. Ego mature.
title: Data Scientist - Product Science

description:
Amazon Studios is seeking a researcher to contribute to a fast-paced, dynamic team tasked with traditional entertainment research and exploration in the digital space. This person will need to be a highly organized, creative, and strategic thinker to carry out program testing, primary research, and consumer insights research for primetime, kid’s television, movies, unscripted, and marketing departments.

Responsibilities will include working on social trend research, key art/asset testing, pilot testing, series maintenance testing, social listening/reporting and more.

This person needs to not only be excited to tackle a unique set of challenges posed by the digital space, but able to pinpoint new challenges and create ways to test and solve them.

Responsibilities:
  • Execute key art/trailer testing, pilot testing, series maintenance testing, social trend research, and more on an international scale.

  • Implement quantitative surveys and qualitative focus groups to inform business decisions related to our movies and primetime, kids, and unscripted television.

  • Analyze data and deliver actionable insights and recommendations to the content development, marketing, and strategy teams.

  • Assist with ad-hoc research requests by designing research projects and using third party syndicated data sets to solve business questions.
The job is located in Santa Monica, California

Basic Qualifications The ideal candidate will have excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail and experience with designing, programming, and deploying survey questionnaires, analyzing raw data, and reporting on results. They must have experience in media or a passion for media and narrative elements to be able to craft program testing. Past experience with qualitative and quantitative analysis and a desire to learn is necessary.
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Excellent verbal and written skills

  • Expert in Excel

  • 2+ Years in Primary, Entertainment, or Market Research

  • Experience managing vendor relationships

  • Quantitative and Qualitative Research analysis, including familiarity with statistics

  • Experience using social listening tools (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)

  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively

Preferred Qualifications Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon team members and leaders:
  • Has relentlessly high standards
  • Has a great sense of ownership; goes above and beyond to get the job done
  • Is creative; thinks big and outside of the box
  • Is a problem-solver and results oriented
  • Has convictions and is thoughtfully critical and supportive in a team environment
  • Thinks strategically and at a fast pace, but stays on top of tactical execution
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

description:
WHY COME TO UC MERCED?
 Cutting-edge sustainability and clean energy focus.

The University of California, Merced, is the newest of the University of California systems 10 campuses and the first American research university built in the 21st century. With a little more than 7,000 undergraduate and graduate students, UC Merced offers an environment that combines a commitment to diversity, inclusion, collaboration and professional development. With bachelors, masters and doctoral degree programs, strong research and academic partnerships, and community involvement, the UC Merced campus is continually evolving and requires talented, knowledgeable and dynamic educators, researchers, management and staff.

Ranked among the best public universities in the nation by U.S. News and World Report, UC Merced is uniquely equipped to provide educational opportunities highly qualified students from the San Joaquin Valley and throughout California. The campus enjoys a special connection with nearby Yosemite National Park, is on the cutting edge of sustainability in construction and design, and supports the economic development of Merced and the region.

In Fall 2016, UC Merced broke ground on a $1.3 billion public-private partnership that is unprecedented in higher education. The Merced 2020 Project will nearly double the physical capacity of the campus by 2020, enhancing academic distinction, student success and research excellence. UC Merced is also building the Downtown Campus Center, a $33 million, three-story administrative building in the heart of Merced.

ABOUT THE JOB:
Reporting to the Director of Institutional Research for the Office of Institutional Research and Decision Support, the Institutional Research Analyst (IRA), leads the production of periodic public, compliance, and administrative reports and surveys to support the information needs of the University. The mission of the department is to provide ongoing support for campus planning and decision-making to help advance the educational mission and effectiveness of the institution. The analyst is responsible for designing and coordinating production of applications and reports for a variety of University stakeholders. The Analyst will help maintain website resources, assist in survey design, execution, and analysis, and serve various campus stakeholders in response to ad hoc information requests.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE JOB:

4. Conducts staff workshops and seminars focused on the understanding of data and the tools designed to obtain data.
5. Provides institutional, state, and federal reporting that includes: accreditation, strategic planning, enrollment management, IPEDS and University of California Office of the President (requests), as well as externally-directed survey projects.
6. Provides technical support for the collection, management, and dissemination of data and analysis in support of institutional decision making and institutional reporting, including strategic planning and accreditation requirements. Develops reports for ease of interpretation and analysis by a variety of audiences and users.
7. Enhances professional and technical knowledge by attending educational and technical workshops/conferences; reviews professional publications; establishes personal networks; benchmarks state-of-the-art practices.

title: Institutional Research Analyst

description:
The mission of the group is to provide the information systems including the methods, software, databases, infrastructure, and training required for Research to access and analyze DNA and protein sequence information and related biological data. To utilize these information systems to analyze biological information and to identify genes of therapeutic interest.

Project 1:
Intern will be responsible for conducting one or more pooled CRISPR-based competitive screening experiments to clarify molecular processes driving Epithelial-to-Mesenchymal transition. They will work in partnership with a Genentech scientist to cultivate, infect and maintain existing cell line models for the duration of the screen, to validate experimental treatment and model properties, to collect the material and generate sequencing libraries, and then analyze the screen results. These responsibilities may be extended to include a computational project related to CRISPR screening methods and infrastructure depending on the proficiency of the candidate.

Project 2:
RNA splicing is a highly regulated process. Deregulation of transcript isoforms plays an important role in human and its evasion from targeted therapies. A better understanding of such cancer-specific transcript isoform usage may allow us to discover new cancer targets and biomarkers as well as resistance mechanisms. However, the interpretation of isoform quantifications is non-trivial and especially differential expression analyses of isoform usage may require approaches that differ from gene level analyses. As a result, isoform expression has largely remained unexplored in many biological contexts.

The successful candidate will explore the landscape of currently available tools for differential isoform expression analysis and apply them to biologically relevant questions. The candidate will be responsible for the evaluation of multiple differential isoform expression methods under various scenarios that simulate real RNA-seq experiments with the goal to identify the best performing approach. Leveraging the extensive in-house collection of RNA-seq data he/she will work closely with scientists outside of the department to identify experiments that will benefit from isoform-level differential expression analyses. Potential questions of interest will include (but are not limited to) explaining drug sensitivity using differential isoform expression, identifying cancer-specific isoform expression associated with mutations in the splicing machinery and detecting isoform expression differences in subtypes of cancer.

Project 3:
The intern will use data from clinical trials to assess genetic determinants of response to cancer immunotherapy. The goal is to identify genetic loci that might impact efficiency or safety of immune checkpoint blockade. The project requires browsing of databases, performing genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and R programming.

Target Start Date: Summer 2017

Who You Are
To be successful in this role, you will be or you will have:

Project 1:
Seeking a candidate with strong bench skills and a background in Biology, Systems Biology, Genetics, or Bioinformatics. Applicant must be proficient in standard cell biology, tissue culture, and molecular biology techniques (culture of immortalized cell lines, infection/transfection, protein and nucleic acid isolation, PCR, western blotting, viability assays). Familiarity with one or more standard high-level programming languages is strongly recommended (e.g., R, Python). Applicants familiar with CRISPR, Cancer Biology, Applied Statistics, and/or High Throughput Sequencing technologies (including library generation) will be prioritized.

Project 2:
  • Background in bioinformatics, biostatistics, computational biology, genetics, genomics or related field
  • Familiarity with Linux working environment and high performance computing recommended
  • Proficiency in R is greatly preferred, skills with other high-level programming languages and experience in standard bioinformatics toolkits and programs highly desired
  • Applicants with good understanding of concepts in cancer biology/genomics and/or familiarity with high-throughput sequencing technologies will be prioritized

Project 3:
The intern should be in a graduate program in bioinformatics, statistics, computer science, math or engineering. Who We Are A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.

The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply online" button below.

Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page .
title: Intern - Research Biology - Bioinformatics - PhD Students

description:
The OMNI Human Genetics department's mission is to use information from the human genome to discover and verify candidate biomarkers, to understand disease pathogenesis and heterogeneity, and to discover new drug targets for gRED prioritized diseases.

Project 1:

The successful candidate will be embedded in Genentech's Human Genetics Department, where they will have access to our internal genetic data, which includes both SNP array genotyping and whole genome sequencing data for tens of thousands of individuals. They will also have access to the members of the department and their know-how.

They will be expected to perform genetic association analyses to identify variants and genes associated with clinical traits. This will involve a literature review of the traits, preparation and quality control of clinical and genetic data, creation of a computational analysis pipeline, troubleshooting problems associated with the data or the pipeline and interpretation and communication of the results. In the past, successful internship projects have led to publications.

Project 2:

The successful candidate will work with the Genentech Human Genetics Department, where they will have access to genetic and phenotypic data from clinical trials, which includes both SNP array genotyping and whole genome sequencing data for tens of thousands of individuals. They will work closely with experienced members of the department.

The successful candidate will be expected to perform genetic association analyses to identify variants and genes associated with clinical traits using gene set enrichment analysis. This will involve a literature review of the traits, preparation and quality control of clinical and genetic data, creation of a computational analysis pipeline, troubleshooting problems associated with the data or the pipeline and interpretation and communication of the results.

Target Start Date: Summer 2017

Who You Are
To be successful in this role, you will be or you will have:

Project 1:
A degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Human Genetics. The ideal candidate needs to have experience working with sequencing or SNP genotyping data and be familiar with the basics of genetic association studies. Candidates also need to have experience with computational tools commonly used for the analysis of genetic data. This includes experience with the Unix command line and with at least one programming language like R or Python. Typical specializations include Human or Statistical Genetics, Genomics, Computational Biology and Bioinformatics.

Project 2:
A degree in Human Genetics, Computational Biology, Epidemiology

Who We Are A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. This analyst will develop, interpret and articulate results of complex improvement experiments which may include but are not limited to: developing risk algorithms, delineating variations in physician practice patterns, and ROI analyses and provide expertise in mathematical and statistical concepts for our broader Data & Analytics team. This position requires collaboration and consultation with a wide range of internal customers involved in value-based initiatives; including Accountable Care team, Variation Reduction, Service Line leaders, Managed Care and Medical Group executives.

title: Population Health Analyst II

description:
Receives instruction and on the job training by performing the following duties:
Plans and conducts the investigation into the circumstances of death at the scene to determine the jurisdiction of the Department of Medical Examiner - Coroner.
Examines the body of the decedent and the surroundings at the death scene and performs required tests for air, water and body temperature, livor mortis, and degree of rigor mortis.
Takes custody of any money, valuables or miscellaneous items or documents; lists and records clothing within reports and personal property on appropriate receipts; arranges for or makes the removal of bodies to the Forensic Science Center or other location.
Responsible for recognizing, collecting and preserving physical evidence, including gunshot residue, sexual assault evidence, appliances, ligatures, garrotes, drugs, narcotics and paraphernalia, and trace evidence.
Notifies and coordinates evidence handling and collection with departmental criminalist or criminalist of other agencies.
Interviews witnesses, friends, and relatives to obtain information about the decedent and circumstances of death and related matters.
Receives initial notice of death from public or government agencies, initiates investigations, determines Coroner's jurisdiction, and notifies and exchanges information with other public agencies when necessary.
Notifies and coordinates with representatives of other criminal justice agencies when necessary. Writes reports of investigations, including all pertinent data and evidence relevant to the circumstances of death.
Enters data into computerized records system as required. Provides information regarding State laws and codes, County ordinances, and Departmental policy and procedures in response to inquiries from members of the medical profession, law enforcement and other government agencies, mortuaries, cemeteries, and the general public.
Testifies in court or under deposition regarding the findings of an investigation of the circumstances of death.
Records information in logs and ledgers regarding Departmental activities; fingerprinting bodies in accordance with Departmental standards.
Uses field photography equipment as required.
Enters information in sections of death certificates in conformance with regulations of the State Registrar of Vital Statistics.
Drive personal vehicle when performing County business, as needed.
Drive a County vehicle to locations throughout the County to transport bodies from death scenes to the Coroner's facility, as needed.
Travel by aircraft, boat, or other vehicles, or travel in heavy equipment to conduct investigations and remove decedents and to perform duties in areas of difficult accessibility, limited visibility and mobility, or adverse weather or disaster conditions, as needed.
Requirements

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

OPTION I: Two years' field investigative experience* with a law enforcement** or governmental regulatory agency***.

OPTION II: A Bachelor's degree***** from an accredited college with specialization in administration of justice, health/physical sciences**** or nursing.

OPTION III: An Associate of Arts degree***** from an accredited college with specialization in administration of justice and one year's field investigative experience* with a law enforcement** or governmental regulatory agency***.

OPTION IV: A current California certificate***** to practice as a Paramedic and three years experience working in paramedic services with no more than a one year lapse in service before applying for the Coroner Investigator Trainee position.

OPTION V: A current California license as a Registered Nurse***** or a certificate to practice as a Physician's Assistant***** issued by the California Board of Medical Quality Assurance and three years experience working in trauma/emergency services or forensic nursing.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS
All applicants must successfully complete all required training and meet all of the standards established by the California Commission on Peace Officers Standards and Training (P.O.S.T.) prior to completion of the probationary period of one year.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENT INFORMATION
  • Field investigative experience must have included duties such as interviewing suspects, informants and witnesses, following leads, searching for physical or documentary evidence of clues, using evidence to substantiate findings or conclusions, examining records to detect links in a chain of evidence of information, reconstructing events and preparing reports of investigative findings and courtroom/deposition testimony.
**Law enforcement agencies include departments such as coroner, sheriff, police, military police, college or university police, and fire.
***A governmental regulatory agency is a public authority or government agency responsible for exercising autonomous authority over some area of human activity in a regulatory or supervisory capacity, and includes departments such as health services, mental health, and social services.
****A health/physical science includes degrees such as a bachelor's of science in anthropology, biology, biochemistry, physics, and chemistry.

LICENSE
A valid California Class "C" Driver License is required to perform job-related essential functions. Successful applicants for this position will be required to obtain a copy of his/her driving record from the California State Department of Motor Vehicles before being appointed. License must not be suspended, restricted, or revoked. AN APPLICANT WHOSE DRIVING RECORD SHOWS FOUR OR MORE MOVING VIOLATIONS WITHIN THE LAST TWO YEARS WILL NOT BE APPOINTED.

Out of state applicants must have a valid license from the state in which they reside at the time of filing and will be required to obtain a California Class "C" or above driver license by the time of hire.

PHYSICAL CLASS
4 - Arduous. Involves frequent and heavy lifting over 25 pounds, often combined with bending, twisting, or working on irregular surfaces; and occasionally requires extraordinary physical activity.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Applicants must be in good general physical fitness and free from any medical conditions that would interfere with the satisfactory performance of the position of Coroner Investigator Trainee.

Appointees must be willing to:
Perform a variety of physically demanding activities, such as frequent lifting and moving of decedents and heavy equipment, climbing down rocky cliffs, carrying a piece of equipment up steep hills, or removing corpses from the ocean.
Work any shift, including nights, weekends, and/or holidays.
Work overtime in order to meet the legal requirements and/or departmental needs associated with death investigations.
Drive 75-100 miles one-way using a County vehicle or personal vehicle to various death scenes throughout the County of Los Angeles (mileage reimbursement is provided by the County).
Assist in death investigations that include the examination of corpses and conducting tests to determine body temperature and degree of rigor mortis and handle bodies that may be fragmented, burned and/or in advanced stages of decomposition.
Assist in infant and child death investigations.
Notify family members of the death of a relative, have them identify the deceased, and provide them with information, empathy, support, and resources.
Work in highly stressful situations.
Develop and apply effective coping and self-care skills that maintain physical, mental, emotional well-being, a healthy perspective, and a clear and appropriate set of boundaries.
Work in death scenes that present a variety of difficult environmental challenges, such as strong odors, extreme temperatures, dilapidated living conditions, and/or rugged terrain.
SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE
Applicants will be required to complete a supplemental job willingness questionnaire at the time of filing. Applicants who do not agree to the work conditions and/or do not meet the minimum requirements will have to wait twelve (12) months from the date of the disqualification in order to reapply.

title: Data Scientist

description:
The Data Systems Analyst will maintain research data systems and perform statistical analyses for ongoing studies in the Program for Reproductive Health and the Environment. The Analyst will integrate data from a variety of sources, monitor data quality, produce and maintain reports, prepare analytic datasets, and respond to investigator data requests. With guidance from investigators, the Analyst will perform analyses (e.g. regression models) and produce summaries of the data for manuscripts (e.g. tables and figures) for publications and presentations. The Analyst will use best practices for maintaining program documentation and data dictionaries. S/he will work in collaboration with investigators and research staff to help identify data needs and develop and implement solutions. S/he will help with manuscript preparation and submission to peer-reviewed journals.

OBSTETRICS, GYNECOLOGY & REPRODUCTIVE SCIENCE
The Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences (Ob/Gyn & RS) is a major academic Department in the School of Medicine, engaged in clinical, research, and training activities at the Parnassus, Mt. Zion and San Francisco General Hospital campuses, as well as satellite locations throughout the Bay Area, with an annual operating budget of $77.2 million and the new Betty Irene Moore Women’s Hospital at Mission Bay. The OBGYN Department has 102 full-time faculty, 136 other academic appointees, 39 post-doctoral fellows, 20 clinical fellows, 36 residents, 136 voluntary clinical faculty, and 266 staff. The mission of the UCSF Department of OBGYN & Reproductive Sciences is to improve the lives and health of all women through excellence, innovation and leadership in Patient Care, Scientific Discovery, Education, Advocacy. “Leading the way in women’s health.”

The UCSF Program on Reproductive Health and the Environment (PRHE) advances scientific inquiry, professional training, public education, and health policies that reduce the impacts of environmental contaminants on reproductive and developmental health. We are a high-paced and committed team conducting novel research linking developmental exposures to environmental chemicals with health and creating new methods for research translation in environmental health science. We foster and promote student and professional interest and capacity in environmental health research, policy and education. More information on PRHE can be found here: www.prhe.ucsf.edu.

PRHE is in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences in the School of Medicine at UCSF. UCSF is a premier medical sciences institution dedicated to promoting health worldwide through excellence in research, teaching and patient care. The School of Medicine is ranked #1 nationwide in NIH support, and UCSF is ranked annually as one of the top hospitals in the United States.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

description:
Jetlore’s dynamic merchandising and adaptive product discovery engine is used by world’s largest online retailers across several continents in millions of daily emails and on-site visits and is responsible for generating millions of dollars in revenue. We constantly strive to improve and evolve the underlying statistical models and machine learning algorithms that empower Jetlore’s product discovery platform in order to provide further revenue boost for our clients and improve their users’ engagement.
We are looking for an exceptional data scientist who is excited to work on challenging problems involving massive amount of data. As part of the data science group, you will be responsible for developing probabilistic models, building dynamically learning algorithms, monitoring the performance of the system, and providing reports. You will work with cutting edge technologies such as Apache Spark and will build algorithms that will be used directly in production. You will explore different signals and incorporate new insights to improve the prediction power of the existing models and to come up with novel ways of increasing users’ engagement. In addition, you will interact with the business side to provide insight into how to improve the performance of the system. Named by Gartner as a Cool Vendor for 2016, we are growing 40% quarter over quarter and look for bold people who can win as a team.

Requirements:
This position requires being able to produce production quality code. Please do not apply if you have no production quality programming experience in an OOD language. Matlab, R or scripting does not qualify as production code.
  • MS or PhD (preferred) in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related fields with strong mathematics, statistics, and programming backgrounds
  • Excellent track record of independently developing and evaluating statistical models and machine learning algorithms (either as part of an academic project or previous work experience)
  • Extensive experience with an object-oriented programming language such as Scala, Java, C++ (at least 4 years of programming experience and at least 2 years of production quality programming experience; R, Matlab and SQL do not qualify as programming experience). Applicants who do not satisfy this will not be considered for the position.
  • Experience with a functional programming language is a plus
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills to carve datasets and provide insights into improving predictive power of models
  • Drive to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment with limited supervision
  • Solid communication skills and ability to collaborate with engineers as well as business and sales
  • Ping-pong skills is a plus!
Benefits:
Competitive Silicon Valley startup salary
Substantial equity in our fast-growing post-Series A startup
Comprehensive healthcare benefits
Healthy meals delivered every day
Birthday and milestone celebrations
Friday happy hour, baseball games, water skiing, and more team activities, Ping Pong
title: ​Data Scientist

description:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

Job Summary

iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is a San Francisco-based medical device startup company combining novel diagnostic device and data analysis concepts together to create a new approach to cardiac rhythm monitoring. We are looking for a data scientist / machine learning engineer to help develop the next generation of our algorithms and play a key role in our data science initiatives. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a new team applying data-driven machine learning technologies to large data sets from wearable medical sensors.

Location

San Francisco, CA

Responsibilities

  • Design, build and test machine learning algorithms for the analysis of electrocardiogram (ECG) signal data
  • Perform exploratory data analysis and visualizations of multivariate clinical data sets
  • Work closely with our software engineering team and clinical experts to deploy machine learning algorithms into production
Required Qualifications

  • MS with 2+ years of relevant work experience or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or a related quantitative field
  • Excellent knowledge of various machine learning classification algorithms, statistical modeling and time-series analysis
  • Basic knowledge of signal processing concepts like filtering, Fourier and wavelet transforms
  • Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with python libraries like numpy, scikit-learn, pandas etc.
  • Excellent knowledge of data structures, algorithms and modern OOP techniques
  • Experience working with real-world data sets with possible noise in data and labels
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills
Desired/Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous research experience with biomedical signals
  • Familiarity or experience with recent advances in deep neural network architectures and software frameworks like Theano and TensorFlow
  • Experience developing software in a Unix/Linux programming environment
  • Familiarity with cloud computing and big data technologies
Benefits/Compensation

This is a full -time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.

Contact

This is an opportunity to join one of the most compelling later stage health care start-ups in the Bay Area and the chance to make an impact on the health of large numbers of patients.

FLSA Status Exempt

iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D).
title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer

description:
The
San José Environmental Services Department (ESD) is responsible for the
management of solid waste collection and recycling; watershed protection and
pollution prevention; municipal drinking water and recycled water; community
sustainability initiatives, and the operation and infrastructure improvements
of the San José-Santa Clara Regional Wastewater Facility. ESD’s mission is to
deliver world class utility services and programs to improve our health,
environment, and economy. ESD is comprised of a staff of over 530 with a
diverse set of skills and specialties among our team. ESD staff demonstrate a
strong commitment to teamwork, environmental protection, and building good
partnerships.

For
more information about the Environmental Services Department, please visit
@sjenvironment on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram.

Positions & Duties

The Laboratory provides critical analytical services for monitoring
operations, compliance, and industrial discharges at the Wastewater Facility; and
the support of various studies monitoring water quality issues in the Bay and
urban tributaries. Our state-of-the-art facility provides analysis for trace
metals, organics, microbiology, toxicological bioassays and other tests for
air, soil, and wastewater. The lab operates 365 days a year and processes more
than 50,000 samples annually for internal and external customers.

The 28-member
laboratory team includes chemists, microbiologists, and laboratory technicians.

Laboratory Technician I is the entry level in this classification
series. Under immediate supervision, technicians in this class perform
standardized qualitative and quantitative physical, chemical, biological and
bacteriological analyses of wastewater, industrial waste and related
materials. Incumbents in this class
normally advance to the Laboratory Technician II class which is involved in the
performance of more difficult or complicated analyses and may provide
assistance in directing and instructing incumbents of the Laboratory Technician
I class. Assignments may be to any shift
in and around-the clock operation, and incumbents must be available for work on
weekends and holidays.

Key responsibilities of the Laboratory Technician include:
-

Prepares samples for chemical analysis, including pH adjustment,
sample homogenization and acid digestion.

-

Prepares bacteriological growth media and cleans and sterilizes
glassware, equipment, and supplies.

-

Performs physical measurements, including pH, temperature, conductivity,
salinity, and turbidity.

-

Performs routine chemical, biological, and bacteriological
analyses of water, wastewater, industrial wastes and related materials,
following specific procedures.

-

Conducts vertebrate and invertebrate biomonitoring procedures.

-

Assists in ordering, receiving, and maintaining an adequate supply
of chemicals and related equipment.

-

Compiles and records data for a variety of logs, reports, and
records, performing calculations as required.

-

Maintains clean and organized work areas, equipment, and devices

-

Inspects screening equipment, sampling equipment and collects
varied wastewater samples from specific locations.

-

May assist in sample collection programs for special or short term
projects.

-

May need to lift 50 lbs sample containers

The annual salary range for the

Laboratory Technician I

level is $52,041.60-$63,294.40. The hourly range is $25.02-$30.43

The annual salary range for the

Laboratory Technician II

level is $62,337.60-

$75,774.40. The hourly
range is $29.97-$36.43

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

1.

Education:
Two (2) years of college chemistry
or related field, with a minimum of 20 semester units in chemistry.

2. Experience:
Lab Technician I - None

Lab Technician II -
One (1) year of experience equivalent to a Laboratory Technician I with
the City of San Jose.

Employment Eligibility: Federal law requires all employees to provide
verification of their eligibility to work in this country. Please be informed
that the City of San Jose

will NOT

sponsor, represent or
sign any documents related to visa applications/transfers for H1-B or any other
type of visa which requires an employer application.

Competencies

The ideal candidate must possess the following
competencies, as demonstrated in past and current employment history. Desirable competencies for this position

include:
Job Expertise

  • demonstrates knowledge of the fundamentals
of chemistry and mathematics; basic principles of qualitative and quantitative
analysis, demonstrate ability to perform routine chemical mathematics and
statistics; demonstrate ability to perform basic biological, bacteriological
and chemical analyses; demonstrate knowledge of sample preparation techniques;
demonstrate knowledge of basic laboratory safety procedures; demonstrate
knowledge of the care, maintenance and sterilization requirements of laboratory
glassware, equipment and apparatus; demonstrate knowledge of standard
laboratory equipment, instruments and procedures; demonstrate knowledge of
laboratory quality assurance methods and procedures; demonstrate knowledge of
computer fundamentals to enter and extract lab data from specific applications
used in the laboratory.

Analytical Thinking

  • approaches a situation or problem by
defining the problem or issue; identifies relevant features, parameters, or
considerations; collects, summarizes and analyzes data

;

,

makes inferences of the data; and utilizes logic and intuition to develop
conclusions and make recommendations.

Teamwork & Interpersonal Skills

  • develops effective relationships with
co-workers and supervisors by helping others accomplish tasks and using
collaboration, constructive feedback, and conflict resolution skills.

Initiative

  • exhibits self-directed,
resourceful and creative behaviors towards meeting job objectives; ability to
follow through on assignments and work effectively with only general
supervision and seek assistance when appropriate; pursue continuing educational
opportunities which promote enhanced job performance; display willingness to
assume extra responsibility or workload and accept challenges; be willing to
accept change.

Reliability

  • completes quality work assignments in a timely and efficient manner;
meets established schedules and deadlines, including assigned work hours;
follows-up on progress of work; follows instructions and appropriate
procedures

Computer Skills

  • experienced with common business computer
applications including but not limited to: Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint,
Access, and Excel; and laboratory information management system (LIMS)
applications

Communication Skills

  • communicates and listens effectively and
responds in a timely, effective, positive and respectful manner; written
reports and correspondence are accurate, complete, well organized, concise,
clear, and in proper grammatical form; demonstrates comprehension of oral and
written questions, instructions, and information rapidly, thoroughly, and
accurately.

Selection Process

The selection process will consist of an
evaluation of the applicant's training and experience based on the application,
resume and answers to the job specific questions. Those applicants meeting the
minimum qualifications will be invited to a written exam. An appropriate number of best qualified
applicants with a passing score on the written exam will be invited to oral
interviews for final selection. These interviews may include a practical/written
exercise.

Note: The written exam is tentatively scheduled
for the end of March/early April. Candidates eligible for the exam will be notified
in advance of exact test date, time and location. Candidates who successfully pass the exam and
are selected for the interviews will be asked to provide transcripts from an
accredited higher education institution, showing the required minimum 20 chemistry
semester units or equivalent quarter units, prior to the interviews. Failure to provide transcripts in a timely
manner that satisfy the education requirement may disqualify candidates from
the screening process.

This recruitment may be used to fill multiple
positions in this, or other divisions or departments. If you are interested in
employment in this classification, you should apply to ensure you are
considered for additional opportunities that may utilize the applicants from
this recruitment.

You will be prompted to answer the following
job-specific questions during the online application process. Please note that there is a 4,000-character
limit, including spaces, for each text response.

-

Please
explain in detail any experience you have working in a laboratory performing
chemical and biological analysis.
Describe your responsibilities, employers, and years of experience at
each. Your answer must be consistent
with your work history.

-

Please
describe your knowledge and experience in using computer applications in a
laboratory environment. Indicate what types of programs you have worked with
and your proficiency in each.

If you have questions about the duties of these
positions, please contact Payal Sarkar at

Payal.Sarkar@sanjoseca.gov

If you have questions about the selection or
hiring processes, please contact Maria Lane at

Maria.Lane@sanjoseca.gov

Claiming
Veterans Preference

The City of San Jose has a Veteran's Preference
Policy (http://www.csj.gov/es/hrps/VeteransPreference.pdf) that applies to this
recruitment. To claim veteran's preference points, you must provide a copy of
your military discharge form, Form DD214, when appearing for the
written/practical examination for this recruitment. (For more information on
the City's Veteran's Preference policy, visit the link above.)

Additional Information

  • Link
to

Benefits

page

  • Link
to

Department

website

The
application deadline is 11:59 PM on the final filing date. Please allow
adequate time to complete the application and submit before the deadline or the
system may not save your application. If your online application was
successfully submitted, you will receive an automatic confirmation email to the
email address you provided. IF YOU DO NOT RECEIVE THE CONFIRMATION,
please email

CityCareers@sanjoseca.gov

and we will research the status of your application. Please contact Human
Resources at (408) 535-1285, or

Human.Resources@sanjoseca.gov

if you have any questions.

title: Laboratory Technician I/II- Environmental Services Department

description:
Supports business decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Produces actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems. Responsible for performing analysis of various data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects and aggregates data from multiple internal and external sources for the analyses to drive insights into business performance.
• Utilizes strong database skills to work with large, complex data sets
• Transforms unstructured or ambiguous data into usable data sets that can be analyzed to extract insights and improve business processes
• Collaborates with appropriate parties within the organization to integrate new data sources into our existing data infrastructure

Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers
• Collaborates with team members across the organization to identify and understand business problems and processes
• Develops analytical and reporting solutions to solve business problems and extract insights
• Develops and supports enterprise-wide strategies, processes, and standards for business intelligence and reporting
• Collaborates in cross-functional teams to implement analytical solutions
• Presents analysis effectively to audiences across the organization

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science plus 2 years technical experience in analytics, data science, actuarial or equivalent quantitative field or Master’s degree in similar quantitative field.

Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability and willingness to continuously acquire new knowledge (business domain knowledge, expertise with software, etc.). Ability to communicate effectively, especially in a cross-functional team setting. Ability to effectively present analysis to ICW staff and external audiences. Ability to multi-task effectively and work well with others in a team environment.

Proficiency in SQL. Experience with SAP Business Objects BI tools (Webi, Crystal, Explorer, Dashboards, etc.). Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques preferred but not required. Experience programming in R and/or Python preferred but not required. Exposure to a data visualization tool such as Tableau is preferred but not required. Familiarity with business operations in the property casualty insurance industry is preferred, but not required.
title: Data Analyst

description:
We are a small, entrepreneurial San Francisco-based quantitative investment firm looking for an addition to our research staff, ideally a PhD-level engineer, statistician, physicist or data scientist. Candidates with a BS or MS will also be considered, albeit with a high hurdle in terms of past achievements.

This is an excellent opportunity for a proactive, highly motivated, and skilled individual to contribute to cutting-edge quantitative finance in in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. This is a full-time job with an immediate start date.

This individual will work primarily with existing research team, including 3 PhD’s and 2 MS’s, at present all engineers with finance experience. Duties include:

  • Manipulating large financial datasets, primarily in SQL and R, although experience in other languages is helpful.
  • Developing algorithms to automatically clean the datasets.
  • Examining company fundamentals, investor behaviors, and other quantitative signals with a view towards predicting forward stock market returns.
  • Building and enhancing our portfolio optimization tools, essentially programs that construct optimized portfolios given a set of individual stock return forecasts.
  • Proactively searching, in academic literature and elsewhere, for additional signals that can enhance our models.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please read carefully entire job description and provide all requested information listed below or we will not consider your resume.

Requirements

  • A fun individual with a positive attitude and friendly demeanor is a must.
  • Interest in finance / hedge funds and able to work in a fast paced and demanding environment.
  • An engineering or scientific degree, preferably with a good dose of statistics. This is a highly quantitative role and you need to know the math.
  • Advanced degrees are preferred, particularly PhD’s. Ultimately, this is research as well as development, and demonstrated research acumen is a must.
  • Stellar academic performance. While we don’t hire solely on your GPA, we do find it to be an interesting data point in the process.
  • Outstanding programming skills. Enough said.
  • Training in finance and accounting is helpful, but not an absolute requirement. We can teach a programmer finance much more easily than we can teach a financier programming.
  • Must exhibit high energy level and be excited to work hard, as days can last 10+ hours
  • Very bright and quick learner; able to work effectively with a diverse team
  • Strong work ethic, diligent and meticulously detail-oriented
  • Ability to maintain discretion and confidentiality
  • A “do whatever it takes mentality” with a collaborative attitude.

Compensation: This is a paid position. We offer a competitive compensation package commensurate with experience.

Please apply with all of the following information:

  • Resume (word or pdf only)
  • Brief cover letter (word, pdf or Indeed-Format)
  • GPA figures
  • SAT scores or equivalent, if applicable
  • U.S. working status
