title: Software and Analytics Scientist

description:
At Aspera, an IBM company, our unwavering mission is to create the next-generation software technologies that move the world’s largest files and data sets at maximum speed, regardless of transfer distance and network conditions!! Our software helps companies in industries such as media & entertainment, life sciences and oil and gas produce and stream movies and entertainment, collaborate on new drug discoveries, and search for new sources of energy.

A pioneer in the enablement of high-speed, data-intensive workflows throughout the enterprise, Aspera has unlocked the Cloud for Big Data with high-performance digital transport and cutting edge transfer services available as a service on demand. Globally, we focus on supplying innovative data transfer solutions that help organizations operate and collaborate more effectively on a much larger scale.

At the root of Aspera’s success lies the patented, Emmy® award-winning FASP™ technology. This highly efficient bulk data transport technology is unique and core to all Aspera high-performance file transfer software. Fused into Aspera’s DNA, our philosophy of innovation is always top of mind with our team, and integral to the software products that fuel the company’s consistent and rapid growth.

We are currently seeking a Sr. User Experience Design/Researcher for our Emeryville, CA. office. This role will help impact the future direction and the current design of our products. The objective of this position will support our challenges in the product design and direction. This role will help discover what our customers and our users need from our products through formative research, exploring the desires and behaviors of our end-users, customers and other key stakeholders. You will also help verify assumptions and requirements of our end users. The bar is high for this role as it is a high impact position that few organizations offer today. As a Design-Researcher, you will also take a secondary role in product design and should be familiar with prototyping and wireframing techniques.

As a leader in User Research, you will help mentor the team, help develop best practices and processes. You will work directly with the product leaders to take Aspera Software to the next level in their design and product evolution. The ideal candidate must have excellent communication and presentation skills. In addition, they must have a strong foundational knowledge and experience with the complete set of UX research tools and possess the strategic knowledge of when to utilize these tools.

Responsibilities:
  • Conduct targeted multi-level research with our customers and end-users. Research to inform the short-term needs as well as the long term vision of our platform;
  • Collect and integrate data into actionable directions;
  • Collaborate with designers, product leaders, engineers, and sales staff;
  • Assist with the design activities and own some areas of design;
  • Support a UX User Council program to encourage customer support in our UX efforts;
  • Understand how to integrate and research software requirements (business, technical, end user, etc.);
  • Communicate research findings into actionable information orally, through presentations, and/or wireframes.
Requirements:
  • BA/BS degree in HCI, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience;
  • Minimum of 5 years of work experience as a user experience researcher for a product or service organization;
  • Demonstrated strategic understanding of a broad range of User Experience methods and metrics;
  • Experience with usability evaluation methods;
  • Strong foundational knowledge of statistics and experiment design;
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills in interviewing a wide variety of stakeholders;
  • Ability to design user experiences;
  • Excellent leadership, communications and collaboration skills;

Preferred:
  • Master’s degree in HCI, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience;
  • Minimum of 5+ years of relevant work experience as a User Researcher;
  • Work experience primarily with technology organizations, not agencies;
  • Experience with platform products;
  • Experience with enterprise applications.
title: Aspera User Experience Design Researcher

description:
Position: Audience Analytics Analyst
Location: Newport Beach, CA

Who are we?
The Shipyard is a leading digital consultancy + agency with offices in Columbus, OH - New York, NY - Denver, CO - and Orange County, CA. We consult organizations at the highest levels on everything from digital transformation - to new business models - to national campaigns. Not only do we provide traditional agency services - we also build many of our own proprietary products in areas like user level tracking (DMP) - attribution - data activation - and multi-site analytics. We have deep partnerships with the many of the leading ad tech companies to provide us access to media inventory across ever channel. The organizational environment at The Shipyard is collaborative, innovative, and fast-paced. We’re currently working on some of the toughest problems in marketing; including first-to-last-touch data collection, custom audience clustering methodologies, attribution modeling, and marketing automation. Our work is seen all over the country (and the world) - and the things you do here will have a huge impact on what people see across mediums like the web, TV, Internet Radio, and mobile. The Shipyard provides a rare opportunity to work on both difficult, interesting problems - and have your work seen by millions. We’re looking for people with great technical ability - but also have a creative streak (this is a creative business after all). Who can come up with unique solutions to problems - and love to work with other aspirational people.

Responsibilities
Develop audience insights from large data sets to drive actionable recommendations
Deliver Advanced Analytics such as look-alike/act-alike modeling, closed loop analysis, lift analysis and a/b/multivariate testing
Use our current DMP solution to identify new audiences to target - and activate those segments in our Media Channels
Analyze systems, processes and data flow, and recognize patterns and areas of inefficiency and opportunity
Perform ad-hoc and regularly planned analytics assignments and projects in support of our clients and agencies
Interpret campaign performance, including media, creative, strategy and landing page, while providing creative insights and solutions to meet campaign needs
Deliver insights and interact with Client, as needed
Complete, supervise, and assist in media campaign reporting and analysis
As the primary owners of the campaign dataset, oversee the development and utilization of campaign analytics tools
Assist in the definition of new tools, opportunities or enhancements for integration efforts to improve the value of the marketing analytic dataset
Be a pioneer in how disparate data sets can be used in the activation of media - even when the data isn’t “media” data

Qualifications
Knowledge of audience management tools (Data Management Platforms) like Adobe Audience Manager, Krux, Lotame, or Google Audience Manager.
Familiarity with video advertising and related metrics
Fundamental knowledge of online media metrics and analysis (Impressions, clicks, bids, CTR, etc)
Mastery and love of numbers and analysis
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Business, Engineering, Math, or other analytic discipline
3+ years of related analytics experience
Ability to write clear and concise recommendations based on insights from raw data
Objective, reliable individual who can proactively run a project and get help when needed
Ability to prioritize and execute multiple projects and deadlines
Strong customer service mentality and proven experience
Ability to apply statistical analysis methods and techniques with the assistance of appropriate software tools
Knowledge of advanced analytics packages, including SAS, R, SQL, and expertise in Excel is preferred. We currently use R, SQL, and Excel.

Icing on the cake
Experience with JavaScript
Knowledge with visualization packages, including Tabelau, Datorama
Knowledge with advertising research packages, including Nielsen, Comscore
Familiarity with general IT and internet technologies
Familiarity with offline advertising metrics
Familiarity with business management and operation principles and concepts
Advertising agency, ad network or publisher experience

description:
Lay the groundwork for a dynamic future with an industry leader. At Kaiser Permanente, you'll forge lasting relationships with colleagues across the organization while enjoying the opportunity to grow your experience and hone your expertise on assignments that have real impact. Our interns have worked on everything from analyzing financial software and developing new marketing strategies, to designing mobile apps and helping clinicians improve care delivery. We want you to get the most out of your time here and will give you projects that challenge you to think freely, question thoroughly, and explore deeply.

Application Services Group owns the maintenance and operation of our applications once they've gone into production.
ASG activities includes:
•Production support

Disaster Recover (DR) currently collects data from different sources. Intern will help standardized how data is collected and reported. Looking to engage an intern who would be interested in documenting and developing IT operational reports and metrics, as well as other ad-hoc data gathering/coordination and analysis as needed.

• Contributing to a designated project or initiative to meet a KP business objective.

description:
Under supervision of the PI the incumbent will perform stereotactic surgeries (after training by fellows), implant chronic electrodes for recordings, train animals to perform operant tasks or social behaviors, and perform electrophysiology experiments using in vivo patch-clamp recordings on head-fixed animals. The incumbent will analyze data and perform statistics using different computerized data analysis routines, create figures for publications and help write manuscripts.
A.
1. Perform stereotactic surgeries involving anesthetized mice, implanting head-bars, lenses, cranial windows,
2. Training animals to perform operant, classical conditioning, and social type tasks.
3. Perform in vivo patch-clamp recordings
4. Perform in-vivo imaging experiments using miniaturized microscopes
5. Perform analysis, including statistical analyses, of data obtained from electrophysiological and imaging experiments.
6. Present and discuss obtained data during by-weekly data presentations
7. Generation of figures for paper
8. Help with writing manuscripts.
9. Participate in bi-weekly journal clubs, occasionally presenting a paper for discussion.
Occasional training of other students an lab personnel.

Job Qualifications M.S. degree in molecular biology, biochemistry, physiology, neuroscience, or related science strongly preferred. General knowledge of University procedures for ordering laboratory supplies & services. Demonstrate knowledge of standard laboratory equipment and supplies. Ability to learn to operate new laboratory equipment, as needed. Excellent organizational skills and record-keeping ability. Good communication skills and ability to work well with multiple individuals. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously with frequent interruptions. Good attention to detail. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to prioritize competing tasks and follow through with all of them without supervision. . Working knowledge of PC computersSkill in using Microsoft Word, Excel & Outlook and ability to learn new programs as needed

description:
Primary Responsibilities

  • Daily cash application.
  • Perform day to day credit & collections work activities for big box retail, dot.com, regional retail and distributors.
  • Analyze deductions and outstanding invoices to determine root cause and prepare appropriate documentation for resolution.
  • Proactively escalate issues to Supervisor.
  • Be proactive and innovative in recommending ideas to improve AR management processes including business to business invoice collections, deduction resolution, account reconciliations, and settlements.
  • Provide management with aging and status reports.
  • Work with Customer Service, EDI, and Warehouse on shipping and vendor compliance issues.
  • Work with Carriers to retrieve proof of deliveries timely.
  • Closely monitor customer web portals:
  • Review vendor compliance scorecard
  • Review open payables
  • Retrieve back up for deductions

Essential Skills

  • Strong analytical skills to identify the root cause of a deduction/compliance charge and effectively work with all resources available to resolve and prevent similar deductions going forward
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, and Word)
  • High degree of integrity and the ability to work with sensitive or confidential information
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Self-motivated, disciplined, and detail oriented
  • Extremely organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver high quality results on time
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills (especially the ability to listen)

Desired Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting/Economics/Statistics or commensurate level of directly related experience
  • 2+ years’ experience working with big box retail and/or Dot.Com customers’ accounts receivable, including invoice collections, deductions, and compliance charges
  • Video Game, Media and Entertainment industry experience
  • Experience using AR management and Credit and Collections software applications
  • Knowledge of Great Plains and EDI
  • B2B Customer service experience

Job Type: Full-time

title: A/R Analyst

description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Specializing in operational reporting and data analysis, the Control, Insights and Analysis (CIA) team provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We help the Google Marketing Solutions (GMS) Services Organization to provide outstanding customer service and drive smart business decisions. As a data-loving member of the team, you will provide analytical support for the most strategic projects within the Global organization.

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of small- and medium-sized businesses. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. Together, we create and implement business plans broadly for every type of small business.

Responsibilities
  • Analyze operations and develop insights and strategies for Global GMS Services, primarily focused on our online help properties (help center, in-product help, and user communities)
  • Manage all analytical aspects of multiple highly visible projects
  • Design, implement and automate dashboards and tools for global initiatives
  • Present regularly at an executive level and engage with stakeholders within the GMS organization
  • Build strong relationships both with GMS Services and with the Support PM/Eng organization

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree in a numerate subject (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Science, Engineering, etc.), or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with data analysis. Experience in database querying (SQL).

Preferred qualifications:
  • Experience in gathering/documenting requirements and recommending strategies for tool development
  • Experience in gathering requirements and recommending strategies
  • Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, research, and trends
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
  • Advanced data extraction skills using spreadsheet software, SQL or other scripting languages.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills (including at executive level)
title: Business Analyst, Control, Insights and Analysis (CIA)

description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Specializing in strategy planning, operational reporting, data insights and data analysis, the controls, insights, and analysts (CIA) team leverages big datasets, analytical tools, and business partnering to help the AdWords Global Customer Experience (GCE) Organization to provide world-class customer experience and to drive smart business decisions.

In this role, you'll provide thought leadership and problem solving to strategic planning projects. Working directly with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams, you will be the data driven voice on global projects with a focus on improving customer experience and increasing efficiency. You will utilize data and data analysis to build compelling strategy proposals and stay engaged helping regional leadership to execute on agreed plans.

Sales Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex and ever-evolving business runs smoothly. Experts in leading process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. They develop global initiatives and set high-level goals to improve productivity.

Responsibilities
  • Deliver insights and provide data based insights and recommendations on major projects and initiatives. Focus on delivering value to customers and stakeholders.
  • Operate seamlessly between being a business-savvy internal consultant and a technical business analyst.
  • Synthesize analytics requests from internal partners, adapt and prioritize based on bigger picture business problems.
  • Gather relevant data to conduct analysis and make strategic recommendations for the global AdWords GCE Organization.
  • Deliver compelling presentations of insights and recommendations to multiple levels of senior stakeholders.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Science, Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in management consulting, business operations or analytics environment.
  • Experience writing SQL queries and working with data sets.

Preferred qualifications:
  • MBA, or an MS or PhD in a quantitative field.
  • Experience with stakeholder management and ability to influence senior stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of statistics and data analysis including R programming or other statistical software packages.
  • Demonstrated problem solving capability.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills; effective verbal/written communication skills including presentation skills.

Summary

The Consumer Research Analyst position is responsible for supporting the comprehensive quantitative and qualitative consumer research processes within Sharp HealthCare to ensure all internal customers have access to meaningful data in a timely and useful manner. Key responsibilities include providing data analysis and interpretation as well as generating all standard reports for patient satisfaction, internal customer research and ad-hoc research initiatives. Adheres to strict timeline for generating and disseminating data at all levels of the organization and is responsible for providing updates to the system and entity report cards as well as the on-line patient satisfaction thermostat. Supports and maintains the patient satisfaction survey process, including the interface with external vendors/software products and internal information systems leaders. Utilizes Excel and other research tools for analysis and data interpretation. Supports all other aspects of Consumer Research and participates in team efforts to help coordinate events hosted by The Sharp University and The Sharp Experience as needed.

Sharp System Services have campuses located in the communities of Kearny Mesa and Serra Mesa and consist of the Spectrum location, the Ruffin Road location and Sharp Operations Center (SOC). These services include: Strategic Planning, Business Development, Information Technology, Compliance, Internal Audit, Legal, Risk Management and Insurance, Contracts, Human Resources, Facilities Management and Development, Clinical Effectiveness, Finance, Nursing, Systems Supply Chain Services, Marketing and Communications, The Sharp Experience and Sharp University.

title: Internet Media Data Analyst

description:
As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, Fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team merchandise by partnering with top leagues, clubs and soccer brands worldwide to offer the largest collection of timeless and timely gear from every pro and college team online, on your phone, in stadiums or on-site at the worldâs biggest sporting events. A top 50 Internet Retailer Company, Fanatics comprises the broadest online assortment by offering hundreds of thousands of officially licensed items via its Fanatics ( www.fanatics.com ), FansEdge ( www.fansedge.com ) and Kitbag ( www.kitbag.com ) brands, as well as the largest selection of sports collectibles and memorabilia through Fanatics Authentic ( www.fanaticsauthentic.com ). A multi-channel company, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), major media brands (NBC Sports, CBS Sports, FOX Sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs ( Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea, Manchester City). The company's in-venue and event retail portfolio includes the NBA, NHL, NASCAR, Wimbledon, Kentucky Derby, The Ryder Cup, Manchester City, Texas Longhorns, Pittsburgh Pirates and New Jersey Devils, allowing fans to experience a seamless shopping experience across online, mobile and physical store locations.

Job Description

At Fanatics, we are passionate about leveraging data to drive growth and operational efficiencies. We firmly believe in putting data at the forefront of delivering an engaging experience for our sports fans! Fanatics Inc. is looking for highly motivated individuals to join our Data Science and Engineering team. You will collaborate closely with engineering, PMs, cross functional business units and address a wide range of challenging problems using techniques from applied statistics, machine learning and/or data mining fields.

Job Requirements
  • Experience developing machine learning, NLP and statistical models for real-world problems using ML algorithms/packages, R, Python or other machine learning/statistical software.



  • Strong algorithmic thinking and passion for empirical research to answer hard questions.



  • Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Information Retrieval and/or Personalization/Recommendation techniques.



  • Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis, analytic approaches and findings in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.



  • Designing and evaluating A|B experiments and monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics.



  • Working knowledge of big data processing technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Pig and Spark.



  • Ability to use SQL to perform data analysis.



  • Have a BS/MS/PhD in Statistics, Applied Math, Operational Research, Computer Science or related field.
title: Data Scientist

description:
Roche Diagnostics has recently created a new start-up business to bring together complex diagnostic and treatment data from medical devices and healthcare IT systems to improve patient care and accelerate the development of new therapies. We are looking for candidates with strong expertise in healthcare IT and the ability to operate in a fast paced environment to join our team and contribute to this exciting initiative.

Position summary :

The Data Scientist, Research Platform provides technical guidance to a highly collaborative team of software developers and scientists in medicine and biology to tackle new multimodality diagnostic data integration challenges and support the development of new therapies. She/he leverages a broad expertise in data science, machine learning, and related tools and methods, to initiate, direct, and execute technology assessments, proof-of-concept activities, and support the development of a new decision support platform for research and translational applications.

Key responsibilities :
  • Serves as subject matter expert on the application of data science and machine learning methods to analyze multimodality diagnostic data in support of drug development applications
  • Conceives, prototypes and implements algorithms and software tools to solve complex data science problems driven by strategic business needs
  • Optimizes algorithms and platforms for efficiency, accuracy, and scalability
  • Keeps up-to-date with and assesses technology advances; tracks competitive landscape
  • Creates intellectual property on related topics
  • Partners with research and development teams within Roche Diagnostics and Roche Pharma; networks with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. pathologists, biologists, oncologists) and subject matter experts in the Roche group and in academia, to drive the data analytics roadmap of the project

Who you are:

You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where the job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
  • Who you are You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
    Minimum Qualifications:
    • Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or a related discipline
    • Related work experience in academia or industry and a track record of building practical solutions to complex healthcare related data science problems
    • Proven track record of publications and/or intellectual property generation from own work
    • Emerging leader in the field through performance and accomplishments
    • Ability to communicate effectively with very diverse and globally distributed cross-functional teams, and to convey complex technical topics and issues in layman’s terms
    • Keen attention to detail with proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
    • Fast learner and passion for building practical solution
    • Prior experience with digital imaging and bioinformatics is preferred
    • Knowledge of Matlab, R and Spotfire




  • Who we are At Roche, 91,700 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

    Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
title: Data Scientist - Research Platform

description:
At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians, data scientists and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies.

We’re looking for talented and passionate team players to join our fast-paced startup company. Specifically, we are looking for an exceptional Ph.D level candidate who has experience in Signal Processing and Data Analysis with a strong track record or extensive publication list and proven product development record in either academic or industry settings. If you want to help change the current paradigm of DNA sequencing and contributor to the GenapSys vision and goals this job is for you!

Responsibilities

  • Develop signal processing algorithms to extract information from many biomedical sensors
  • Develop DNA sequencing base calling algorithms
  • Develop DOE (design of experiments) for troubleshooting and failure mode analysis
  • Perform in-depth data analysis and present results and conclusions for characterization and modeling of a complex physical system on a chip
  • Present written and oral reports and proposals to peers and management
Required Qualifications

  • PhD level candidate in electrical engineering, computational biology, physics, mathematics, statistics.
  • 4+ years of experience either as a postdoc or in industry after receiving PhD degree.
  • Expert in signal processing algorithm development.
  • Expert in Matlab, C/C++ .
  • Working knowledge of regression analysis, statistical estimation and signal detection theories.
  • Experienced in implementing clustering algorithms, PCA analysis and Markov models.
  • Familiar with data analysis and characterization of physical systems. Has the ability to model, simulate and validate dynamic systems.
  • Machine learning experience is a big plus.
  • Innovative, driven, results-oriented and methodical with a successful track record.
  • Detail oriented with strong documentation skills.
  • Strong team player who is flexible, adaptable and the ability to collaborate within a multidisciplinary organization.
  • Ability to manage work within tight timelines.
Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Anthem Blue Cross PPO and Kaiser Medical (including for dependents)
  • Excellent Dental and Vision through Guardian
  • Fully sponsored Life, Short and Long-term Disability insurance
  • FSA, 401(k) retirement plan
  • Stocked kitchen and beverages, daily catered gourmet lunches
  • Weekly Fancy High Tea and Happy Hours
  • Free complex onsite gym membership
  • Learning and growth opportunities
About GenapSys

At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimers, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour, and incubated over 6 years (2004-2010) at Stanford University. The company was incorporated in early 2010 and is funded by leading firms in both venture and institutional capital. We have built an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals – join our team and be part of the adventure!
title: Signal Processing & Data Analyst

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

Currently, we are working with large industrial partners helping them improve their existing production microbes. We are in contract and advanced discussions with a variety of Fortune 100 companies. Over time we expect to develop a large portfolio of our own products, ranging from drop-in replacements for existing chemicals to advanced materials to life-saving therapeutics â all generated from green, renewable raw materials.

Growing our business requires technical development work: to establish new molecular biological techniques, to move existing protocols to robotics workstations, and to create workflows that enable high throughput microbe engineering and evaluation.

Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring several Research Associates to drive bench-scale fermentation within the company. Immediate responsibilities include:

  • Weekly setup, running, and tear down of a bank of fermentors, including work in off hours
  • Prepare media and clean and sterilize equipment
  • Maintain and repair the fermentation systems and the supporting infrastructure as needed
  • Process samples in plate-based and HPLC assays in collaboration with the analytical chemistry team
  • Work with data capture systems to store data and metadata about the experiments
  • Use data analysis tools to understand process variations and manage process controls, and to identify microbes with improved performance
  • Collaborate with the microtiter plate based screening team to form the high throughput microbe screening pipeline
  • Collaborate with outside partners on transfer of technology between facilities
The fermentation capacity within the company is integral both for screening microbes in high throughput to identify those with improved performance as well as for transferring technologies between Zymergen and our partner organizations. We need members of our fermentation department to bring creativity and perseverance across a variety of large and small projects including installing equipment and establishing scalable processes. In addition, the Associate will be part of the foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

Qualifications/Experience
-------------------------

We are hiring candidates with a range of experience levels from junior to mid and senior scientists, along with a mix of backgrounds from engineering to microbiology. We favor candidates with a degree and experience in relevant fields (chemical engineering, bioengineering, microbiology, biochemistry), and with a history of success within an industrial setting.

We prefer Associates with experience in some or all of the following areas.

Equipment and SOP development:
  • Familiarity with a variety of bench scale fermentation units including those from Sartorius, DASGIP, Applikon and New Brunswick (Eppendorf)
  • Experience installing the physical infrastructure and establishing the support processes required to build out a fermentation capability
  • Understanding the basics of statistics including JMP, and the use of manufacturing practices such as control charts, Lean, and 5S
  • Expertise writing and validating SOPs for fermentation and fermentation-related processes
Chemical engineering and microbiology:
  • Experience with a variety of microbes (bacteria, yeasts, filamentous fungi), a variety of fermentation processes (aerobic, microaerobic, and anaerobic), and a variety fermentation products (proteins, small molecules)
  • Familiarity breaking down processes and equipment to identify sources of contamination or variation
  • Attention to detail to execute complex fermentation processes with minimal deviations
  • Understanding of associated processes like analytical chemistry, microtiter plate-based growth and production, lab support services, LIMS, etc.
Previous experience in the field of synthetic biology is not essential.

Our facilities are located in the San Francisco Bay Area.

------
title: Research Associate, Fermentation

description:
Note: Not all unique aspects of the job are covered by this job description

JOB PURPOSE:
Interprets, monitors, and analyzes information regarding policies, procedures, demographics, and operational outcomes yielding actionable information to guide decisions in wide-ranging areas. Provides related consultative services. This level performs under minimal supervision includes both routine and challenging assignments; this is differentiated from Level 2 based on the smaller impact and visibility of findings involved (e.g.: an academic program might be changed; explore the use of staggered work hours and work from home options as a means of decreasing in and out bound traffic to the campus during peak hours).

Researches, develops, and optimizes predictive models using data science, machine learning, and statistical inference techniques for advanced analytics across procure to pay such as spend analytics, savings prediction, and business expense analysis. Sources and acquires data both internally and externally needed to build predictive algorithms.

CORE DUTIES*:
  • Answer questions by developing research methodology, gathering data and/or using appropriate statistical techniques on available data.
  • Drive collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources; apply and use algorithms or other advanced techniques to accomplish this.
  • Fully analyze the problem, question existing processes and assumptions, gather data and information, find and evaluate alternative solutions, and propose best course of action.
  • Explore data from multiple angles, determine meaning behind the data, and recommend ways to apply the data.
  • Communicate, convey, and visualize informed conclusions and recommendations across an organization’s leadership structure in a manner to “tell the story” behind the data and influence how organization approaches the challenge.
  • May interact with and influence senior leaders, faculty, and/or senate with written summaries and/or presentations on assigned research.
  • May delineate the information to be gathered, collect data at the project inception, prescribe how to structure the data, and specify the data warehousing structure for future access.
  • Through data, may predict what actions will be taken in a designated timeframe for a prescribed issue/challenge.
  • May need to collaborate with other organizations to gather data. Proactively seek and locate data, including outside benchmarks or comparative data, to support or refute proposed decisions.
  • - Other duties may also be assigned
Qualifications

Education & Experience:
Bachelor degree in a relevant technical field and four years’ extensive experience or combination of education and relevant technical field experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.

Preferred education with Master degree and experience in data science, machine learning, statistics, computer science, or other related fields.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Proficiency in manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
  • Extensive experience in and strong passion for empirical research and answering hard questions with data.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills to positively convey findings and influence senior leadership & faculty.
  • Demonstrated experience querying, processing, analyzing, and reporting on large data sets.
  • Ability to use data retrieval and manipulation tools such as SQL, Brio Query, Business Objects, etc.in conjunction with visual data tools to present data clearly to non-technical audiences.
  • Familiarity and experience with intermediate statistical methods; advanced proficiency with statistical tools such as SPSS, SAS, R or similar tools.
  • Ability to tell stories with data using data visualization software such as Tableau, Excel, SPSS, or similar software in conjunction with strong verbal ability.
  • Ability to use visual data tools to present data clearly to non-technical audiences.
  • Flexible analytical approach allowing for results at varying levels of precision.
  • Familiarity with strategic planning concepts.
  • Excellent project management skills.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Expertise in developing innovative and scalable advanced analytic techniques, tools, and platform to visualize, monitor, and optimize performance of impactful metrics.
  • Ability to build and optimize predictive analytic models leveraging data science -- machine learning, data mining, statistical inference, etc.
  • Experience in leading the research and development of machine learning and predictive models such as classification, multivariate regression, clustering, anomaly detection, support vector machine, and neural network.
  • Hands-on developing text mining algorithms utilizing NLP, semantic modeling, contextual analysis, etc.
  • Ability to translate unstructured, complex business problems into abstract analytical and mathematical framework and solutions.
  • Ability to analyze analytics requirements and recommend solutions, techniques and metrics to minimize false positive.
  • Experience in various programming languages -- Python, R, Java, or SQL.
  • Proficiency in statistical analysis tools such as NLP, Text Mining, Matlab, or SAS.
  • Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing framework -- Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Pig, Hive, NoSQL, MongoDB, Data Warehouse.
  • Expertise in software engineering and data analysis principles and skills working on Windows/ Unix/Linux operating systems, Version Control and Office software.
  • Ability to understand and apply the software development lifecycle.
  • Ability to lead, mentor, motivate and supervise technical staff.
Certifications and Licenses:
None

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
  • Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.
  • Frequently sit, sort, file paperwork or parts, grasp lightly, and use fine manipulation, lift, carry, push and pull objects that weigh 10 pounds or less.
  • Occasionally write by hand, twist, bend, stoop and squat.
  • Rarely stand, walk, reach or work above shoulders and use a telephone.
  • - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • May work extended hours during peak business cycles.
WORK STANDARDS:
  • Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
  • Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
  • Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University’s Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.

title: Data Scientist 1

description:
Your goal – to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through Data Science, NLP and Machine Learning.
The organization: Graph and Modeling
Data Science and Machine Learning are core to Chegg: as a Student Hub, we want to ensure that students discover how things get connected – from a course they take to a skill they acquire to a career they pursue. To create the most relevant and engaging interaction, we are solving a multitude of ML problems so that we can better model student experience, link various types of content and provide a personalized experience.
The role: Staff Data Scientist – Machine Learning
The Staff Data Scientist focusing on Natural Language Processing will use natural language processing and machine learning expertise to define, design and develop text processing solutions at Chegg. You will lead in identification and implementation of key projects to link various types of content and facilitate knowledge discovery. You will partner with the analytics and data engineering teams to deliver production-ready tools and packages.

Responsibilities:
Develop adaptable NLP solutions including text categorization, domain classification, entity extraction and linkage, event detection, text preprocessing to improve Chegg products and services
Identify and prioritize NLP projects for the company use cases
Identify key evaluation metrics and release requirements for NLP products within Chegg
Integrate new data and design workflows
Innovate, share and educate team members and community

Requirements:
MSc. or PhD. in computer science, engineering, statistics, computational linguistics
7 + years of experience in machine learning, natural language processing, information retrieval, signal processing, recommendation systems
Text mining: relation extraction, pattern detection, named entity recognition, semantic role labeling
Topic modeling, clustering and classification
Acquiring natural language resources
Domain-specific language modeling
Strong programming skills in Linux/Unix scripting/Python/R/Java/Scala
Hands-on experience with NLP / IR tools and libraries (e.g. NLTK, SOLR, CoreNLP)
Experience using Big Data platforms (Hadoop/Mahout, Spark/MLlib) for NLP
Experience building production-ready systems and/or developing text processing solutions for company-wide use
Ability to think about problems from a data perspective, establish conceptual connections to data sources, understand relationships among data, see the forest and the trees, be comfortable with uncertainties/approximations.
Designing evaluation tasks for data science products, crowdsourcing
Excellent communication skills, curiosity and sense of humor

description:
Requisition 35447

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs ( www.zaplabs.com ) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogy’s world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogy’s leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogy’s other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Junior Data Scientist

You’re a recent graduate with the right skills, maybe some internship experience, or just significant academic
experience in data science / data modeling disciplines and looking to learn more. You’re a self-described data geek
and love finding patterns in large data sets to discover the signal from the noise. You are a strong independent
worker and group collaborator and can communicate your ideas thoroughly with evidence-based perspectives.
You enjoy being part of a fast-paced environment and can effectively balance pragmatism and perfection to deliver
valuable insight at speed.

Responsibilities:
You’ll join ZapLabs’ Data Science & Engineering team, working closely with product managers, engineers, and
ZapLabs’ leadership team to provide insights and analyses that drive product strategy, innovation, and adoption.
Our consumer products include highly rated and trafficked iOS, Android, mobile web, and web apps for home
buyers and sellers while our Business Products consist of an industry-leading CRM for real estate professionals.
You will be responsible for everything from working closely with a development team to analyze the performance
of a new feature to improve predictive algorithms for predicting lead conversion. Your work will sometimes
turn into a directly productized feature, resulting in a new dataset on our products for our millions of real estate
consumers. Other times, your work will form the foundation of internal KPIs to improve our business operations.
Most importantly, you’ll be expected (and encouraged) to learn quickly, make some mistakes, develop some
solutions, and make big contributions!

Skills, accomplishments, or interests you should have:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Pursuing a BS/BA/MS/PhD in a related discipline or equivalent of education and experience
  • Excellent analytical thinking, problem solving, organizational, and time management skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Enthusiasm and experience manipulating and cleaning large data sets
  • Gained valuable experience using R and/or Python for scientific computing
  • Proficiency in or willingness to learn SQL
Nice to haves:
  • Contributed to and breathed in an agile development environment
  • Experience/knowledge in data-mining languages/tools e.g. Python, R, SAS, Stata, SPSS, Excel
  • Experience/knowledge in probability, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing
  • Extensive LOTR or Star Wars knowledge
Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of usâand we're just getting started. Come join a diverse and collaborative team of researchers who work directly with product design to make the best social platform for Facebook's billion users. Our work ranges from formative to evaluative, ethnography to live experiments and involves collaboration between qualitative and quantitative researchers. For this position, we are looking for people with strong skills in behavioral data analysis, experimental and survey research, and statistics.

The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about UI design, passionate about social computing, comfortable in a flat, fast moving organization, excited to collaborate, and focused squarely impacting the design of Facebook. Work closely with product teams to identify research topics
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs
Conduct research using a wide variety of quantitative methods, and interpret analysis through the lens of UX, HCI, and social science
Collaborate closely with qualitative researchers
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
Partner with engineers, analysts, and other technical roles to create and share research
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways MS/PhD, human behavior related field preferred (HCI, Psychology, Social Science, Information Science, etc.)
3+ years of experience in applied product research
Experience working with large scale data in multi-method studies
Experience with applied statistics
Experience coding, PHP, SQL and Python preferred
Experience with survey design and response effects
Understanding and appreciation of qualitative and user-centered design methods preferred
Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful questions
Ability to communicate complex analysis and results compellingly to a lay audience As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.

title: Analyst

description:
The Analyst will be responsible for developing the reporting and executing queries to support data requirements across the entire program. The analyst will be working with multiple business organizations at Humana, as well as external partners, so they need to have good oral and written communication skills. This role requires intimate knowledge of both Medicare and Clinical systems and data tables. It’s a requirement that the associate knows how to create queries using data tables from multiple business areas. Additionally, the individual will need to rely on other business areas for data requirements.

You will run reports/extracts, creating queries from a variety of data sources and databases to pull specific information and collect multi-faceted data, analyze the information, validate report outputs and make recommendations which drive decision making.

Complete routine dashboard and reporting reviews to identify potential process gaps and performance trends.

You will also provide a level of business acumen to ensure that the results are correct based on various data validation tests and approaches.

Ensure that alignment of data definitions and consistency of data sources for teams reports are aligned with operational and compliance metrics, as well as executive dashboards.

Continuously improve and implement enhancements to all processes.

Work closely with IT teams to plan and provide oversight to the report configuration and workflow management of each report with the market and functional business teams.

Work with Business Areas and Markets to continually improve reporting and enhance capabilities needed to perform the required analysis.

Perform specific analyses to support business decisions.

Provide routine and ad hoc analyses of forecasted versus actual and year over year results.

Qualifications

Role Essentials

Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Data Mining, or any discipline involving analysis and programming.

Experience analyzing and presenting complex data and proven problem solving abilities.

Data analysis experience.

Detail oriented and process and systems thinker.

Excellent organizational skills required.

Excellent written and oral communication skills required.

Complete proficiency in Advanced Microsoft – Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.

Knowledge of SQL programming.

Role Desirables

Graduate degree in a Healthcare, Health Technology, Informatics discipline, or a related quantitative discipline

Experience with reporting/business intelligence tools against large databases, such as Qlikview, SAS, SSRS and Access

Knowledge of VBA programing

Knowledge of healthcare and/or medical, pharmacy and clinical data a significant plus

Prior experience within the healthcare industry.

Reporting Relationships:
You will report to a Manager.

At Humana, we know your well-being is important to you, and it’s important to us too. That’s why we’re committed to making resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life. If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana.

description:
The position will be in statistical and analytical research. This individual will serve as a research assistant for the Department of Medicine Statistics Core (DOMStat). Major duties include correspondence, preparation of statistical presentation and summary (e.g., tables and graphs), assisting faculty and staff members with data management related tasks (set up databases, basic level of programming in SAS, etc.), maintenance of faculty members' biosketches and curriculum vitae, preparation of official documents (assisting with the preparation of grant applications and IRB submissions), formatting manuscripts, and compiling literature reviews. Additional duties include working as a head database programmer for the RedCap and standardizing forms across many projects.

Job Qualifications Bachelor's degree plus 1-3 years of related experience in a health care, research, or educational environment. Knowledge of CTSI and experience entering ticket information accurately using the TSS system. Ability to perform duties and tasks independently with minimal supervision. Ability to take initiative and follow through independently on projects. Ability to maintain confidentiality with participant-related data. Prior experience in handling a variety of tasks with a high degree of accuracy (multitasking) and ability to set priorities when confronted with competing requests. Ability to meet tight deadlines and last minute requests efficiently and accurately. Skill in analyzing information, problems, situations, policies or procedures to define the problem, need or objective, identify relevant issues or concerns, formulate alternatives for resolution or new program development, and recommend alternative choices and implications for implementation. Knowledge of HTML code. Data extraction, transformation, analysis and presentation of quantitative data from administrative and research databases.

Preferred: Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with other staff members and faculty. Strong problem solving skills. Flexibility and adaptability in dynamic environment based on changing priorities and frequent interruptions. Ability to seek appropriate staff and other resources when questions regarding format, illegible writing, or office procedures arise. Skill in analyzing information, problems, situations, policies or procedures to define the problem, need or objective, identify relevant issues or concerns, formulate alternatives for resolution or new program development, and recommend alternative choices and implications for implementation. Ability to maintain and track databases, and assist with other data related activities, as appropriate for the project.

description:
Natural Language Processing & Machine Learning Scientist

Do you love natural language and believe that getting machines to use it the same way humans do is the most interesting thing one can do? Are you experienced at applying machine learning (ML) to sophisticated natural language processing (NLP) tasks? Are you excited to solve difficult problems in human-computer communication, machine translation, question-answering, knowledge base construction and querying, natural language understanding, natural language generation, search, and multi-modal modeling while applying the latest algorithms and techniques? Are you comfortable operating with large data sets? Do you like finding solutions to problems before others can even articulate what those problems are?

A recently opened R&D; center in Los Angeles has multiple positions available for NLP&ML; scientists at all career stages from graduating doctoral students to internationally renowned researchers and practitioners. We are looking for top scientists capable of using the latest natural language processing and machine learning algorithms and techniques to design and implement state-of-the-art solutions for problems that have never been solved before.

At Amazon, we solve many of Amazon's most difficult and important problems, and in partnership with teams across Amazon, we build new services that surprise and delight our customers. We have current and future projects in language understanding, conversational agents, machine translation, search, question-answering, deep learning, and more.

Machine learning and natural language processing at Amazon are highly experimental activities grounded in sound theoretical analysis and innovation with a purpose. Our natural language processing and machine learning scientists work closely with software engineers to put algorithms into practice. They also work on cross-disciplinary efforts with social scientists, economists, computer vision experts, and others.

If interested please apply directly online via this posting and our recruiting department will review your profile.

description:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for translating client needs into engaging reports and visualizations to support in-depth analysis. This position will also collaborate with key stakeholders to develop reports, dashboards, and other visualizations for analysis into possible trends or correlations to other data sets from competing clients. The successful candidate will be highly analytical with the ability to collect, organize, and disseminate significant amounts of information.

The position is located in Irvine, CA.

Essential Functions:

  • Analyze large sets of raw data using various analytical tools (MSSQL Server, Teradata, R, Python,Tableau, or Domo) to create reports and charts that could lead to insights on ecommerce consumer buying behavior for our brand manufacturer clients.
  • Collaborate with the Client Management team to thoroughly understand business objectives and determine types of data required to create informative and actionable reports to our clients.
  • Analyze competitive information to inform leadership and make recommendations in support of strategic decisions to increase our software service offerings.
  • Prepare and effectively present your findings to the Client Management team, including executive management in a concise fashion.
  • Generate ad hoc analysis and reports as requested.

Required Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics.
  • 5 plus years’ experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and trend analysis with various forms of data, especially web analytics or e-commerce data.
  • 3 plus years’ proven track record of building innovative and interactive web-based data visualization reports and dashboards in a BI platform such as Tableau, Domo, JReport, QlikView, or Crognos.
  • 3 plus years of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, R, SAS, SPSS, etc.).
  • Ability to work independently as well as partner with cross functional teams.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver clear, concise information to leadership and partners.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience running A/B or and multi-variate tests
  • Big data analytics experience (Hadoop, Mongo, SQL)

description:
Would you like to be a part of the Milken Institute’s upcoming Global Conference? Join our team for a paid internship supporting our signature event by providing research and data support for several conference panels. By supporting the Milken Institute on-site during the week of Global Conference, this is also an excellent opportunity for interacting with business leaders and policymakers. For an example of the caliber of speakers at this event, see last year’s program .

The research interns are responsible for compiling data and material to support our mission and the work of our research group. The position requires a bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, or related subject area and an outstanding academic record. A master’s degree and knowledge of financial, health-related, and macroeconomic data are a plus. Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint is a must. Candidates should have strong organizational skills, great attention to detail, a strong interest in economic research, clear communication skills, and the ability to handle pressure in a demanding work environment. Other logistic and administrative tasks may be required. Research interns work closely with Milken Institute economists.

We are looking for team players who are smart, creative, organized, and who enjoy learning and applying their problem solving skills to a variety of topics.

The internship will begin in early April and last through the first week of May. At least 20 hours per week is preferred, with fulltime commitment required for the duration of the conference April 30 - May 3, 2017. An exceptional candidate will be considered for an additional period and will have an opportunity to contribute to several research projects that will be of interest to policymakers and business leaders worldwide. The position will be based in our Santa Monica, California office.
