description:
Saucey is a venture backed tech company based out of Los Angeles that is working on building the future of the $113B/yr retail alcohol industry, changing the way people drink. In short, Saucey puts a fully stocked bar in everyone’s pocket. We’ve created a simple, high-end experience that lets you buy beer, wine, spirits and have it delivered to you in 20-40 minutes. We also work with some of the largest brands in the world, helping them to connect with customers in ways never before possible.

How have we managed to do all of these things in an industry that hasn’t changed since the early 1900’s? We’ve built an incredibly talented team of ambitious problem-solvers, and people who think towards the future. As a result, demand for Saucey is at an all-time high and we’re looking for inspiring people to join our team.

As Director of Growth Marketing at Saucey your objective is to drive double-digit week-over-week growth at one of the most impactful startups in the world. That’s it, the rest is up to you ;)

Key Responsibilities
    • Manage all performance marketing across mobile and web: paid acquisition, conversion optimization, email and engagement, partner marketing
    • Work closely with Product to develop and build new features to drive to improve customer experience and engagement
    • Develop new acquisition, engagement and retention programs (e.g., Corporate program, subscription model)
    • Execute multi-city marketing campaigns
    • Run analytics to answer key strategic growth questions (e.g., what behaviors/demographics predict customer LTV)
    • Experiment constantly to identify and refine acquisition channels and optimized conversion funnels
Qualifications
    • 5-7 years of growth marketing experience with significant focus on product marketing, email marketing and paid advertising
    • Experience managing a growth organization at a fast-growing tech company (ideally a marketplace business)
    • Track record for managing marketing budget across multiple channels to over perform on acquisition and engagement goals
    • Proven ability to identify and test new channels
    • Effective at implementing and measuring channel success (cohort analysis, LTV)
    • Degree in quantitative discipline (CS, Engineering, Math, Economics, Statistics)
    • Expertise in Excel, SQL, SPSS and other analytical tools
Benefits
    • Competitive salary and stock option plan
    • 100% medical, dental and vision benefits
    • Fully Paid Vacation!
    • Whatever equipment you need
    • Awesome 3 story office in Weho
    • Amazing team and company culture
    • Work at a company with a huge vision, changing everything about one of the oldest industries in the world
title: Director of Growth

description:
About Bill.com

Bill.com is the leading business payments network, with over 1.1 million members paying and getting paid over $26 billion per year in volume. Bill.com saves companies more than 50% of the time typically spent on financial back-office operations by automating end-to-end processes. Bill.com ties together finance and accounting programs, banks, customers, vendors, accounting professionals, and documents. The company is the choice of three of the top 10 U.S. banks and over 50 percent of the top 100 accounting firms. The recipient of more than 43 awards, Bill.com was recently recognized as one of the San Francisco Business Time's Most Innovative Companies and proudly received a PC Magazine's Editor's Choice Award.

Mission:

We are looking for a talented, enthusiastic and dedicated person to join Bill.com’s Risk Management team. The incumbent will be responsible for leading key projects associated with predictive fraud detection, transaction risk modeling and loss mitigation at Bill.com. This position requires a person who has experience with developing machine learning models and performing analytics preferably in risk domain.

Professional Experience/Background to be successful in this role:

  • Minimum 5 years of industry experience in data science
  • An advanced degree (M.S., PhD.), preferably in Statistics, Physical Sciences, Computer Science, Economics, or a related technical field
  • Strong track record of performing data analysis and statistical modeling using SQL, SAS or similar tools
  • Mastery of a wide range of Machine learning techniques, tools, and methodologies with a demonstrated capability to apply them to a broad range of business problems and data sources
  • Machine learning techniques include clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, anomaly detection etc. * Ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical experts, business partners, and executives
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and yet able to steer analytics projects toward clear business goals, testable hypotheses and action-oriented outcomes
  • Desirable to have experience solving problems related to risk using data science and analytics
  • Experience with data visualization a plus

Competencies (Attributes needed to be successful in this role):

  • Functional/Technical Expertise
  • Values
  • Learning Abilities/Tech Savvy
  • Communication
  • Team Player

Expected Outcomes in 12 months:

  • Build and productionalize predictive models and fraud detection algorithms by utilizing advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or other data mining techniques
  • Utilize predictive models to build strategies that can address fraud mitigation and operations efficiency
  • Continuously evolve the models to improve the detection rates
  • Analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes related to anomaly detection and probability of fraud
  • Identify and evaluate new data sources to build effective fraud controls for online transactions
  • Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of decision systems and statistical models
  • Work with product and engineering team to evangelize data best practices, deploy models, and design/implement new analytical systems/frameworks
  • Design and measure A/B tests to optimize existing fraud and credit strategies

Bill.com Culture:

  • Humble – No ego
  • Fun – Celebrate the moments
  • Authentic – We are who we are
  • Passionate – Love what you do
  • Dedicated – To each other and the customer

Job Type: Full-time
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
2,500 Environmental Services staff. 20 technical specialties. 900 professional associations. An international team with local expertise. You could say we know a little something about the environment. Our passion for it drives our work. Grounded by safety, quality, and ethics, we come up with solutions that perfectly fit the site. We know what it takes to balance competing project interests with creativity and efficiency. We know what to look for. And, we know how to get the job done—the right way. Join a team that has the environment down to a science.

Your Duties: As a Junior Biologist based in the Sierra Nevada, you will work in a highly dynamic team environment with other biologists, ecologists, water resource specialists, and regulatory experts. Based in Nevada City, you will contribute to environmentally conscious infrastructure and recreation planning, as well as support a diverse array of projects throughout the state. This position will include opportunities for both field and office work. In the field, our biologists conduct surveys on foot, via kayak, and by helicopter. In this position, you would support more senior biologists conducting nesting bird surveys, special status species surveys, fisheries assessments, wetland delineations and tree surveys. Fieldwork may also involve construction-related environmental compliance monitoring and field support of ecosystem restoration projects.

In this position, you will contribute to multi-disciplinary project teams by executing field biology work throughout the Sierras and northern California and possibly beyond. As a junior biologist, you will provide support and expertise in field biology for baseline assessments, impact assessments and environmental permitting and compliance. Your specific background should consist of wildlife ecology and field survey expertise. Familiarity with regulatory permitting and compliance is a plus.

This position requires strong skills as a self-starter, with ability to balance work on multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and organizational skills are essential.

Our Biologists:
  • Are knowledgeable ecologists and respected scientists.
  • Demonstrate success with research, analysis, and reporting.
  • Are motivated, team-oriented professionals with excellent written and communication skills.
  • Are familiar with review and analysis of scientific data, maps, and drawings.
  • Provide support in delivering high quality work products to Stantec’s multi-disciplinary project teams.
  • Have the ability to identify opportunities and build relationships with clients.
  • Care about the environment and facilitating regulatory compliance.
  • Are extremely safety conscious.

Your Capabilities and Credentials: Basic Qualifications:
Education: BS in Biology, Environmental Science, Ecology, or other related field.
Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years
  • Must have a good driving record and valid driver’s license
  • Prior to employment with Stantec, this position will require the successful completion of a physical and drug screening.

Primary Skills:
  • Experience with and knowledge of the biota in the western intermountain, coast, and desert region of the U.S.
  • Experience performing various biological field surveys. Able to safely conduct field surveys and perform strenuous activities in variable, rough, and remote terrain, including streams and lakes under various weather conditions.
  • Experience with species listed under the Federal Endangered Species Act (ESA), California Endangered Species Act (CESA), and California special status species is a plus.
  • Demonstrated technical competence in baseline biological data collection, including use of a GPS.
  • Experience conducting nesting bird surveys.
  • Experience contributing to biological technical reports, environmental impact evaluation, siting reports, or environmental permit applications, including field surveys and reporting or resource and impact evaluations and documentation.
  • Self-motivated and team-oriented.
  • Adept at data entry and excel-based data analyses.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Willingness to travel for field survey work.

Preferred Qualifications:

Education: Bachelors or Master’s degree in Biology, Environmental Science, Ecology, or a related field
Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years

Primary Skills:
  • Northern California-based biological field survey experience. Key species surveys include nesting migratory birds, western pond turtle, foothill and/or Sierra Nevada yellow-legged frog, California red-legged frog, California tiger salamander, anadromous fish, giant garter snake, salmonids, and small mammals, among others. Additional southern California and Nevada-based biological field survey experience a plus.
  • Knowledge and experience of state and federal wildlife protection regulations and guidelines for listed species.
  • Familiarity with the Migratory Bird Treaty Act and experience conducting point count and nesting bird surveys. California and Nevada avian species familiarity beneficial.
  • Experience serving on and/or leading teams of field scientists for biological surveys in California.
  • Water quality field data collection experience.
  • Experience performing aquatic resource studies and delineations.
  • Experience conducting environmental monitoring (baseline monitoring and environmental compliance monitoring).
  • Possession of a state [Scientific Collecting/MOU] or federal permit [10(a)1(A)] for listed species.
  • An understanding of biology-related concepts associated with the California Environmental Quality Act and National Environmental Policy Act.
  • An understanding of environmental permitting in California including: US Army Corps of Engineers Clean Water Act Section 404 waters of the US permitting, Regional Water Quality Control Board Clean Water Act Section 401 Water Quality Certifications, California Department of Wildlife DFG Code Section 1600 et seq. Streambed Alteration Agreements, CESA permitting, and other environmental permitting.
  • Established, respected relationships from local, state, and federal permitting agencies a plus.
  • General understanding of GPS - based data collection and GIS analyses and mapping.
  • Experienced in using ArcGIS, statistics programs such as “R”, Excel, Word, and Powerpoint for data analyses, report writing, and presentations.
  • Ability to work independently, as well as in teams ranging from two to 60 staff.
  • CPR and Wilderness First Aid Certification a plus.
title: Junior Biologist

description:
You will provide strategic, analytical, and audit support for HRIS and Compensation activities. You will use your business acumen and technical knowledge to develop and deliver solutions for our internal customers. You will work with various HR functions, Global Compensation, Global Benefits, Staffing and HRBPs in understanding and auditing their various feeds into payroll, compensation, and applicant tracking systems.

This Position Reports to: Compensation Manager

Responsibilities:
  • Oversee the audit function to ensure compliance with all payroll dependencies
  • Responsible for validating all reports from Human Capital Management System (HCMS)
  • Ensures HCMS records are updated and reports on any matters of interest
  • HCMS reporting and analysis
  • Collect and gather data through HCMS dependencies (ICIMS)
  • Data mining and analyzing of trends
  • Collaborate with manager and with teams across the business unit
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and troubleshoot functional and technical issues by providing preventative solution
  • Identify solutions to improve our data integrity and find more efficient ways of making mass changes
  • Test systems and processes that impact managers and employee self service
  • Ensure systems meet compensation needs and are updated to reflect changes to jobs, salary structures, bonus programs, etc.
  • Audit and approve job requisitions based on compensation guidelines
  • Prepare and audit monthly new hire equity reports, including managing the grant approval process
  • Complete quarterly and annual compensation surveys based on current employee data
  • Assist with compensation market analysis reporting
  • Ad-hoc reporting and insights request

Qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree in, Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math or other technical fields
  • 2 years of work experience in a role that leveraged data analytics (strategic planning, management consulting or analysis)
  • Experience with data modeling
  • MS Excel Proficient
  • Experience working with datasets and in using business intelligence
  • Genuine excitement and passion for developing and analyzing large, complex data sets and converting them into the information/insights that drive business decisions at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to project manage by identifying key deliverables and milestones, and work with business stakeholders independently
  • Demonstrable organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities
title: Business Analyst - CONTRACTOR

description:
About IHS Markit
IHS Markit harnesses deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk.

Headquartered in London, IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth.
_______________________________________________________________

IHS Markit is seeking a Market Research Analyst to assist industry analysts and research managers in covering technology and market trends in IT, networking, and telecoms. It is a dynamic position focused on providing support for a broad range of primary and secondary research projects, working as part of a research operations team and reporting to the Senior Researcher.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned.

Support the development of market research, including market share, size, and forecast reports and surveys, by manipulation of large amounts of quantitative and qualitative data.
Create and update high-quality deliverables for our clients using advanced Excel skills: pivot tables, charts, advanced formulas, and conditional formatting.
Enter data into Excel workbooks, update written reports, and review data for accuracy.
Conduct web research on activity and financial data of telecom service providers, and write short summaries of vendor announcements.
Summarize data, design and test questionnaires for service provider and enterprise surveys.
Use and maintain databases to retrieve and analyze data for accuracy and validity.
Create graphs and charts to present data to our clients in a clear, appealing, standardized way.
Perform other duties as assigned by manager.

COMPETENCIES:
Analytical skills: Synthesize complex and diverse information. Collect and research data. Use intuition and experience to complement data. Identify data relationships and dependencies.
Communication: Exhibit good listening and comprehension. Express ideas and thoughts verbally and in writing. . Use appropriate communication methods.
Planning and organizing: Prioritize and plan work activities. Use time efficiently. Plan for additional resources. Integrate changes smoothly. Set goals and objectives. Work in an organized manner.
Problem solving: Identify problems in a timely manner. Gather and analyze information skillfully. Develop alternative solutions. Resolve problems in early stages. Work well in group problem-solving situations.
Quality: Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness. Display commitment to excellence. Look for ways to improve and promote quality. Apply feedback to improve performance. Monitor own work and review colleagues’ work to ensure quality.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) in market research, economics, sociology, or statistics preferred
Two to four years of related experience
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
Experience in survey research (questionnaire design, survey programming, creating target contact lists, survey data analysis, and Qualtrics)
Commitment to excellence and high standards
Ability to work independently and as a member of various teams
Creativity, flexibility, innovativeness, and team player attitude
Ability to work on complex projects with general direction and minimal guidance

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS is a participant in E-Verify (see links below) . We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing.

description:
As a member of the data science team, you will develop and investigate hypotheses, structure experiments and build mathematical models to identify game optimization points that will encourage users to play our games more often, over longer periods of time, resulting in higher lifetime values. We are looking for a sharp, disciplined, and highly quantitative individual who has a passion for mobile gaming, data mining, and mathematical modeling. We are building a unique technology platform dedicated to the operation and real time optimization of free to play games. We are changing the gaming industry!

What you'll be doing:
    • Build mathematical models and automated machine learning tools to analyze and optimize all aspects of MZ games, providing actionable insights in real-time
    • Design and implement experiments to test various hypothesis
    • Work in a collaborative team environment with other highly skilled specialists in gaming, statistics, machine learning, and engineering
    • Influence development teams to implement tools, features and/or designs - success is measured in % monetizing, retention, time spent in the game, and lifetime value




Your background and who you are:
    • Bachelor's or higher in Applied Math, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. Graduate degrees preferred
    • 2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, specific experience with social games or mobile apps strongly preferred
    • Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability
    • Solid understanding of statistical modeling / predictive analysis/ machine learning / data mining / recommender system concepts
    • Familiar with R, Python or equivalent for data modeling and analysis
    • Familiar with SQL
    • Good presentation and communication skills
    • Ability to prioritize and track multiple projects in parallel

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of Californiaâs Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Provides Actuarial Dept with pricing support, calculating reserves, risk assessment/analysis, data reporting, financial forecasting/projections, creating filings and/or performing financial and risk analysis in changes to provider contracts in order to help BSC meet its goals of providing low-cost healthcare and meeting earnings objectives. Responsibilities: May perform a combination of the following depending on discipline/dept: - Conducts analysis, pricing and risk assessment to estimate financial outcomes. - Maintains and produces timely various standard analytic reports for internal and/or external use. - Analyses changes in provider reimbursement terms. - Calculates premiums, reserves and non-forfeiture values of new and existing plans of insurance. - Assists in preparing the actuarial portions of the financial statements and the federal income tax returns. - Compiles, evaluates and certifies statistical data. - Calculates premiums or reserves for new or existing products, and may perform research, experience studies and other statistical analyses. - Usually assigned to a line of bus or unit for analyzing loss and expense reserves, developing rate indicators, evaluating pricing levels, analyzing profitability and communicating results to more senior actuaries.

The Data Scientist analyzes statistics andinformation from multiple sources to spot trends and to gain maximum insightthat can help give iHerb a competitive advantage by using cutting agetechnology to make recommendations across our organization. Communicatesdata findings to both business and IT leaders to influence how an organizationapproaches and meets business challenges of an evolving customer base andchanging marketplace, using strong business acumen.

description:
JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Manager Service Delivery the Import Analyst will act as the primary client contact to ensure that proper information is provided for entries and adjustment documents. The IA is the primary support for the Client Service Team and to ensure accuracy and integrity of the client records/system (CAT). Duties will include ensuring that an effective relationship is maintained with the client at all times and ensuring that all entries are classified and billed accurately, on time and within standard to the customerâs complete satisfaction.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Builds and maintains direct relationship with the client and provides day to day contact and support.
  • Prioritize and complete work according to client demands, customs requirements and Livingston standards for release conditions and ensures compliance.
  • Create and proactively maintain the client tariff database, ensuring all associated system maintenance files/information are accurate and current in order to take advantage of data defaults for accurate quality output and one-step processing. Updates information as necessary.
  • Proactively verifies documentation.
  • Works directly with clients to obtain missing documentation, information and/or instructions.
  • Works directly with Customs and PGA's as necessary.
  • Provide technical expertise to team members.
  • Assists team members with on-the-job training.
  • Conduct periodic checks to ensure accurate application of tariff and valuation along with proper selection of client/importer information.
  • Responsible to conduct documented internal audit.
  • Assists Manager Service Delivery in compiling and reporting performance measurement statistics for the Client Service Team.
  • Participate fully with other team members in the day-to-day operations of the team, including setting priorities, organizing and scheduling work, coordinating with others, problem-solving and decision-making, participating in meetings and handling special projects.
  • Proactively coordinate and implement electronic data relationships to gain efficiencies and improve one-step processing.
  • Must keep abreast of new systems developments

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

  • High School Diploma
  • Customs Broker License or upon availability, enrollment in with successful completion of the NCBFAA Certified Customs Specialist Course.
  • 5 plus years Customs related experience

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • Fully conversant with Company policies and procedures, all applicable Customs laws, regulations, procedures and industry practices.
  • Full working knowledge of HTS with respect to general chapter notes, SPI rules, etc.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written).
  • Strong customer service orientation.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines.
  • Strong PC skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast pace environment and to handle large volume of work.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • El Segundo, CA

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

Required experience:

  • Customs: 3 years
  • Entry Writing: 2 years

description:
Uber Advanced Technology Group is the R&D; hub of Uber’s engineering team dedicated to self-driving technologies, mapping, and vehicle safety. This team is responsible for developing long-term technologies that advance Uber’s mission of bringing safe, reliable transportation to everyone, everywhere. We are ambitious, engaged and excited about transforming the way the world moves. Our research will make the process of moving real assets and real people safer and more efficient now, and in the decades to come.

Uber ATG UX Research Team is seeking experienced qualitative and mixed methods researchers to help us develop innovative new products and services related to self-driving cars and trucks.

This is a full-time position based in San Francisco, CA.

Responsibilities:
  • Design and conduct user research to evaluate new and current products, using both qualitative studies (field observations, interviews, & remote and in-person usability studies) and quantitative studies (experiments and surveys).
  • Identify and explore new opportunities before they make it onto the drawing board.
  • Collaborate closely with other researchers, designers, product managers, and engineers.
  • Adapt and innovate research practices to meet team needs under the tight timeframes of a rapidly growing company.
  • Synthesize and communicate research findings to inform business decisions.
  • Connect user insights to A/B experiment (live experiment) with measureable and actionable hypotheses.

Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 4 years of relevant user research experience in product environment. Demonstrable ability to plan and conduct mid-to-large scale research projects, in close collaboration with people in a variety of roles (we work in teams).
  • Deep understanding of the strengths and weakness of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
  • Scrappy, self-starter able to deliver results quickly with minimal oversight
  • Excellent working knowledge of statistics and principles of survey and experiment design, including sampling, data collection and analysis.
  • Ability to clearly, concisely and persuasively communicate research findings.
  • Willingness to travel 15% time.

Perks:
  • Employees are given Uber credits every month.
  • The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product you built. We’re not just another social web app, we’re moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally.
  • Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.
Benefits (U.S.):
  • 401(k) plan, gym reimbursement, nine paid company holidays.
  • Full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs.
  • Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it.

So, if y
ou’re a great researcher and communicator, comfortable in a high-velocity startup, and unafraid to push the limits, we’d love to talk with you.
title: User Experience Researcher, Uber Freight

description:
Recently voted Fast Company’s #1 Most Innovative Company in Education and #28 Most Innovative Company in the world, General Assembly is a venture backed, post Series C, NYC-based startup in our fourth year. General Assembly transforms creators into thinkers through education and opportunities in technology, business, and design. We offer classes, workshops, long-form courses, and events in worldwide markets including New York where we are headquartered, Atlanta, Austin, London, Hong Kong, Sydney, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, Melbourne and Washington DC.. We also partner with Fortune 500 companies to spur innovation through increased digital fluency and more effective approaches to collaboration.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are looking for a Data Scientist to teach our brand new full time class:

Our Data Science Immersive course is a brand-new, life-changing educational experience where students leave with the skills and mindsets to take on new careers as Data Analysts and Scientists. We are looking for an instructor to spearhead this transformation through leading General Assembly’s Data Science Immersive course.

Why Teach the Data Science Immersive?

If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by doing what you know and love, this is the position for you. Through this unparalleled opportunity, you will:

  • Deepen your own skills by guiding students through a rigorous journey where they begin as driven novices and leave as empowered data analysts and scientists
  • Facilitate a supportive and energetic community that lasts well beyond the course
  • Hone your own leadership skills by working with an instructional team and classroom community
Who are we?

General Assembly is a venture-backed, NYC-based startup focusing on education for individuals and enterprises in the areas of technology, design, and entrepreneurship. We currently have physical classrooms in 15 cities across 4 continents, with tens of thousands of students coming through our doors.

Skills and Qualifications

You have at least 2+ years of professional data science experience.

  • You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of data scientists.
  • You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
  • Must Haves:
  • You are an expert in SQL, Python and related Python libraries (pandas, numpy).
  • You have fluency in the following topics: statistics; manipulation of large data sets; data visualization techniques and tools such as Tableau, matplotlib; machine learning algorithms such as naive bayes, SVMs, decision trees, KNN, K-means clustering.
  • Nice to haves:
  • Familiarity with python libraries NLTK and sci-kit learn, Hadoop, Apache Spark, JavaScript, D3.js; R; Basket-weaving,.
  • You are on top of big data trends
  • You have previous data science or engineering teaching experience, through a course, team training, etc.
Responsibilities and Duties

  • 2 weeks of planning and curriculum development followed by 12 full work weeks (5 days a week) of teaching, planning and content development.
  • Work closely with two – three co-instructors to provide students with meaningful and prompt feedback on their progress.
  • Work alongside GA staff in order to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
  • Guide students through the development of stellar projects that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.
  • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.
  • Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning complex subjects
title: Data Science Instructor

description:
Job Descriptions:
Summary:
The Logistics Analyst is responsible for supporting the logistics operation of Soraa, Inc., including coordinating outbound/inbound shipments, freight invoice audit and managing logistics updates in SAP.

Responsibilities:
Work with freight carriers and Soraa’s 3 rd Party logistics provider on operations exceptions and freight movements.
Maintain records of SAP daily shipment details against sales orders.
Execute transactions and reports in SAP as required.
Work with service providers to improve data quality, reporting tools and business process.
Develop and maintain daily and monthly KPI statistics, collecting and managing data from external (carrier) as well as internal sources.
Utilize metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPls) to measure/optimize performance against service levels, rate competitiveness, stress points, volumes/routing, lead-times, etc.
Support the development of transportation budget reporting and long range planning
Work with key partners to identify requirements for importation of goods into new destinations.
Gather and organize required documentation from manufacturers needed for import procedures.
Work with internal/external customers along with key partners and vendors to meet project timelines and objectives; communicate clear project requirements and timelines.
Perform analytics on network design options to determine most efficient lane for transport of goods.
Support Shipping/Receiving functions as needed.
Assist with Customs and trade compliance issues.

Required Experience:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or a Minimum 5-7 years’ experience in logistics.
Thorough understanding of domestic and international logistics.
Knowledge of ERP systems, SAP preferred.
Experience with import and export control requirements.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, with particular emphasis on Excel.
Customer Service and problem-solving skills are a must.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal verbal and written communication skills.
Strong work ethic and attention to detail.
Candidate must be pro-active, highly motivated and goal-oriented.

title: Logistics Analyst

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

1. Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring a distinctive Scientist to develop techniques for high-throughput microbial strain culturing. The Scientist will join a team working in collaboration with partner companies to advance the tools and techniques applied to existing microbes used in large scale industrial fermentation. At Zymergen, the Scientist will work together with other scientists, automation engineers, and software engineers to develop micro-well plate scale models for microbe growth and production, and then enable their use in high throughput workflows. In addition, the Scientist will be part of the foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

Immediate responsibilities include:
  • Developing tools and techniques for the genetic engineering of various microbes, including those used for industrial production
  • Using knowledge of microbial metabolism and phenotypic analysis data to select a broad array of targets for strain improvement
  • Guiding the development and implementation of molecular biology tools for an automated, high-throughput strain engineering platform
  • Developing plate models for non-standard microbes that align to growth and production data from large scale bioreactors
The nature of the work at the company is such that every few quarters new projects begin, and Scientists will be expected to bring creativity, perseverance, and expert planning and execution of experiments to each new project.

2. Qualifications/Experience
---------------------------------------

We favor candidates with substantial experience designing and executing experiments in lab: PhD, MS with 4+ years working experience, or BS with 7+ years working experience. We are interested in candidates with technical training in biology, molecular biology, biochemistry, or chemistry. Lastly, we look for candidates that have a track record of displaying creativity in developing new protocols and techniques to speed work in lab.

We favor Scientists with experience in some or all of the following areas:

  • Molecular Biology and Biochemistry:
  • Proficiency with techniques used to build large DNA assemblies from a library of DNA parts
  • Expertise using a variety of DNA transformation techniques into both eukaryotes and prokaryotes
  • Skill with standard methodologies to isolate and purify proteins and characterize activities.
  • Cell Biology and Physiology:
  • Familiar with microbial physiology for a variety of host microbes, including eukaryotes and prokaryotes
  • Knowledgeable regarding cellular metabolism including the ability to generate ideas for engineering new phenotypes into host microbes
  • Understanding of processes associated with target molecule production, including energy usage, product transport, impact on growth and health, etc.
  • Target molecule production and detection:
  • Success developing aerobic and anaerobic plate models to mimic at scale production
  • Experience using a variety of fluorescence, spectroscopic, and chromatographic measurement techniques to detect target molecules
  • Familiarity with a variety of bioreactor operation modes (batch, fed batch, continuous) including ability to run them using bench scale equipment
  • Advanced Tools:
  • Adept at utilizing automation to assist with complicated or lengthy workflows
  • Capable of developing software scripts to assist designing experiments and processing data
  • Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust data analysis
Previous experience in the field of synthetic biology is not essential.

Our facility is located in the San Francisco Bay Area.
title: Scientist, Advanced Technology Development

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

  • Job Description and Specific Responsibilities
Zymergen is hiring a distinctive Scientist to develop CRISPR/Cas9-based technology for high-throughput engineering of microbial genomes. The Scientist will invent new technologies, bring in cutting edge protocols described in the literature, and extend existing Zymergen protocols to provide newer and better workflows to our microbe engineering Factory. The Scientist will work together with other scientists, automation engineers, and software engineers to deploy these new technologies in our microbe engineering Factory. In addition, the Scientist will be part of the foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

Immediate responsibilities involve:
  • Developing CRISPR/Cas9-based technology for editing and/or manipulating microbial genomes
  • Optimizing CRISPR/Cas9-based technology for genome engineering and deploying the technology into our high-throughput microbe engineering Factory
  • Identifying and developing the next generation techniques for DNA assembly, microbe transformation, and genome editing.
The Scientist will work within the team responsible for the upgrade path for the central technology platform at Zymergen. Projects handled by the team include short term optimization projects and long term high risk and high impact development projects. This Scientist will be an early member of the team and will contribute both to the technical and cultural foundations within the growing company.

  • Qualifications/Experience
We favor candidates with formal training (PhD, or equivalent experience) in molecular biology, biochemistry, bioengineering, or related fields. We prefer candidates with a history of successfully developing CRISPR/Cas9-based technologies in the field of molecular biology. Lastly, we look for candidates who have demonstrated creativity and problem solving in a variety of fields.

We favor a Scientist with experience in some or all of the following areas.

Biology and Chemistry:
  • Expertise handling and engineering eukaryotic and/or prokaryotic microbes.
  • Understanding of genetics and gene regulation for a variety of eukaryotic and prokaryotic microbes.
  • Familiarity developing CRISPR/Cas9-based technologies for genome engineering.
  • Proficiency with techniques to build DNA assemblies, transform microbes and edit microbial genomes.
Advanced Tools:
  • Adept at utilizing laboratory automation (Agilent, Tecan, Beckman, and others) to assist with complicated or lengthy workflows
  • Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust data analysis
  • Success in tech transfer of materials and processes (e.g. to our Factory teams).
Our facility is located in the San Francisco Bay Area.
title: Scientist, CRISPR/Cas9 Genome Engineering

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

  • Job Description and Specific Responsibilities
Zymergen is hiring a distinctive Scientist for microbial strain engineering via iterative cycles of Design-Build-Test-Learn, each supported by robotics, laboratory automation, computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-aided manufacturing (CAM) software. The Scientist will focus on engineering multiple microbes for the production of a wide variety of molecules with applications in the chemicals & materials space. The Scientist will join a team working on metabolic pathway design, genetic construct design, strain construction, phenotype analysis to improve the performance of the microbe via multiple, iterative rounds of genome engineering. In addition, the Scientist will be part of the foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

Immediate responsibilities include:
  • Analysis and design of metabolic pathways for the production of a wide variety of molecules across multiple microbes.
  • Translation of these metabolic pathway designs into genetic constructs and new microbial strain designs.
  • Working together with our microbe engineering Factory team to build & test the designed strains.
  • Analysis of data from phenotype testing and using knowledge of microbial metabolism to design a new set of genetic constructs for the next round of strain engineering
  • Developing high-throughput compatible tools and techniques for the genetic engineering of a variety of microbes that either shorten the engineering cycle time and/or extend the throughput and capabilities of the engineering cycle.
  • Developing generic procedures and ultimately algorithms to assist the design, build, and test of the microbe engineering cycle.
The nature of the work at Zymergen is such that every quarter technical Milestones are targeted, and Scientists will be expected to bring creativity, perseverance, and expert planning and execution of experiments to the project.

  • Qualifications / Experience
We favor candidates with formal training (PhD, or equivalent experience) in biochemistry and metabolic engineering, or related fields. We prefer candidates that have experience in the lab. Experience in writing software and developing algorithms to analyze metabolism is a plus. Lastly, we look for candidates that have demonstrated creativity and problem solving in a variety of fields.

We favor Scientists with experience in some or all of the following areas:

  • Deep understanding of cellular physiology and metabolism for a variety of eukaryotic and prokaryotic microbes.
  • Deep understanding of processes associated with target molecule production, including redox metabolism, energy usage, product transport, impact on growth and health, etc.
  • Knowledgeable regarding cellular metabolism including the ability to generate ideas for engineering new pathways into host microbes.
  • Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust data analysis
  • Capable of developing software scripts to assist designing pathways and genetic constructs
  • Capable of developing software scripts to assist in analyzing and processing phenotypic data.
Our facility is located in the San Francisco bay area.
title: Scientist, Metabolic Pathway Engineering

description:
Zymergen is hiring a multiple experienced Scientists to lead the development of technology for high-throughput engineering of microbial genomes. This technology development group is growing as we are going to double in 2017 and many of these people will be entry level Scientists and Research Associates. We need experienced Scientists to mentor and manage junior staff while managing the execution of technology development projects.

Our group is primarily involved in three areas:
  • Identifying and developing new technologies to improve the way we generate genomic diversity; e.g. CRISPR and CRISPRi technologies.
  • Designing new processes and workflows for high throughput DNA assembly and strain engineering in various industrially relevant microbes.
  • Coordinating cross-departmental activities (Development, Implementation and Optimization, Automation, Software) to accomplish the activities above with the goal of readying implementation into Operations.
The Scientist will invent new technologies, bring in cutting edge protocols described in the literature, and extend existing Zymergen protocols to provide newer and better workflows to our microbe engineering operations. In addition, the Scientist will be a leadership role on a foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company. The Senior Scientist recognizes and seizes on intellectual property opportunities, and drives technical vision towards invention, development, and implementation of next-generation technologies for microbe engineering in a high throughput setting. The Senior Scientist will manage and grow a team of 2-10 people.

Qualified candidate will have a PhD and 5+ years experience. Bachelors/Masters and 8+ years would be considered as well. Candidates must display competencies in the following areas:

  • Understanding of molecular biology and genome engineering. Expertise handling and engineering eukaryotic and/or prokaryotic microbes.
  • Understanding of genetics and gene regulation for a variety of eukaryotic and prokaryotic microbes.
  • Awareness of high throughput methodologies (automation, software, biology)
  • Knowledge of CRISPR-cas9 mediated engineering (this borders with a nice-to-have)
  • 2+ years project management, technical leadership and/or functional management experience in an industry setting.
  • Personality Traits: Self-starter, innovative, proactive communicator, works well with different personalities (i.e., team player).
  • Adept at utilizing laboratory automation (Agilent, Tecan, Beckman, and others) to assist with complicated or lengthy workflows
  • Competent in using statistics to strengthen experimental design and enable robust data analysis
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).
title: Scientist III, Genome Engineering

description:
The Gladstone Institutes is an independent, not-for-profit research organization affiliated with the University of California San Francisco (UCSF), contributing to the health and well being of all people through medical research, education, and outreach in the areas of heart disease, HIV/AIDS, and neurological disease. Gladstone Bioinformatics hosts a convergence zone of cutting edge research, omics analytics, biostatistics and technology development, and is one of the primary centers for the National Resource for Network Biology, an NIH-sponsored resource for broadly distributed network biology software and methods. We are located in an award winning building adjacent to UCSF's Mission Bay Campus.

Responsibilities: We are seeking a talented Bioinformatician or Statistician to join the dynamic bioinformatics team here at Gladstone Institutes. You will be providing bioinformatics and statistical support to the world-class biomedical research conducted in labs at Gladstone Institutes, UCSF, and beyond. Working closely with experimental scientists, you will lead end-to-end studies from hypotheses and experimental design, to analysis plans, implementation and pipelining, to methods assessment and result reporting or publication. You will be working with a variety of data types generated by various platforms and technologies (eg, Bulk RNA-seq and DNA-seq, Single-cell sequencing, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, metagenomics, CRISPR screens, Mass spectrometry, and others). You will also have opportunities for methods development, technical writing for grant applications and manuscripts, and training.

Qualifications: PhD with 3+ years of working experience in Bioinformatics/Statistics (or similar fields). At least four years of experience with analysis of large biological datasets using R, Python, Perl or equivalent is required. Statistical genetics experience or NGS experience is strongly preferred. Prior consulting or industrial experience supporting research is a plus. The successful candidate will have a strong background in statistical analysis, experimental design, and quantitative analysis of biological systems, as well as a demonstrated ability to communicate and work effectively with all types and levels of internal and external collaborators.

Salary: Based on experience.

Start Date: March 2017 preferred.

Application Instructions:

Please submit the following:

CV

Cover letter (optional)
Contact info for 3 references (can be submitted later)
title: Staff Research Scientist in Bioinformatics and Statistics

description:
Company Summary

CLEARink Displays is developing next generation reflective display modules with the daylight readability of paper and the colorful video performance of digital displays. The company was founded in 2012 as a U.S. Inc., with product development, engineering, and technology development in Santa Clara, CA.

CLEARink currently has 20 team members, including eight PhD’s from leading international universities, and a strong portfolio of 25 patents covering optics, device architecture and materials. The entrepreneurial management team has global experience in commercializing display technologies and hands-on experience in managing display businesses in Asia – home of all display manufacturing.

The Company is currently in the development phase and increasing the size of the technology, product development, and engineering teams as it transitions to commercialization.

Electrical-Optical Scientist

CLEARink Displays Inc. is looking for an Electro-Optical Scientist with a passion for development and commercialization of cutting edge display technologies to lead the development of display driving algorithms at CLEARink. The candidate will work closely with Electrical Engineers, Optical Physicists and Chemists. You will be responsible for designing and executing experiments to understand electro-optical phenomena on the CLEARink display technology to develop and implement optimal driving waveforms for customer applications.

Responsibilities:

CLEARink will rely heavily on the candidate as a key member of a cross-functional team with members skilled in optics and materials to understand the electro-optical characteristics of the CLEARink display module and optimize performance. Additional responsibilities include:

  • Research and develop reproducible optical response with different voltage driving on simple test cells and TFT’s.
  • Design test plans to quantify and qualify the electrical-optic display performance.
  • Participate in electrical-optical lab design and setup.
  • Analyze the display on test cell and TFT modules for electrical and optical behavior.
  • Design new electrical-optical driving mechanism for every new TFT test build.
  • Provide functional design recommendation for TST driving electronics.
  • Participate in display subsystem design review.
  • Research waveform algorithms.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Electrical Engineering or Applied Math.
  • 2-5 years’ experience with electronic devices and laboratory equipment such as oscilloscopes, power supplies and function generators.
  • Must be self-driven, always curious and have a passion to understand how things work.
  • Have excellent troubleshooting skills and tenacity.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced startup environment.
  • Great documentation skills, experimental design, and result recording.
  • Knowledge of a broad range of optics including imaging, illumination, radiometry and photometry, physical and geometric optics, statistics and polarization.
  • Knowledge and experience with color science, colorimetry and visual optics.
  • Programming experience: Labview and Matlab, C/C++ is beneficial.
  • Familiarity with optical metrology tools and setup for image quality testing.
  • Experience with test automation tools such as Labview.

Benefits:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. In exchange for your hard work and dedication, we offer competitive compensation and medical coverage including health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance. We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • electronic devices and laboratory: 5 years
title: Electrical Optical Scientist

description:
The Bioinformatics Staff Scientist will support a group of experienced scientists to develop novel NGS applications. This individual will need to develop novel algorithms and pipelines, provide data analysis support and be a key contributor to the product development team.

Responsibilities:
  • Develops algorithms for novel NGS and qPCR applications
  • Builds comprehensive NGS data analysis pipelines
  • Provides data analysis support for internal product development and external collaborations
  • Works closely with R&D; scientists to support their daily research activities
  • Participates in brainstorming sessions and contributes ideas in technology, algorithms and products
  • Works independently and also collaborates with other team members to meet project deadlines
  • Prepares and delivers presentations based on scientific and technical progress and achievements
  • Demonstrates and upholds behavior consistent with the Integrated DNA Technologies Core Values and delivers the Integrated DNA Technologies experience to customers and other business associates.

Qualifications: Education:
  • Bachelorâs degree (in Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field) with ten or more years relevant work experience required

Professional Experience:

Integrated DNA Technologies is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

description:
In this role, he/she would have high visibility and opportunity to analyze and extract insights to help strategize and optimize business channels. You would perform in depth analysis, design tests and provide recommendation and insights base on thoughtful data-driven analysis. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on individual with strong analytical background and proven quantitative skills to help improve business process and initiatives. He/she should be comfortable working collaboratively and eager to be a strategic partner in analytics assignments.

What you'll do:
  • Uncover complex issues, understand business challenges, design scientific analytical process, improve functional efficiency and assist in infrastructure definition, data strategy and analytics roadmaps
  • Perform data analytics, statistical/mathematical modeling and prototype designs
  • Data exploration, design of experiments (A/B and multivariate tests) and hypothesis validation to deliver meaningful insights and recommendations for better process and experience
  • Engage in independent research and experimentation of new methodologies to discover new insights, improvements and/or problems. Deliver findings and interpretation of results to management team through data visualization, presentation, or training sessions
  • Guide and educate analysts on best analytical practices during projects
  • Not afraid of ambiguity and understand pragmatic vs. good to know. Willing to utilize analytics to tell the truth and propose improvements to the business.
What we're looking for:
  • MS or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics or Psychology
  • 4+ years experience utilizing quantitative research and analytics to drive significant business impact with some experience in increasing customer satisfaction, engagement and/or improving marketing/product efficiency
  • Solid understanding experimentation, predictive analytics and/or machine learning
  • Good algorithmic thinking, strong interpersonal skills with business acumen and ability to translate business objectives to analytical framework and action items
  • Comfortable training and dealing with wide range of audience
  • Proficiency working with statistical tools (such as R, SAS), database query languages (SQL) and some scripting language (such as Python)
What we'll provide:
  • Top salary
  • Flexible hours
  • Casual dress code
  • Stock options
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits

description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Acquisitions Strategy and Operations team (Global Sales Excellence) drives the strategy and operations for the acquisition of advertisers for Google by partnering with New Business Sales (NBS), External Telesales (ETO), App Developer Sales (AppDev) and Marketing Organizations. The team leads the design, planning, and operations of programs that drive a scalable and analytical approach to generating incremental business growth.

Strategy and Operations Analysts use an analytical and data-driven approach to develop a deep understanding of our fast changing business, provide insights that will translate directly to business growth, and improve Googleâs business development productivity. You will find answers to complex, ambiguous, and high-visibility business challenges. You will also provide analytical expertise and business understanding to the Acquisitions leadership teams, and partner with cross-functional teams to deliver acquisition performance insights, while working closely with Sales and Marketing leaders to ensure smooth execution and implementation of the resulting strategic recommendations.

Additionally, you will have exposure and visibility to executives and cross-functional leaders as you advocate for opportunities and highlight the impacts of your programs.

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. Together, we create and implement business plans broadly for every type of businesses.

Responsibilities
  • Conduct sophisticated analysis and modeling that translates data into actionable insights, and support business development.
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis to predict, measure, and interpret business trends and to inform key decisions.
  • Identify opportunities for product, program, and process improvement, with a focus on driving business growth. Research and analyze key business drivers, trends, and operating metrics.
  • Communicate findings on a regular basis to all levels of management.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree with quantitative focus (economics, computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics or accounting) or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of analytical work experience in marketing and sales, management consulting, or in a business operations and analytics environment.
  • Experience analyzing large quantities of data with strong spreadsheet and database query experience (e.g. SQL).

Preferred qualifications:
  • MBA, MS or other advanced degree.
  • Experience presenting to senior executives.
  • Track record of thought leadership in applying data-driven models that have had a tangible impact on sales and marketing operations across international markets. Ability to strategically analyze and synthesize data in order to develop useful formats and actionable insights.
  • Ability to consistently deliver quality outputs in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to work to tight deadlines. Extremely well-organized and capable of handling multiple projects and ad-hoc requests simultaneously.
  • Ability to work in and contribute to a fun, fast-paced, high impact and dynamic environment.

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate to solve hard and interesting problems? description:
# Business Intelligence Analyst

**REF#: ** 27529

**CBS BUSINESS UNIT: ** CBS Interactive

**JOB TYPE: ** Full-Time Staff

**JOB SCHEDULE: **

**JOB LOCATION: ** Burbank, CA

**ABOUT US: **

CBS Interactive, a division of CBS Corporation, is the premier online content network for information and entertainment. With more than 250 million people visiting its properties each month, it is a top 10 Web property globally and a top 5 Web property in the U.S. in terms of unique video viewers. Its portfolio of leading brands, which include CNET, CBS.com, CBSNews.com, CBSSports.com, GameSpot, TVGuide.com and Last.fm, span popular categories like technology, entertainment, sports, news, and gaming.

About the teamWe are the Central Audience Development and Acquisition team. We work closely with all CBSi brands (CBS, CBS News, Sports, CNET, GameSpot, TVGuide, et al.) to develop, promote and amplify the very best content and products of what CBSi produces every day.

**DESCRIPTION: **

CBSi Central Audience Development and Acquisition team is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to play a highly visible and important role providing the business with the highest quality insights for decision making.

From helping to frame the initial questions, shaping the data and analyzing to presenting recommendations based on the results. The BI Analyst is able to understand the problem facing the business and come back with an insightful solution. To accomplish this, the analyst is comfortable with off-the-shelf web analytics packages, directly querying in SQL against the data warehouse, and using analytics software. The analyst can also effectively communicate with all levels of the organization and promote and defend the recommendations they are making. The analyst also partners closely with product management to ensure reporting needs are met. The analyst should also be proactive in identifying opportunities for analysis and optimization. The business intelligence analyst will be required to provide analyses and recommendations regarding campaign performance, financial performance, and advertising effectiveness.

Specific Responsibilities:
Update marketing campaign tracking reports

Work with internal and external partners

Coordinate and manage meetings

Manage campaign initiatives with all stakeholders

Create, maintain, and improve process workflows

Strong ability to derive insights from data.

Experience with database tools and direct SQL access

Experience with Tableau or other similar platforms

Experience with Adobe Site Catalyst/ Omniture

Thorough understanding of data modeling and relational databases

Experience and enthusiasm with large, raw data sets

Excel, Powerpoint

High degree of initiative and ability to learn and very enthusiastic about data

Excellent communication skills

Ability to work quickly and accurately on multiple projects concurrently

Must successfully pass a background check

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in the tech industry preferred; experience working in the Consumer Technology, Gaming or Digital Media industries a plus

In addition, CBS will be guided by applicable federal, state and local laws when considering for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

**EEO STATEMENT: **

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled
title: Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
Sunverge is looking for a motivated and talented Data Scientist with strong analytical skills to help drive the future of solar integrated storage.
As a Data Scientist, your role will be to develop and improve the algorithms that control the operation of our units. These algorithms will provide financial benefit to one of our three value streams - consumer, network, and wholesale - and may incorporate predictive analytics such as PV and load forecasting. You should be able to design algorithms that will co-optimize the operation of the unit across different value streams in order to fulfil multiple business objectives and maximize revenue. Additionally, the Data Scientist should be able to work with partner companies to assess their products and leverage external analytic solutions as required. Once the correct algorithmic solution have been determined, the Data Scientist should be able to work with our Engineering team in order to integrate such algorithms into the product, asses their performance in the field, and suggest further improvements based on that analysis.
Sunverge is sitting on a goldmine of data that is unique in the industry: you will be leading the effort to turn that gold into business value.

Requirements:
  • BA/BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related technical field (MA/MS/PhD preferred)
  • Well-rounded knowledge of analytics platforms, distributed computing technologies, BI and reporting tools, data capture, data warehousing, and data analysis
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Python, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable.
  • Great communication skills
  • Experience with data visualisation tools such as D3.js
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good scripting and programming skills
  • Data-oriented personality
  • Understanding of the various components of customer side utility electric usage metrics and distribution grid characteristics
title: Data Scientist, Algorithm Research and Development

description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.

The Global Revenue Team is responsible for business growth forecasting and analytics for Google’s products and services, including the Hardware business. As part of this team, you will have a unique perspective on Google’s emerging product businesses, services and the ecosystems that they operate within. Hardware is a very dynamic area with a recently launched portfolio of products from Phones to VR. This is a great opportunity for someone with a passion for consumer electronics who wants to participate in the shaping of the future of that organization.

You will manage the cross-functional Finance processes which inform Google’s both short and long-term business trajectory, especially business growth drivers. You will work to ensure the highest standards of quality and transparency in our business growth processes and reporting, and proactively implement best practices to minimize risk. You will also collaborate across Product, Sales, Business Development, Retail Operations, Strategy and Pricing teams to identify opportunities and risks for business growth. You will thrive by being a strong communicator, cascading relevant information to partners across Google. You are a natural self-starter with a keen eye for detail, collaborative work style and a passion for scaling Google’s next business growth engines.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

Responsibilities
  • Forecast business growth generated by our Hardware products.
  • Develop analysis/tools to track business growth for Hardware to better understand the drivers of that business growth.
  • Partner with leaders in engineering and product organizations to understand and shape technical drivers of business growth performance.
  • Provide executive management with clear insights into drivers of business growth, risks and opportunities.
  • Manage monthly business growth and variance analysis. Support long-range financial modeling.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, or related quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience in financial/quantitative analysis.
  • Database experience including experience in SQL coding across standard relational environments (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, etc.).
  • Experience working in the consumer electronics sector.

Preferred qualifications:
  • Advanced degree in mathematics or statistics.
  • Specific expertise with time series analysis and large scale data systems
  • Proficiency with statistical or scientific software packages (R/SPLUS, Mathematica, MATLAB, or similar).
  • Excellent analytical, communications, quantitative and interpersonal skills.
title: Financial Analyst, Revenue
