description:
Parallel Machines is an exciting new start-up that is focused on improving how companies manage advanced real-time analytics and machine learning applications for large datasets. The company was founded in 2014 by a talented team with backgrounds in distributed systems, machine learning and mathematical statistics. By focusing on a unified solution for machine learning that works with both batch and streaming data and manages workloads from edge devices to the cloud, they are radically changing how these applications are developed and deployed.

The Machine Learning Software Engineer will work within the Machine Learning (ML) team todesign, architect and implement ML algorithms and solutions. The engineer will be responsiblefor developing core support for parallel implementations of mathematical functions to ingest,transform, and manipulate large data sets as well as developing critical testing functions toensure correctness. Responsibilities also include scoring and evaluation functions to measuremodel efficacy. Duties may also include interfacing with customers and partners to help refinesolutions based on our platform.

Qualification and Skills Required:

- MS/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering.

- Technical knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Machine Learning Algorithms,Statistical Modeling, Data Mining, Pattern Recognition, Information Retrieval, NaturalLanguage Processing.

- 1-5 years of experience. Experience in a predictive technology product organization aplus.

- Proven ability to model, prototype, architect and engineer systems. Hands on experiencein model building and coding.

- Hands-on experience implementing machine learning techniques including data ingest,cleaning, and modeling as well as production deployment.

- Deep understanding of analysis and mining of large structured and semi-structured data.

- Dataset manipulation and engineering experience with document, graph, log data, andsemi-structured data.

- Excellent communication and problem solving skills.

- Hands-on experience doing code development in R, Matlab, or Python including coremathematical functions, feature engineering and data manipulation functions, modelanalysis and evaluation functions, and library/package management.

Qualification and Skills Desired:

- Hands on experience Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Theano, Caffe, Keras or similar packages.

- Experience testing and evaluating performance and correctness of newly developedmathematical functions in Matlab or similar products.

- Hands-on experience benchmarking alternative implementations of machine learningpipelines using publicly available data sets.

- Knowledge of Distributed Computing and Parallel System solutions and ability to leveragethem to minimize the time to insight using large data sets. Solid understanding of computer architecture, particularly in terms of current Intelmicroarchitecture is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time
title: Machine learning Software Engineer

description:
About the Role:
The Advanced Optimization team focuses on utilizing machine learning to drive revenue at AdRoll while optimizing value for individual marketers across our growing product eco-system.

Your primary responsibility will be to improve and scale our internal optimization algorithms. You will have a strong understanding of statistics and experimental design. You are comfortable working with AdRoll’s large data set and possess the ability to articulate recommendations in a clear and concise way. You will have a background in a quantitative or technical field and attested software development skills to translate state-of-the-art algorithms into production-ready applications. You will bring a real passion for finding creative, end-to-end engineering solutions to complex business problems.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop scalable algorithms to optimize and monitor campaign performances across a diverse group of over 20,000 marketers
  • Design and run experiments to optimize user segmentation, creative design, campaign setup, and real-time bidding strategies
  • Apply statistical models on large datasets to:
  • measure results and outcomes
  • identify causal impact
  • predict future performance of campaigns
  • Conduct design and code reviews
  • Research technical literature for new ideas
  • End-to-end mathematics/machine learning product development: Partner with the Business Intelligence team to understand business problems/requirements, conduct research to develop mathematical/machine learning solutions, and engineer a product to scale
  • Communicating and convincing vested stakeholders the nuanced benefits/drawbacks of your proposed solution
Qualifications:
  • BS or MS (PhD preferred) in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, Physics or a related degree. Relevant work experience will supersede degree
  • 2+ years “hands-on” experience building production-ready, scalable software solutions
  • 3+ years experience in building models and developing algorithms for machine learning, statistics, and simulation in industry and/or academia
  • 3+ years experience with Python. Familiarity with R is a plus
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Excellent communication, organization, and problem solving skills
Bonus Points:
  • Background in online advertising
  • Experience with C++, C
  • Familiarity with a wide breadth of mathematical knowledge (e.g., convex optimization, bayesian analysis)
Please include the following with your application:
  • Link or attachment of code you’ve written related to a recent data analysis. Please provide an overview of your key findings, methodology and impact.
Compensation:
  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits
  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule
  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award
About AdRoll:
AdRoll is the largest independent retargeting and prospecting platform with over 25,000 clients worldwide. It specializes in performance marketing for several verticals including e-commerce, b2b, finance, travel, education, and media, and analyzes data on over 1 billion digital profiles across desktop, mobile, and tablet devices through its proprietary technology. Partnering with top media and tech companies including Google, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Apple, along with millions of websites and mobile apps, the company is home to the world's largest opt-in advertiser data co-op. AdRoll’s goal is to map the world’s intent data and put it to work for every advertiser on the planet.

AdRoll is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in New York, Tokyo, London, Dublin, and Sydney. It is backed by Foundation Capital, IVP, Accel Partners, Merus Capital, Peter Thiel, and other leading investors. Learn more atwww.adroll.com ( http://www.adroll.com/ ).

AdRoll is committed to creating diverse teams of “Rollers” and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, sex, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or other characteristics.
title: Machine Learning Software Engineer

description:
Data is integral to all the decisions we make at Twitch - come join our growing team of data analysts and work with our data scientists, product managers and engineers to resolve ambiguity with data, play a crucial role in product iteration and optimization at Twitch, and evangelize data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities
    • Influence product decisions from inception to launch to post-launch - educate your stakeholders on how to resolve ambiguity through quantifiable goals at the inception phase, design and help implement data instrumentation and tracking during execution, and come up with accurate KPIs to track performance and make suggestions post-launch for future iterations or deeper data dives.
    • Supplement day-to-day operations with data - provide teams with ad-hoc analysis, automated reports and dashboards, and self-service reporting tools that accurately reflect the health of their business and help them track their progress towards their goals.
    • Identify opportunities for developing new data sources, and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available.
    • Communicate your results to diverse audiences at all levels from executives to engineers with effective writing, visualizations, and presentations.
    • Be a champion for high quality data-driven decision-making on your team and throughout the company.
Requirements
    • Expert SQL skills. Your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success.
    • 2+ years of experience in using data to iterate on and improve a product and meaningfully impact product decisions.
    • Fluency in data analysis and communication about data, including time series and event data analysis, data visualization, and defining KPIs.
    • Experience with automated self-service reporting tools.
    • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bonus Points
    • Technical background with some programming experience.
    • Statistics and AB testing experience or knowledge is always a plus.
    • You know a lot about online communities, games, or Twitch.
Twitch is the worldâs leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitchâs live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at: http://twitch.tv

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records .

description:
Connexity empowers brands to put intelligence from extensive consumer insights and the largest panel of online consumer measurement to use to help marketers build, segment, understand, and activate their own custom audiences. Our goal is to leverage all our unique data assets in order to bridge the gap between consumer insights and audience activation.

As part of our expansion, we're looking for a Data Science Superstar to leverage state-of-the-art methods to turn big data into business value. Our ideal candidate has the passion and drive to make a difference, is highly collaborative yet autonomous, understands how to translate business requirements, and enjoys a fast-paced environment. Could you be our next X'er?

Responsibilities
Translating business problems into analytic frameworks and using advanced methods (machine learning, data mining, statistical modeling) to create business value.
Managing analytics projects throughout entire development lifecycle: concept, design, production, testing and release of projects.
Conceiving, communicating and owning the overall timeline for analytics projects.
Driving innovation as a principal data analyst.
Delivering solutions to all verticals across the enterprise.
Qualifications
Masterâs degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
Minimum of 3 years working as a Data Scientist.
Experience analyzing and interpreting the results of product experiments.
Knowledge of machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, statistics, predictive analytics, NLP or related field.
Programming skills in some of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala, Perl, Shell.
Knowledge of statistical languages such as R or SAS.
Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools (i.e. Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, or Storm).
Working knowledge of relational database systems and SQL.
Experience with some of these methods: Regression, Decision Trees, CART, Random Forest, Boosting, Evolutionary Programming, Neural Networks, Fuzzy Systems, Bayesian Belief Networks, Support Vector Machines, Ensemble Methods, Association Rules, Singular Value Decomposition, Principal Component Analysis, Clustering.
Experience in some of these applications: Collaborative Filtering, Personalization, Consumer Segmentation, Text Analytics, Information Retrieval, Search Relevance.
Experience managing end-to-end machine learning pipeline from data exploration, feature engineering, model building, performance evaluation, and online testing with big data set.
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written).
Prior experience in this area with Ad Tech eCommerce or Online Retail would be a plus.
Excellent organization skills and attention to detail.
Exceptional problem solving skills with unrelenting focus on practical business implications.
Leadership, passion, and curiosity.
Headquartered in Los Angeles, we operate sites and business services in the United States, the United Kingdom, Italy, Germany, and now Australia! We offer top benefits including flexible time off, casual work environment, competitive comp, free lunch and much more!
title: Sr. Data Scientist-Machine Learning Engineer

description:
Job Description:
Sr. Staff Scientist - Algorithms will be part of a growing Clinical Genomics team of Bioinformaticians, Lab Scientist, Data Curation Scientists, Clinicians and Medical Fellows. Clinical Genomic Service (CGS) is a collaboration between Stanford Hospitals and Stanford School of Medicine to deliver best-in-class genomics service to Stanford community. CGS plans to use multi-omics (Whole Exome and Transcriptome) analysis approach to diagnosis. This position will be responsible for leading the algorithm development efforts within CGS. Evaluate current algorithms and develop a "best-practice" set of algorithms for use in a clinical diagnostics setting. Guide and mentor other junior members of the algorithm development team. Interface with the Curation team to identify gaps in variant detection and annotation and develop novel algorithms and methods to fill those gaps.

Lead the algorithm development group and efforts with the goal of developing NGS algorithms that serve as NGS community standards.
Develop novel algorithms for DNASeq and RNASeq for use in a diagnostics setting.
Develop new and/or improve upon existing algorithms for genome assembly, variant detection (SNPs and InDels) and Structural Variant detection (CNVs, Inversions and Translocations) for clinical grade genomic analysis pipeline.
Develop and maintain a knowledge database of variants and annotations discovered in processing of samples.
Develop and maintain a database of public annotation sources such as ClinVar, Exome Variant Server, 1000 Genomes, TCGA and DGV.
Develop efficient protocols and tools to upload WGS/WES data from internal servers to Cloud Storage (AWS S3/Google Cloud Storage).
Establish new and leverage existing collaborations with research groups within Stanford and other pre-eminent research institutions.
Maintain a high public profile within the Clinical and Translational Genomics community through publications and presentations in high impact journals and conferences.
Help mentor other junior-level bioinformaticians in the group.
Work closely with the data curators and genetic counselors to help improve the overall solve rate of cases.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.

Qualificiations:
Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.

Minimum Requirements
Education: Graduate Degree (Ph.D, M.S with considerable experience will be considered) in Computer Science/Engineering, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Statistics and other related fields.
Experience: Six (6) years of experience with increasing responsibilities, developing algorithms for next generation sequencing (preferably in a Clinical setting).
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge of algorithmic techniques common to bioinformatics (e.g., dynamic programming and graph algorithms), machine learning and statistical analysis methods (e.g., Bayesian inference, Hidden Markov Models, Principal Component Analysis).
Experience in developing one or more of the algorithms used in NGS analysis - Sequence alignment, Variant Calling (SNVs), Local-Assembly (De-bruijn graph), and Fusion Detection etc.
Extensive experience handing error modes in NGS data (preferably Illumina) within STR, long homo-polymers, high GC and other troublesome regions of the human genome.
Experience in bioinformatics resources such as BLAST, BWA, GATK, dbGaP, Clustalw, NCBI, EBI, Pfam, COG, GO, KEGG, etc.
Experience in Biomarkers/Genomic markers discovery is a big plus.
Proficiency in either C/C++ or Java and Linux.
Familiarity with Perl, Python and R.
Strong analytical abilities and communication skills.

description:
Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program

Lockheed Martin is looking for world-class talent in Operations Analysis to join our historic Skunk Works team in Palmdale, CA. The team is seeking a candidate who can develop and use engineering-based techniques, advanced analytical methods, and critical thinking to inform and improve decision-making and quantify value proposition for advanced concepts and technology applications. We need a candidate who is passionate about working on cutting-edge design concepts; comfortable with ambiguity; thinks strategically and creatively with proven analytical and engineering problem-solving skills; and thrives in a high-performing team environment.

The selected candidate will have the opportunity to serve as the analytical lead on projects and be responsible for modeling and analysis of military systems to quantify the impact of operational concepts (CONOPS), air vehicle system design, payloads, and tactics; as well as perform analysis to support requirements definition, concept of operations evaluation, operational and cost effectiveness, and military utility assessment. Responsibilities will include researching military systems performance and operations, modeling systems and scenarios in digital simulations, executing trade studies, quantifying Measures-of-Effectiveness (MOEs), analyzing simulation results to draw meaningful conclusions, preparing reports/briefings and presenting analysis results. The successful candidate must demonstrate effective communication and interpersonal skills as the position will require frequent interactions and collaboration with leadership, project management, customers, other team members, and engineers in other disciplines. The ability to travel on occasion is required.

Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Must be a US Citizen this position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelors or above degree from an accredited college in related engineering discipline
• Proficiency to apply engineering principles and analytical techniques to analyze performance of weapon systems
• Demonstrated analytical thinking and ability to solve complex engineering/analytical problems
• Proficiency in trade study execution, data analysis, and delivering analysis results and products
• Proficient in scripting/programming; MATLAB or Perl/Python experience
• Experience as project technical interface with management and/or customers
• Must have an active Secret clearance with a current background investigation within five years and ability to obtain Top Secret and SAR program clearances

Must be a US Citizen this position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Desired skills
• Aerospace or mechanical engineering, applied mathematics, or Operations Research degree preferred
• Proficiency analyzing military system performance, operations, and effectiveness; with experience analyzing missile systems highly desired
• Knowledge of surface and airborne military systems, operations, and Integrated Air Defense Systems (IADS)
• Operations analysis experience working in industry or government
• Hands-on application of engagement to mission simulations (ESAMS, AFSIM, Brawler, Suppressor, EADSIM); one-on-one engagement model experience with ESAMS, RADGUNS, or TMAP highly desired
• Proficiency with C++/JAVA /XML
• Design of experiments, statistics, and/or optimization knowledge
• Proven customer engagement experience; with demonstrated skill to develop & deliver effective presentations
• Proven ability to lead small technical team to deliver analytic products
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Active Top Secret Clearance preferred

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Operations Analyst Staff

description:
DuPont Pioneer is aggressively building our Big Data and Predictive Analytics capabilities in order to augment our world class R&D; capabilities and deliver digital services to our customers. We seek a Chief Data Scientist to lead our global data science team to further develop our analytics capabilities. This is a critical position with strategic impact on our business.

The successful candidate will have an extensive background and track record in statistical methodologies as well as data mining and machine & deep learning strategies, and proven experience validating models against experimental data. Individuals who have a natural curiosity and passion for scientific investigation, talent for strategic leadership, interest in digital product development, and experience in people management are encouraged to apply: we are looking for those creative, smart, driven individuals who enjoy giving their all to tackle tough analytics problems, strategically shape the future, and deliver digital services and solutions to R&D; and our customers.

Job Duties/Responsibilities:
  • Lead development of data science strategy for a leading global agriculture business with world class R&D; in an environment that is rich in complex biological, environmental, operational, and business data.
  • Lead and manage a global data science group including expertise in statistics, image analysis, data-driven predictive analytics, and computer science.
  • Recruit, develop, and manage capabilities in machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling, and other computational approaches to extract insights from large proprietary and public agronomic and molecular plant science data sources.
  • Establish and manage collaborations engaging with mathematical modelers and data engineers for the development of novel data analytic approaches and integrated decision science solutions with our partners.
  • Coordinate the collaboration of the data science group with all R&D; groups and the Digital Services business to develop solutions for challenging R&D;, operations, and customer questions in cross-functional teams
  • Represent DuPont Pioneer R&D; global data science capabilities with our partners and in the scientific community.

Job Qualifications Educational Qualifications:
PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related field and at least 10 years of relevant, post-graduate work experience in analytics in a fast paced, product-oriented environment.

Competencies & Experience Desired:
  • Experience in machine learning, deep learning, data mining, statistical methodology and demonstrated experience using these techniques to solve research and consumer problems.
  • Experience in strategy development and strategic leadership in R&D; or business environments.
  • Experience with people management with global, diverse talent.
  • Passion for collaboration and working with and inspiring cross-functional, multi-disciplinary teams.
  • Excellent communication skills, verbal and written, with internal and external audiences.
  • Knowledge of digital product development.
  • Experience with computer science methodologies, high performance computing, data engineering, software development, and data modeling and architecture.
  • Interest in plant sciences, agriculture, and farming is a must; experience in these fields is a plus.
title: Chief Data Scientist

description:
The Manager, CoE Analytics II is responsible for the development, planning and execution of Consumer, Commercial, and Sales Operations quantitative analyses allowing our internal clients to answer questions for deviation from goals, and contribute with the development of a strong data infrastructure. This position will proactively engage business leaders of supported departments to execute on impactful strategic initiatives by delivering decision enabling insights.
This position will direct an analytics team responsible for reviewing and analyzing operations performance metrics and providing recommendations to achieve Department Objectives.

Duties and Responsibilities

1. Develops and supports complex analytical processes and procedures to identify opportunities in the supported departments. This would involve problem frame-works, development of hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan.
2. Proactively analyze key performance indicators. Drive step-change improvements in credit and sales operations by creating models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis. Present data driven insights and recommendations to senior management for improving business operations.
3. Provide input into the vision and direction of the department to senior leaders that will support the directives set by the company objectives. This should include the ability to interact with Executive Management as well as leadership of all departments to facilitate the accomplishment of company goals
4. Develops team members by providing feedback on strength and growth areas, providing an environment that supports learning and development, and regularly discussing progress towards goals with direct reports. Direct work flow and priorities within scope.
5. Perform all other duties as assigned.

Knowledge and Skills

• Solid programming, data mining, quantitative, statistical, modeling, and analytical skills
• Excellent written and oral communication skills, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills
• Result oriented with intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals.
• Proven track record of problem solving based on analytics and conceptual thinking with an ability to execute in a fluid and fast paced environment
• Possess excellent leadership skills that can leverage capabilities of internal and external business partners across the enterprise. Should foster innovation, drive critical decisions, hold business partners accountable, and be able to consistently deliver results

Education and Experience

• Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (business, math, economics, finance, statistics, science, engineering), Masters Preferred
• 7+ years proven experience in Statistical model building and Business Analysis; Superior industry/product knowledge
• 3+ years of captive finance experience preferred
• Proficiency in analytical methods, data mining and model development;
• Strong programming skills including knowledge of statistical programs (i.e. SAS, SAP) and/or advanced SQL
title: Manager, CoE Analytics II

title: Think Big Senior Data Scientist

description:
Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity, and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play.

SUMMARY Hulu’s Content Planning & Analysis team is seeking an experienced Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our Finance department. As an Analyst at Hulu, your primary responsibilities will include modeling cost and performance of prospective content deals, regularly tracking and forecasting long term content spend, evaluating content performance, digging deep in data to analyze trends in content using predictive analytics, preparing reports for management, and other projects. Due to the “undefined” nature of the work, the successful candidate will have the aptitude to tackle multiple projects, problem-solve, and efficiently execute deliverables.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
  • Prepare complex models to project content performance to support content acquisition and original development decision making
  • Support the day-to-day management of Hulu’s long-term content budget
  • Prepare deal memos to build internal support for potential transactions
  • Assist with the creation of presentations to support board meetings and other strategic initiatives
  • Participate in various ad-hoc content projects
WHAT TO BRING
  • 2-3 years of experience in a highly quantitative / analytical role
  • Complex modeling experience and analytical abilities with exceptional Excel skills required
  • Strong work ethic, high sense of urgency, and ability to work extended hours
  • Detail oriented and exceptional organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
  • Bachelor's degree majoring in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Business with strong academic performance
NICE-TO-HAVES

description:
Description All Covered, IT Services Division of Konica Minolta Business Solutions (KMBS) , is the leading national IT services company serving SMB to enterprise markets. Offering a wide variety of career opportunities, All Covered is an excellent choice for motivated IT professionals interested in a stimulating and progressive work environment. With over 1,000 employees across the U.S. and Canada, All Covered has a highly skilled team of professionals focusing on superior quality service delivery to our customers. We offer hands-on technical training on the most relevant technologies in the industry and career path advancement in all levels of the company.

Please join us in our exciting growth and pursue a rewarding career with All Covered!

POSITION OBJECTIVE:
The purpose of the position is to provide business and financial analysis and support to All Covered, IT services division of Konica Minolta. Responsibilities include but are not limited to business and financial reporting, analytics and administration of reporting tools and data sources.
The Business Analyst position reports to the VP, Financial Planning & Analysis in Foster City, CA and works among a team of experienced business and financial analysts.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Collect and process large data sets from multiple sources to create business metric reporting under leadership direction.

  • Report and investigate business drivers impacting financial results by measuring trends against industry standard and historical performance.

  • Manage and maintain various real-time, daily, weekly and monthly reporting to assist leadership in making informed and timely decisions.

  • Support the IT services business in decision-driven data reporting by providing ROI analysis and tracking monthly actuals against target.

  • Provide month-end reporting support to the finance team to meet deadlines, including reporting through excel models and BI tools.

  • Examine and reengineer processes and reports based on feedback from business leadership to improve analysis and reporting.

  • Participate in key projects and take on ad hoc projects as needed.

    Requirements QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelorâs Degree in finance, statistics, mathematics, big data and other quantitative fields.
  • Minimum 1-3 years of related work experience
  • Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills
  • Self-starter with ability to investigate and solve problems independently and meet deadlines
  • Ability to collaborate with others and use judgment to produce results and conclusions
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and adhere to deadlines while maintaining accuracy
  • Superior work ethic and energy level
  • Possess technical aptitude and/or desire and ability to learn.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel and excellent understanding of the What-ifs and Lookup logics preferred
  • BI Tools (such as Domo and Power BI) and SAP, CRM and Business Objects experience a plus

    Konica Minolta offers:
  • Competitive compensation program
  • Outstanding benefits package (including medical, dental, life insurance)
  • 401(k) plan with matching company contribution
  • Excellent holiday/vacation plans.
  • Tuition reimbursement.
  • Employee Referral Bonus Program.
  • Ongoing training opportunities.
  • Visible, exciting work supporting the sales of cutting edge technology and workflow solutions.

    KMBS is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity, disability, alienage or citizenship status, marital status or partnership status, genetic information, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under applicable law.

    Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description:

The individual will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Life Cycle Management, and other groups to transfer new products and sustain and improve processes for existing products.

Product Transfer
  • Implementation of process controls

Production

  • Experience with high volume production in a high tech, high volume consumables industry is a plus.
  • High level computer skills are a plus.

  • Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.

Education:

title: Associate Scientist 1, NPI

description:
We are looking for a highly talented Scientist to be a key member of our metrology team within the Department of Reagents and Consumables. A candidate with fundamental knowledge of measurement techniques used to quantify products and process will become a key contributor to integrated and multidisciplinary teams developing new, and improving existing DNA sequencing technology platforms. Candidates with a proven track record in a variety of analytical chemistry methods, spectroscopic techniques or kinetics characterization tools will be considered. As a successful candidate you will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment to create genomic analysis consumable devices that enable leading-edge medical research.

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Quantitatively characterize materials and surfaces including polymers, enzymes, monolayers and functionalized surfaces.
  • Create or identify innovative new ways to characterize surfaces, materials and processes used in the creation of Illumina’s consumables.
  • Perform and lead failure analysis.
  • Interface with third party analytical labs to plan experiments and analyze results.
  • Assist in developing manufacturing friendly methods and transferring them to production areas.
  • Play a key role in product and process development by interpreting complex data and providing guidance to product development teams.
  • Work collaboratively with surface and polymer chemists, biochemists and bioinformaticians, developing new DNA analysis platforms.
  • Lead technical project teams in delivering cutting edge solutions to highly integrated product development problems.
  • Teach staff members how to perform measurements and interpret data.
  • Present clear and concise written and oral communications to colleagues and supervisors, lead and/or participate in technical meetings, and provide recommendations based on technical results.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.

Requirements:
  • Extensive hands on experience and deep technical understanding in one or more analytical techniques such as HPLC, LCMS, NMR, TOF-SIMS or related methods.
  • Experience with dimensionality reduction analysis techniques for spectroscopic data, including PCA.
  • Deep statistics knowledge with experience manipulating and analyzing large data sets.
  • Strong candidates will possess a solid process development mindset with knowledge and hands on experience using “6-Sigma” variability reduction methods including gauge studies, method validations and capability analysis.
  • Expert knowledge in one or more programming/scripting languages (C/C++/C#, Matlab, R etc.) and experience designing and implementing analysis algorithms/software is a significant plus.
  • Successful candidates will have demonstrated the ability to overcome technical challenges in a fast-paced, industrial environment within an interdisciplinary team setting.

Education:

The ideal candidate will have a PhD in Physical Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Physics, Biomedical Engineering or a closely related field.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
title: Scientist 1

description:
Weâre looking for a Data Scientist to help us build the first real-time cross-screen TV analytics platform that brings the power of online analytics to TV data.

The perfect candidate will have a background in math, stats, physics, econometrics, computer science or a related quantitative field, will have experience working with large data stores, statistical modeling, and will have some experience building software. You are scrappy, focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression, and user engagement of a product.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Design, build, and launch new data models for TV usage and associated online activity.
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how users interact with our products.
  • Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems, build products based on data, and identify trends and opportunities.
  • Mine massive amounts of data to extract actionable insights that inform, influence, support, and help execute our product decisions and product launches.
  • Design and implement reporting and metrics that track and monitor the performance of our products, the quality of our data, and overall health of the business.
  • Data Infrastructure
  • Work with SQL, Map Reduce, and no-SQL databases.
  • Design, build and launch new ETL processes.
  • Build data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis.
  • Automate analyses.
  • Product Operations & Leadership
  • Design and evaluate experiments monitoring key product metrics, and understand root causes of changes in metrics.
  • Build and analyze dashboards and reports.
  • Influence product teams through presentation of findings.
  • Communicate the state of business, experiment results, etc. to product and management teams.
  • Exploratory Analysis & Statistical Modeling
  • Understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
  • Identify levers to help move key metrics.
  • Evaluate and define metrics.
  • Build models of user behaviors for analysis and powering production systems.
  • Identify and correct for any biases or errors in our data sets.
--------------
Qualifications
--------------

  • 2+ years Data Science experience outside of academia.
  • Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, or other related field) from a leading academic institution.
  • Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
  • Expert in SQL and fluent/proficient in at least one scripting language (ideally Python).
  • Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
  • Excellent communication skills with demonstrated success presenting complex data and analysis (qualitative and quantitative) in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action
  • Strong understanding of statistical analysis, experience with packages such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata, etc.
  • Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources.
  • Ability to analyze data to identify deliverables, gaps and inconsistencies.
  • Experience in custom ETL design, implementation and maintenance.
  • A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data. A passion for problem solving, comfort with ambiguity, and creativity.
  • A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision.
  • Experience utilizing both qualitative analysis (e.g., content analysis, phenomenology, hypothesis testing) and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, pattern recognition, descriptive and inferential statistics).
  • Quick learner, with the ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance.
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive change and collaborate effectively with a variety of individuals and organizations
-----
Bonus
-----

  • Deep hands on experience with schema design and dimensional data modeling.
  • Ph.D. in a relevant technical field.
  • Solid to expert knowledge of lower level programing languages such as C/C++.

title: Data Scientist

description:
At Nuna, our mission is to make high-quality healthcare affordable for everyone. We are dedicated to tackling one of our nation’s biggest problems with ingenuity, creativity, and a keen moral compass.

Nuna is committed to simple principles: a rigorous understanding of data, modern technology, and most importantly, compassion and care for our fellow human. We want to know what really works, what doesn't—and why.

Nuna partners with healthcare payers, including self-insured companies and the United States government, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning.

If you share this passion, join us!

------------------------
Nuna Data Science
------------------------

Nuna’s Data Science team is focused on the development of smarter, data-driven healthcare policy. We come from fields such as biomedical informatics, health economics, statistics, and epidemiology, with a shared passion for research, experimentation, trial and—of course—error, measurement, learning, and improving. We leverage our expertise to help our partners ask the right questions and measure the right outcomes so that they can bring positive, responsible, meaningful change to the health of their populations.

Data science is an independent team at Nuna and works in collaboration with others to:

  • Understand and answer customer questions
  • Develop analytical methods and features for Nuna’s products
  • Support data-related engineering and operational efforts
  • Investigate and pursue strategic opportunities for the company
----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Work with stakeholders to understand their most critical data-related challenges.
  • Perform directed analyses to help Nuna’s commercial clients create better, data-driven health and benefits policies.
  • Work with engineering, and product management to develop methods that enhance the quality and value of data in Nuna’s data platform.
  • Support Nuna’s data-driven products with development of methods for measuring provider cost and quality and predicting the impact of proposed healthcare policy modifications.
  • Document and present resulting insights to clients with poise and authority.
------------
Requirements
------------

  • Advanced degree (PhD or Masters) in quantitative field (e.g. statistics, bioinformatics, computer science, or a quantitative health-related field)
  • Proficiency in SQL and R or a similar quantitative toolset (e.g. Python, SAS)
  • 3+ years of working with real-world datasets
  • Experience working on and delivering results in fast paced, stakeholder-facing settings
  • Clear communication skills and ability to break down problems and generate shared understanding
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work both in a team and in a self-directed manner
  • [Bonus] Prior work with healthcare related and/or financial data
Nuna is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics and/or veteran status.

description:
Under the direction of an assigned supervisor, perform extensive and technical institutional research and evaluation duties, including those related to state-mandated matriculation programs and activities; design and perform research and evaluation of college and groups; prepare reports for college personnel to fulfill compliance regulations and requirements; assure institutional and matriculation effectiveness for appropriate funding.

Representative Duties:

Perform extensive statistical and technical planning, design, research and evaluation duties related to institutional projects, including, but not limited to, state-mandated matriculation programs and activities and a variety of internal and external issues

Conduct reviews and assessment of academic and student services programs

Utilize accurate statistical procedures and sampling techniques for institutional research projects to assure high levels of confidence and reliability to survey results

Prepare reports for college personnel and state agencies to fulfill compliance regulations and requirements and to assure institutional matriculation effectiveness for appropriate funding

Prepare and revise reports with accompanying tabular, graphic and statistical contents, descriptions of analytical methods used and narrative of findings and conclusions for college and matriculation research and evaluation

Create, develop and maintain databases related to student enrollment projections, follow-up studies and analyses of program enrollment patterns

Collect, assemble and perform statistical analysis; determine appropriate statistics for data types including frequencies, chi-square, correlation, multiple regression and others

Identify and extract a variety of requested data; inspect and code data in preparation for analysis; create project documentation and databases

Operate a variety of software packages used on mainframe and personal computers for data analysis, data management, graphics and word processing

Communicate with appropriate college staff, stakeholders and other community college districts in analysis, compilation and interpretation of data

Attend meetings as assigned

Perform related duties as assigned

Any Combination Equivalent to:

Bachelors degree in statistics, mathematics, economics or social/educational research AND three years responsible experience involving related research and analysis activities and projects.

Knowledge of:

Standard and advanced statistical procedures related to sampling, correlation analysis, projections and other quantitative measures applied to education, social and program research and evaluation

Regression techniques, principles and tables

Research design for original data collection and analysis

Use of personal computers, mainframe and appropriate software packages

Standard statistical software

Technical report writing

Organization and presentation of narrative and statistical information

Technical aspects of research

Effective public speaking

Uses, capabilities, characteristics and limitations of computers and related equipment

Modern office procedures and methods

Correct English usage, spelling, grammar and punctuation

Ability to:

Perform extensive and technical research and evaluation tasks

Design forms and documents for various research purposes and target audiences

Design and perform research and evaluation of college matriculation and other institutional planning issues

Interpret and apply applicable sections of the State Education Code and other related laws and regulations

Interact, participate and conduct presentations to individuals, college groups, committees, organizations and others as assigned

Prepare comprehensive statistical and narrative reports

Utilize accurate and appropriate statistical procedures and sampling techniques

Create, develop and maintain computer databases

Create and maintain necessary research documentation, files and records related to research projects

Conduct meetings and interviews necessary for investigation and data collection

Work as a team member with other college research staff

Use tact, patience and courtesy

Operate a computer and related peripheral equipment

Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing

Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work

50.0

description:
Job Posting

Date: 2/27/2017

Position Title: Intake Coordinator

Number of Positions: 2

Full-Time or Part-Time: Full-Time

Business Address: 10800 Hole Ave Suite # 10 Riverside, CA 92505

Day/Hours Requirement: Must be available to work 8 hrs a day, 5 days week.

Department/Unit: Respite Services Department/Riverside Branch Office

Position Scope:

Under general direction of the Respite Program Coordinator or their designee, will perform a variety of duties assigned to client verification, intakes, home visitations, record management and other duties as assigned.

Essential Duties:

  • Receive, review and enter and verify all intakes.
  • Maintain ongoing communication (verbal and written) with consumer recruitment specialist, case workers, clients, the regional center, human resources and other departments.
  • Accurately maintain client files for all respite programs assuring that all contracts are current, client evaluation packets are updated on an annual basis and other required documents (e.g. CDER, IPP, etc.) have been completed and signed by the appropriate parties.
  • Assure all data pertaining to new and/or amended contracts, terminations and inactive clients have been accurately entered; periodically generate a revised client list.

  • Enter new client data into the appropriate respite system for both respite programs.

  • Responsible for conducting home visitations and conducting client-home evaluations.

Secondary Duties:

Physical Requirements: Visual/hearing ability sufficient to comprehend written/verbal and telephone communication. Ability to sit for long periods, standing, computer entry, walking, repeated bending, lifting and carrying up to 20 lbs, reaching. Ability to travel within and outside the county as needed.

title: Intake Coordinator

description:
Do you love data? Are you self-motivated and have a passion for marketing, advertising, data and campaign management? If you have experience managing campaigns and projects that deliver and surpass company business goals & expectations, Laserfiche wants you!

We are looking for an analytics-driven Digital Marketing Analyst to plan, analyze, and monitor digital marketing campaigns. You will manage all testing, analysis, and improvement of our various conversion points in the marketing funnel. This role will also be responsible for day-to-day creation, oversight, and management of PPC, SEM, SEO, Paid Social, remarketing, as well as campaign and website performance reporting. You will work closely with the Demand Generation and Digital Marketing team to identify and explore opportunities for new data sources and reporting functionality.

Responsibilities Include:
  • Responsible for planning, initiating, and managing targeted online media buys for Search, Display, and Social Media advertising campaigns
  • Work with a variety of software platforms, including Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Bing Ads, DSPs, PPC and social media platforms
  • Analyze website traffic and behavior to provide feedback and strategies to improve user experience and conversion rates using tools like heat mapping and A/B testing.
  • Ongoing analysis of SERPs and recommendation on how to improve results. Reporting on keyword trends, impact of changes and latest results
  • Utilize additional research tools to improve site rankings and make digital media campaigns more effective and efficient
  • Analyze campaign performance and recommend necessary optimizations. Stay apprised of data and analytics technologies within the digital marketing industry
  • Develop insights, Key Performance Indicators and visual dashboards; report to management and project teams
  • Work internally with staff to plan campaigns, collaborative development of ad content, and provide ongoing campaign reporting and recommendations
  • Collaborate with all departments by contributing to the development of target audiences and communication strategies designed to increase engagement, traffic, sales, and profitability

What You’ll Need:
  • BA/BS in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, Finance, Statistics or a related field of study
  • 5+ year’s professional experience in data analytics, digital strategy, paid media, and/or digital media. Preferably in B2B enterprise technology market
  • Experience with SEO analytics tools (e.g. Moz)
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g. pivot tables, macros, functions, etc.)
  • Experience with paid social media platforms (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter)
  • Deep digital marketing analytical skills
  • Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion and attribution modeling.
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate testing
  • Google AdWords and Analytics certified

Laserfiche complies with all Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action regulations. Laserfiche makes all employment decisions – such as recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, professional development practices, discipline and termination – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, pregnancy, age, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic characteristic, marital status, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law, except as may be permitted by law.

description:
At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Bioanalytical Chemist within our Analytical Chemistry group to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

The Associate Staff Scientist - Bioanalytical chemist will provide technical expertise, and hands-on bioanalytical method development and validation within the Analytical Chemistry laboratory in support of all of SGI’s business units’ needs. The successful candidate will have a strong background in bioanalytical chemistry with emphasis on protein mass spectrometry, and will be abreast of modern protein mass spectrometry tools and techniques. He or she will be responsible for designing and conducting laboratory experiments, interpreting complex datasets, reporting results to supervisors, and for supporting cross-functional collaborations across diverse research programs.

Required Skills:
• The Bioanalytical Associate Staff Scientist will develop and implement mass spec based analytical methods for full protein characterization including post-translational modifications.
• Expert knowledge in sample preparation for protein mass spec, mass spectrometer operation and data analysis is required.
• Expertise in LC MS/MS, GC/MS, HPLC, GC, IC, CE spectrophotometric and electrophoretic techniques including instrument operation and troubleshooting, data collection and interpretation, statistics, and analytics is also required.
• The candidate should be a hands-on LIMS user, and highly knowledgeable of relevant databases and data analysis software packages.
• The candidate should be experienced with documentation and capable of generating detailed protocols, and standard operating procedures for both complex and routine methods.
• The candidate should be able to work efficiently and collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment.
• Strong organizational skills, orientation to detail, ability to multitask and prioritize effectively are required.
• Critical thinking skills, a high degree of self-motivation, flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and resources are necessary.
• The candidate must possess excellent interpersonal skills, have strong oral and written communication abilities and will be expected to contribute significantly to the overall success of scientific program(s), on-going projects, critical patents, grants and scientific publications.

Required Experience:
• M.S. in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Physical Chemistry, or other relevant discipline with a minimum of 5 years of hands-on post-degree experience in protein based analytical chemistry, preferably in an industrial setting. Candidates holding B.Sc. degrees and having 8-10 years of relevant experience will be considered.
• Demonstrated state-of-the-art technical capabilities, particularly with protein mass spectrometry
• A strong, diverse knowledge of synthetic biology, biochemistry, inorganic chemistry, organic chemistry and protein chemistry.
• Experience with handling and analysis of complex biological samples
• Experience with modern mass spec based data acquisition and analysis software. Direct experience with Agilent instrumentation and data analysis software is highly desirable.
• Proven ability to operate, maintain, and troubleshoot versatile analytical instrumentation to maintain high standards of performance.
• Experience working with external contractors, such as partner companies or external laboratories involved in chemical analysis.

title: Bioanalytical Associate Staff Scientist, Analytical Chemistry

description:
Join Marin Software as a Data Scientist to apply your real world experience of data analysis and machine learning techniques on vast data sets.

Marin Software Engineers are passionate about designing quality code through a collaborative process. We enjoy intense mathematics and computer science challenges and approach these problems with creativity and teamwork. We believe Marin's impressive growth should not compromise its agility in responding to market trends. We are a company that believes in building a product for the long-term, and creating a company that can grow as the market matures.

Marin Software is rapidly building out our Big Data infrastructure. We are extending our data practices to handle billions of new records each day, a petabyte scale repository for analytics, and on-line applications for adaptive management of advertising campaigns. This platform enables Marin’s customers to advertise, analyze and attribute user actions across Search (Google, Bing, Yahoo, Baidu), Social (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn) and Display channels. We’ve already built out a 100+ node, petabyte size cluster, to give us access to these big data sets and now is a great opportunity to join as a key member of the team and be at the center of the action.

Opportunity

  • Enjoy solving challenging issues and building cutting edge technology.
  • Contending with state of the art approaches while dealing with real, heterogeneous big data.
  • Learning opportunities in technology and R&D.;
  • Work with a dynamic team, in very fast-paced release cycles and contribute actively to the success of the company.
  • Help build the next generation digital advertising technologies that allow handling billions of ad impressions every day, while improving advertisements return on investment.
Responsibilities

  • Work on all aspects of the design, development and delivery of machine learning (ML) enabled solutions for Ad tech
  • This includes problem definition, data acquisition, data exploration and visualization, feature engineering, experimenting with ML algorithms, evaluating and comparing metrics, deploying the models and iteratively improving the solution
  • Build scalable, stable, and efficient processes to collect, manipulate, present, and analyze large datasets for production
  • Design, code, validate, automate, and scale software in a collaborative environment
  • Passion for developing efficient, testable, scalable, and well-documented code
Requirements

  • 3+ years with PhD or 5+ years with MS degree (Computer Science/Mathematics/Statistics or other quantitative disciplines)
  • Spark MLlib and Scala experience
  • Distributed Systems (Hadoop, Spark, Giraph)
  • Extensive experience in Machine Learning (ML)
  • Familiarity with alternate ML toolkits such as R and scikit-learn
  • An interest in mathematical optimization using tools such as Maple
  • Experience with data analytics projects involving machine learning/optimization in production environments.
  • Publications within Machine Learning preferred
About Us

Marin Software Incorporated’s (NYSE: MRIN) mission is to give advertisers the power to drive higher efficiency, effectiveness, and transparency in their paid marketing programs that run on the world’s largest publishers. Marin provides industry leading enterprise marketing software for advertisers and agencies to measure, manage, and optimize more than $7.8 billion in annualized ad spend across the web and mobile devices. Offering an integrated SaaS ad management platform for search, social, and display advertising, Marin helps digital marketers improve financial performance, save time, and make better decisions. Advertisers use Marin to create, target, and convert precise audiences based on recent buying signals from users’ search, social, and display interactions. Headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in eight countries, Marin’s technology powers marketing campaigns around the globe. For more information about Marin Software, please visit: marinsoftware.com ( http://marinsoftware.com/ ).

Marin Software embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to diversifying our workforce, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status, and we operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Compensation

This is an on-site, full-time salaried position in our San Francisco Headquarters. Marin pays market-leading compensation with benefits to match. We provide Equity participation; comprehensive health plans including medical, vision, and dental; unlimited vacation and sick time; and reimbursement of 50% of monthly commuting costs for parking and/or mass transit up to the IRS limitations. Our world headquarters is located in the financial district of San Francisco, with remote offices in the world’s most important tech hubs, including Chicago, New York, Austin, and Portland. Our European headquarters is in London, with additional offices in Singapore, Paris, Hamburg, Sydney, and Tokyo.

title: Record Integrity Analyst - Full Time -

description:
No longer the realm of science-fiction, the time is now. Trusted Autonomy™ envisions a world where digital labor empowers human labor to ensure that downtime is always planned and productivity is always optimized.
To make this vision a reality Trusted Autonomy is building the world’s first Digital Labor Force™ using best in class cutting edge technologies that are leading the charge in defining the futuristic world of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). We empower a knowledge work force to make better quality and faster decisions by sorting through mounds of data.

We are networking fleets of cognitive computing machine agents for commercial and industrial market segments. Are you ready to be part of Trusted Autonomy’s success? Do you love working with cutting edge technologies? Embark on the journey with us at Trusted Autonomy. We own the mission to design and deliver better ways to deliver learning using deeper analytics, cognitive computing, and a personalized digital platform.

If you are a creative and confident data scientist who is curious about the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and who loves the collaborative nature of an early stage company, then we would love to meet you! Our mission is to be the universal leader in Artificial General Intelligence based on our proven cognitive and autonomous computing capabilities.

Our technologies include reasoning systems, natural language processing and understanding, machine to machine interfaces, embedded intelligence, expert systems and advanced analytics. Our culture is one of open communication, collaboration, curiosity, unbridled creativity and teamwork. We will apply our technologies to growing markets related to the Internet of Things, Data Security and Operational Efficiency.

Responsibilities:

• Contribute to solving business problems as part of a project team by framing the problems, determining intended approach and quantitative methods, evaluating the analytical solutions to the problems, and deploying them to production
• Evaluate commercial and open source approaches in Machine Learning, Data Mining, and Analytics
• Build scalable and high performance Machine Learning and Data Mining algorithms
• Test your hypotheses by developing prototypes, running offline experiments, as well as integrating potential solutions into live test environments
• Generate reports, develop presentations, and contribute to proposals
• Develop visualizations that provide insight into your work
• Document projects including business objective, data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics.

Minimum Experience and Qualifications:
• Experience with Time Series and streaming data science requried
• BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or Statistics with emphasis on data mining or machine learning
• 2-3 years of experience in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms
• Demonstrated experience with machine learning fundamentals and analysis tools (e.g., Matlab, SciPy, NumPy, etc..)
• Expertise in Machine Learning, Data Mining, and Analytics
• Building scalable and high performance Machine Learning and Data Mining algorithms
• Ability to communicate findings and results to both technical and non-technical audiences

Preferred Requirements:
• PhD, or MS + relevant work experience.
• Experience in HDFS, Hadoop, Spark.
• Knowledge of graph databases (Neo4j/Titan) and semantic frameworks
• Experience with Neural Nets, Streaming Data and Biomedical Analytics
title: Artificial Intelligence Data Scientist

description:
Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smart, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play. SUMMARY
Hulu’s Consumer Insights and Analytics team is seeking a Marketing Analytics Manager focused on Subscriber Growth who will be an exceptional addition to our Consumer Insights and Analytics team. As a Marketing Analytics Manager at Hulu, you will provide and advanced segmentation analyses identifying potential customers to acquire, where to reach them, optimal messaging/creative and upsell opportunities. You will also perform model builds, A/B tests, forecasting, spend optimization and ad hoc analyses focused on acquisition and retention. The right person for this role has exceptional analytical abilities (must have experience using an advanced analytics tool such as R, Python and/or SAS), craft a story with data, deliver actionable insights, have a strong work ethic, high sense of urgency and can work independently. He/she is detailed oriented and an excellent communicator. If you are someone who obsesses over details, thrives in a collaborative environment, and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges, then this is a great role for you. WHAT YOU’LL DO
Serve as a contact for the Marketing team as it relates to subscriber acquisition and retention analyses and model builds
Handle prioritization of various initiatives and communicate with key stakeholders regarding progress
Develop statistical and econometric models to inform marketing decisions
Produce advanced segmentation analyses using online and offline data using Advanced Analytic tools such as R, Python and/or SAS to identify users with high propensity for subscription and retention and key drivers
Use existing (and build new) predictive models to quantify estimated lift due to marketing activities
Produce and deliver actionable insights using unstructured large datasets
Ensure that marketing campaigns are optimized against data findings, including identification of best-performing media sites, ad creative versions, and offers
Communicate findings to executives in a simple, clear and concise manner WHAT TO BRING
7+ years of experience in a highly analytical environment
Acquisition/Retention focused analytics experience is a must, entertainment is preferred
Machine Learning and Data Mining expertise required
Bachelor’s degree required, major or emphasis in Statistics, Accounting, Finance, or Economics from a top-tier university a plus. Graduate degree strongly preferred.
Exceptional analytical abilities and high proficiency with R/Python/SAS, SQL, Tableau or other BI and/or data visualization tools, Excel and PowerPoint
Demonstrated experience with Google Analytics preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
Strong work ethic and ability to work extended hours
Detail oriented and exceptional organizational skills
A high sense of urgency and the ability to multi-task
Ability to work independently and be nimble

Job Summary

Working independently, the person in this position is the Plant Collection IST of the Department of Biological Sciences living plant collections (Greenhouse and Arboretum) and is responsible for the care and maintenance of the permanent plant teaching collection.

This person also provides additional plant materials at the proper stage of development for laboratory experiments in General Biology, Plant Anatomy and Physiology, Plant Taxonomy, Genetics, and Ecology, and for faculty and student research projects. The individual in this position is also responsible for assisting in the care and maintenance of the University Arboretum, including supervision of student assistants and curation of living specimens and exhibits. This person is responsible for ordering all supplies for the greenhouses, and for the proper functioning and maintenance of all greenhouse equipment. This person supervises student assistants employed to assist with greenhouse and arboretum operations. This individual also provides tours to off campus groups.

For more information on the Department of Biological Sciences, visit: http://www.csus.edu/nsm/departments/biosci.html

Benefits/FLSA

This position is covered by health benefits, and is non-exempt, (eligible for overtime compensation) according to the Fair Labor Standards Act.

For more information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit:
http://www.csus.edu/hr/departments/benefits/benefitsprograms.html

Minimum Qualifications

Knowledge and Abilities:
- Knowledge of the principles of performing support services; knowledge of the principles, methods, and techniques related to the discipline and the curriculum; knowledge of the materials and supplies in the curriculum and the curriculum and their uses.
- Ability to plan, organize, and schedule activities; ability to operate technical equipment related to the discipline; ability to maintain records; ability to adjust and perform simple maintenance of technical and scientific equipment.

AND

Experience:
- Equivalent to three years of experience providing instructional support services for a related unit or discipline, or in producing materials or supplies or repairing equipment in a discipline related to the area to which assigned.
or
- Equivalent to two years of college with 16 semester units in courses involving extensive use of materials, supplies, or equipment and in a discipline related to the area may be substituted for one year of the required experience.
or
- Equivalent to four years of college with 16 semester units in courses involving extensive use of materials, supplies, or equipment and in a discipline related to the area to which assigned may be substituted for two years of the required experience.

Required Qualifications

1. Equivalent to three years of experience providing instructional support services for a plant sciences related program in a greenhouse or in producing materials or supplies and maintenance/repair of greenhouse environmental control systems.
OR
2. The equivalent of two years of college (60 semester units) with at least 16 semester units of biology, botany and horticulture can substitute for one year of experience.
OR
3. The equivalent of four years of college (120 semester units) with at least 16 semester units of biology, botany and horticulture can substitute for two years of experience.

4. Knowledge of the principles of performing support services for Biological Sciences class support
5. Knowledge of the materials and supplies from the greenhouse as it relates to the Biological Sciences curriculum
6. Knowledge of propagation and germination techniques for maintenance of the greenhouse collection
7. Knowledge of the principles, methods, and techniques related to greenhouse maintenance and pest management
8. Knowledge of pest management strategies within a greenhouse setting
9. Knowledge of county and state regulations related to pesticide use and application
10. Candidate must possess or have the ability to obtain a Qualified Applicator Certificate for pesticide use through the California Department of Food and Agriculture
11. Ability to plan, organize, and schedule greenhouse activities
12. Ability to maintain records of plant specimens
13. Ability to curate plant collections for educational use (both for classes and the general public)
14. Ability to design or modify both indoor and outdoor environmental controls to maintain a dynamic living collection
15. Ability to operate equipment and automated systems for environmental controls within the greenhouse (watering systems, evaporative coolers, humidifiers, fans and vents that are controlled by timers and other automated systems)
16. Ability to perform simple maintenance of environmental control systems for both indoor and outdoor living collections

Preferred Qualifications

17. Extensive knowledge of horticulture and plant taxonomy, as well as greenhouse experience such that the individual can develop and maintain permanent collections of exotic and native plants within the greenhouse, arboretum nursery and in the grounds surrounding the greenhouse
18. Evidence of ability to assume responsibility for proper operation of all greenhouse equipment as well as the ability to identify and treat disease and pest problems, and cultivate specimens for use by the University
19. Evidence of ability to cultivate, propagate and deliver plant materials to courses in the Biological Sciences, as well as leading tours to both on- and off-campus groups, working with students and faculty on research projects
20. Evidence of ability to design, fabricate and/or modify equipment due to the dynamic nature of a living collection
21. Evidence of ability to develop educational and/or interpretive programs associated with the living plant collections
22. Experience ordering greenhouse and plant propagation supplies
23. B.S. or B.A. degree in biology, botany, horticulture or a related discipline
24. Experience working with students, particularly from a diverse student population

License/Certification

Must possess a valid State of California driver's license and maintenance of safe driving record required.

Candidate must possess or have the ability to obtain a Qualified Applicator Certificate for pesticide use through the California Department of Food and Agriculture.

Eligibility Verification

Candidate selected will be required to provide proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.

California State University, Sacramento is not a sponsoring agency for Staff or Management Positions (i.e. H1-B VISAS)

Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current California State University, Sacramento employees who apply for the position.
