description: The Mortgage Trader is responsible for daily management of bulk bid requests from approved clients. This includes scrubbing and mapping bid tapes, maintaining pricing models, accurately pricing loans and returning bids to clients in a timely manner. The Mortgage Trader will also be responsible for maintaining minimum margin thresholds and volume requirements for the bulk platform. Additional responsibilities include maintaining a database of all loans that come through the platform, conducting statistical analysis on the portfolio and reporting results to management. The Mortgage Trader will work closely with the Capital Markets team to optimize pricing and execution strategies. Essential Functions Monitor and track all requests submitted on a daily basis. Accurately map, price and prepare bid requests. Return them to the client in a timely manner. Prepare confirmations for loans traded through the platform. Update margins in hedging model. Update pricing in the loan origination system. Track loans and work with clients to ensure the loans are submitted in a timely manner. Handle all change requests on loans traded through the platform in accordance with the Commitment Policy. Validate pricing at Final Price Check Develop and maintain relationship with bulk clients. Ensure adherence to company hedge and pricing policies. Ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Complete all required compliance training. Maintain knowledge of and adhere to company internal compliance policies and procedures. Take responsibility to keep up to date with changing regulations and policies. Required Skills and Experience:
title: Mortgage Trader

description:
Amazon is all in on games.

2016 has been a year of firsts for Amazon Games - Orange County, and for gaming at Amazon. In February, Amazon released Lumberyard, a free, cloud connected game engine. In April, we moved to a state-of-the-art game studio and streaming facility. Later this year, we will reveal the first of our new projects to the world. What milestones will you be a part of?

We believe the evolution that began with arcade communities a quarter at a time, growing to the live streams and esports of today, will continue to a future where everyone is a gamer and every gamer can create, compete, collaborate and connect with others at massive scales. If you share our belief that games will produce some of the future’s most influential voices in media and art, come join us. At Amazon Games, Orange County, you’ll have the power of Amazon Web Services’ cloud, Twitch, Amazon Lumberyard, and our digital and physical media publishing infrastructure available as raw material to forge a future filled with amazing experiences for players, broadcasters and creators. We are building teams with the industry’s best to help us create and support AAA PC games that attempt to evolve gameplay and unite players with community focused online experiences.

As a game BI Analyst, you will live in our data, surface vital insights about our players to the game team and champion data-driven decision making. You will work closely with many product owners, riffing off concepts and hunches, so you are turning ambiguity into data. Your long-term perspective leads to insights around understanding retention and engagement over months and years of a player lifespan, and you use your passion for playing the game to turn data into player narratives. If this sounds like you, come join our team!

Job Description
  • Be a passionate advocate for leveraging data, analysis and statistics as a means to informing, measuring, tracking, testing and reporting on the performance of the game as well as specific initiatives within the product
  • Work closely with key decision makers to understand goals, identify opportunities within player data, translate product needs into analytical solutions, and present discoveries back for consideration
  • Aggregate, analyze, and report vast quantities of data in an organized and visual format that clearly communicates what players are experiencing in the game
  • Create custom visualizations that effectively convey insight across different audiences and addresses game-specific data needs
  • Work with data from multiple sources looking for insight across all player experiences in and out of the game, and use the insight to drive the cross-discipline decision making processes
  • Efficiently and effectively respond to ad hoc analytics requests that address the underlying product questions rather than just the data request; be able to prioritize requests and manage data customer expectations
  • Derive telemetry requirements based on analytical needs and work with engineers to implement telemetry calls to capture data for analyses.
  • Conduct deep investigation into the data collection to ensure data fidelity

Basic Qualifications
  • 3+ years in big-data analysis
  • Strong technical understanding and usage of SQL
  • Experience with columnar database such as Redshift, postgres, Vertica, BiqQuery, etc.
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau and Kibana
  • Experience with advanced analytical techniques, such as regression analysis, predictive modeling, segmentation, forecasting, hypothesis testing
  • BS in Computer Science, Statistics, or similar quantitative field

Preferred Qualifications
  • MS in Computer Science, Statistics, or similar quantitative field
  • Experience with live service video game business intelligence
  • Experience delivering beloved and commercially successful free-to-play games
  • Avid gamer with passion for competitive games
  • Flexible with changes in criteria and goals within a fast-moving work environment
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity – Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation
title: Game BI Analyst - Breakaway

description: Job Description
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
Celgene is a global biopharmaceutical company leading the way in medical innovation to help patients live longer, better lives. Our purpose as a company is to discover and develop therapies that will change the course of human health. We value our passion for patients, quest for innovation, spirit of independence and love of challenge. With a presence in more than 70 countries - and growing - we look for talented people to grow our business, advance our science and contribute to our unique culture.

Overview:

We seek a talented, collaborative Bioinformatician to participate in algorithm design and implementation, development and maintenance of processing pipelines and data analysis, with a focus on Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) and data integration. This individual will play a key scientific role enabling innovative computational analysis strategies across a wide range of data sources to empower data-driven decisions and improve therapeutic outcomes in complex diseases of unmet medical need.

Expertise in the analysis of large genomic datasets, and contemporary methods for processing, analysis and integration of NGS data are prerequisite. The position would suit an individual with exceptional NGS bioinformatics, communication and collaboration skills.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

Working alongside computational, biology and clinical researchers across the Celgene Research and Early Development organization, responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Pursue leading applied computational genomics approaches aligned with key Celgene scientific objectives.
  • Design, implement and apply novel algorithms for data mining and data analysis of Genomics data and provide written documentation and specifications.
  • Apply contemporary methods for genomic data processing, analysis and mining. Develop and maintain NGS data processing pipelines.
  • Guide and implement genomic profiling plans including integration and processing of high quality genomic data from internal and external sources.
  • Contribute to presentation and reporting of methods, results and conclusions to a publishable standard.
  • Participate in design and analysis of vendor performance evaluation projects.

*LI-MG2

BIO-US PRIORITY

Qualifications
  • Ph.D. in bioinformatics, computational biology, genetics, computer science or related discipline at a recognized higher-education establishment.
  • 6+ years relevant post-doctoral experience of inter-disciplinary bioinformatics research, in academic or industry research scenarios.
  • Publication record in analysis of next-generation sequencing data.
  • Skilled in probability and statistics. Good knowledge of molecular biology, genetics, and genomics.
  • Experience with high performance computing, including cloud computing (e.g. AWS) and cloud HPC.
  • Comfortable working in Linux, with working knowledge of Windows/MacOS. Excellent programming skills using scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, R/Bioconductor, Matlab).
  • Good knowledge of contemporary database structures. Experience with SQL (Postgres, MySQL etc) and noSQL (MongoDB, SOLR etc) databases would be advantageous.
  • Expert knowledge of current bioinformatics trends, public genomic tools, databases and utilities, with a focus on Next Generation Sequencing and genome annotation.
  • Experience developing and integrating data analysis tools to manipulate large datasets.
  • Motivated, innovative and strong team player able to function with a high degree of independence. Demonstrable ability for deep and creative thinking.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Fluent verbal and written English language skills required.

Celgene is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Celgene complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must have authorization to work for Celgene in the U.S.
title: Senior Scientist, Research Analytics (Bioinformatics)

description:
Food Access Program Coordinator

Sacramento Food Bank & Family Services (SFBFS), a local non-profit organization serving families and individuals in need since 1976, offers fifteen diverse programs and services at two facilities in Sacramento. A staff of more than 80 and several thousand volunteers accomplish SFBFS’ mission of assisting families in need by alleviating their immediate pain and problems and by moving them toward self-sufficiency and financial independence. For more information, please visit http://www.sacramentofoodbank.org

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

SFBFS is hiring a Food Access Program Coordinator to oversee our Food for Seniors program. This program aims to increase the consumption of healthy foods among Sacramento County residents who are 60 years old and older. The ideal candidate is passionate about SFBFS’ mission and is ready to help lead our community to better health.

The Food Access Program Coordinator is responsible for the following:

  • Oversee program logistics for SFBFS’ Food for Seniors program. This includes:
  • Expanding SFBFS’ Food for Seniors program through the implementation of a new grant.
  • Developing and maintaining relationships with existing partners and cultivating partnerships with additional senior-serving organizations and housing complexes.
  • Training partner organizations on program requirements.
  • Conducting site visits of Food for Seniors distribution locations to ensure products are being distributed safely and according to program requirements.
  • Collaborating with the Food Access Programs Manager on the evaluation of program activities.
  • Managing monthly statistics for the Food for Seniors
  • Keeping accurate records of program activities and assisting in the completion of reports.
  • Represent SFBFS at meetings and presentations related to the Food for Seniors program.
  • Attend SFBFS’ staff meetings and recommended trainings.
  • Participate in community outreach events, as needed.
  • Assist with other SFBFS programs and activities, as needed.
  • Other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Passion for nutrition and/or food access issues
  • Bachelor's degree and a minimum of two years of related work experience in program implementation:
  • Ability to:
  • Work with a diverse community
  • Work independently with limited supervision
  • Respond to unanticipated events
  • Maintain accurate records
  • Safely lift or carry items weighing up to 40 pounds.
  • Detail-oriented, excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to multi-task
  • Leadership skills and excellent decision-making abilities
  • Willingness to cross-train and learn other positions within the organization
  • Reliable transportation and a valid California driver’s license and insurance
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Publisher, PowerPoint)
  • Successfully pass background/fingerprint check

ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bilingual English/Spanish desired
  • Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Education, Social Work, Public Health, or other related field
  • Experience working on food access issues
  • Food handler certification
  • Knowledge of Sacramento County

POSITION DETAILS:

  • Location: Position is based primarily at Sacramento Food Bank & Family Services’ campus in North Sacramento.
  • Full-time; non-exempt hourly position with comprehensive benefits. Typical schedule is 40 hours a week Monday – Friday, 8:30 a.m. – 5 p.m.; occasional weekends, nights and holidays are required to support SFBFS’ mission.

Applicants must include resume, cover letter, three professional references and SFBFS’ Employment Application (found on www.sacramentofoodbank.org under Employment) by February 24, 2017 for consideration.

No phone calls please.

Job Type: Full-time
title: Food Access Program Coordinator

description:
Bioinformatics Scientist, Tertiary Analysis
We are seeking a Bioinformatics Scientist enthusiastic at automating clinical relevant annotation and interpretation for NGS data, providing insights from knowledge mining databases/literatures to bridge genotype and phenotype, performing data analytics on clinical and genomic data, and ensuring the quality of our informatics platform for personalized medicine. You will work with our highly professional teams in both science and engineering to deliver the best genomic solution to the field.

How you will spend your time:
Developing, enhancing and automating annotation and interpretation methods
Data mining and analytics on public and internal data sources
Deriving/comparing quality metrics for evaluating tertiary analysis pipelines
Prototyping interpretation workflows through collaborations

Experience, skills, talents you will need:
Good knowledge in tertiary analysis tools/algorithms/databases for sequencing data
Skills in data analytics or data science, e.g. predictive modeling from clinical data
Experience with content curation, especially in oncology is a plus
Good knowledge in statistics and genomics
Familiarity with NGS secondary analysis is a plus
Proficiency in programming, e.g. Python, R, Java
Familiarity with database management is a plus, e.g. SQL, etc.
Strong verbal and written communication skill and experienced working collaboratively
Team player known for your fanatical attention to detail at scale in a fast-paced environment
PhD in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics or equivalent field; or Masters with >3 years of experience
About Us
You will join a group of scientists in our Data Insights team dedicated to building innovative products and approaches for the analysis and interpretation of next-generation sequencing data.
The science of interpreting the human genome is an exciting work in progress. Next-generation sequencing and genomic technologies are providing us with unprecedented visibility into the origins of health and disease. However, the main challenge is enabling the analysis, management and interpretation of massive datasets being produced by scientists and researchers around the world.
We know the ability to analyze and manage these datasets will revolutionize how we diagnose disease, develop drugs, and treat patients, especially in complex cases such as cancer.
With a strong interdisciplinary knowledge in science and technology, we are elevating the speed and quality of genomic analysis, bringing us one step closer to solutions that will change and save lives.
The Data Insights team is part of Roche Sequencing and located in Belmont, California.
Why work with us?
Because you have worked hard to master your craft but you want to do more and make your mark in this world. You are relentless in the pursuit of excellence and you are ready to code to cure.

Outside Recruiters: Please do not contact Bina Technologies employees with unsolicited resumes. Any resume sent by an outside agency without an explicit signed Bina generated agency agreement in place will be considered unsolicited and will not be eligible for payment.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individualâs race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
title: Tertiary Analysis - Bioinformatics Scientist

description:
Uber’s Risk Team is at the forefront of one of the world’s biggest challenges. Every day we process millions of mobile transactions in over 75 different countries, while also issuing driver-partner payouts on weekly, and in some cases, daily basis. As we grow and rapidly expand our transaction base across emerging products, we face new and interesting situations that many companies have never encountered. Our goal is to deliver innovative risk management in the two-sided marketplace to maximize legitimate revenue and sustainable growth.

This is a fast-paced, hands-on role for an experienced fraud or risk professional who can successfully manage large projects across product, engineering, data science, finance, security, and operations stakeholders in a complex environment. As an owner of key loss metrics, you should have the analytics experience, intellectual curiosity, and resourcefulness to identify, measure, and mitigate new and emerging loss vectors. In this role, you will serve as the global subject matter expert and thought leader on techniques that mitigate risk of financial losses while also maintaining a positive user experience and enabling Uber to continue making big bold bets.What You’ll DoEstablish a Foundation by designing, coordinating, and implementing Uber’s framework for mitigating the risk of fraud and financial abuse across riders, drivers, merchants, and affiliatesBuild Our Business Strategy by collaborating with product and engineering teams to define product roadmaps and strategy, while designing solutions that prevent, detect, or action against fraudulent or suspicious user behaviorDeep Dive into Data through systematic and ad hoc analyses that identify root causes of loss segments and estimate the impact of new products and processesAnalyze and Design Rules that introduce appropriate amounts of friction for suspicious Uber users based on high risk user characteristics and machine learning modelsCommunicate Results on a regular basis to stakeholders around the world, including executive leadershipExecute on Projects by implementing policy proposals, developing the user support experience, and coordinating work across teams to deliver on short- and long-term risk, fraud, and payments efforts What We’re Looking For In You 5+ years experience in Risk Management (payment fraud, Incentive or Promotion abuse, collusion). Experience with merchant, seller, or publisher fraud.Quantitative background in statistics, math, computer science, business, or related disciplinesStrong analytical skillset and experience with analytics tools (Excel, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, and other statistical or data analysis packages)Exceptional communication and presentation skillsCreative problem solving and critical thinking skills with a bias toward action and a get things done attitudeTeam player mindset that takes ownership for a collective outcome and helps others along the wayAbility to take initiative in a fast-moving environment and independently make decisions or take risks with incomplete informationExperience leading a team a plusPERKS: Employees are given Uber credits every month.Ground floor opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the company.The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product you built.

We’re not just another social web app, we’re moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally.Sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment.BENEFITS (U.S.): 401(k) plan, gym reimbursement, nine paid company holidays.Full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs.Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it.
title: Senior Risk Analyst - Fraud, Abuse, and Security

description:
The Video and Display Advertising team builds the large-scale platforms and products that enable selling, targeting, serving, understanding, and optimizing display and video advertising across Yahoo sites and other web properties and apps. We live and breathe âbig dataâ and deep science, delivering results for advertisers, revenue for publishers, and relevant, engaging experiences for consumers.

A Little About Us

The Video and Display Advertising Unit is responsible for delivering market-leading advertising and audience analytics technologies, platforms, solutions, and services. Our advertising products deliver billions of ad impressions to hundreds of millions of users everyday, enabling hundreds of thousands of advertisers to effectively connect with the right audience at the right time across devices and across the globe. Our audience analytics products analyze multi-terabytes of data everyday and deliver insight on the preference, intent, interest, and behavior of users to help Yahoo and its customers drive user growth, engagement and value.

A Lot About You

We are seeking data mining scientists and engineers to mine the massive amount of data at Yahoo and apply innovative statistics, machine learning algorithms, advanced control theory, and optimization algorithms to develop advertising tools and solutions that will automate and optimize critical decisions in the end-to-end online advertising process that help publishers as well as advertisers achieve their respective business objectives. They will be working on a variety of online advertising problems such Real Time Bidding strategy optimization, response prediction, modeling and simulation of dynamic systems of advertising, design and development of intelligent control algorithms for optimizing campaign ROI, etc.

The successful candidates will be those who are curious, quick learners, self-motivated, and creative thinkers. They shall have broad knowledge about statistics, machine learning, advanced control theory, optimization, statistics, and experimental design. More importantly, they will be excellent practitioners of these knowledge, and get enormous satisfaction from implementing their solutions in production and seeing them make a real difference to the business everyday.

Your Day
  • Collaborate closely with business partners to identify strategic opportunities for applying innovative algorithms to help advertisers to optimize the ROI of their advertising campaigns, allow publishers to maximize monetization and engagement of their users, and enable all participants in the marketplace to operate efficiently
  • Analyze petabyte size data to identify useful relations, patterns, and features that are predictive of user behaviors, preferences, intents, interests, brand affiliation, and etc. Continuously identify and explore new and unconventional data sources
  • Apply advanced statistical, machine learning, and other types of analytical techniques to audience analytics to improve inventory forecasting, audience segmentation, audience extension, trust and safety, and etc
  • Design, develop, and implement statistical and machine learning models to predict competitive bidding landscape, click through rate, conversion/action rate, ad relevance to user, supply and demand risk, bot detection, and etc
  • Abstract the objectives and constraints of critical business decisions for advertisers and publishers, and formulate them in the form of control and optimization problems. Develop advanced adaptive control and self-learning algorithms and experiment design methodologies to solve the identified problems
  • Model campaign behaviors and build simulation environment to test closed-loop performance of new control and optimization algorithms.
  • Develop innovative techniques to collect performance data and measure the impact of online advertising. Design effective experiments to continuously explore the efficiency frontier of advertising performance
  • Work with engineering and operations teams to build systems and operational capabilities for implementing models and algorithms, and monitoring and evaluating their health and effectiveness in production.

You Must Have
  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, Control Theory, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field
title: Research Engineer- Advertising Products

description:

Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field. Equivalent to two years of full-time analytical or administrative customer service experience which includes supervising others and planning and organizing daily tasks. Additional experience in Customer Service, Conference Administration or Guest Relations may be substituted for required education, on a year for year basis.

title: Guest Services Coordinator (JID 5990)

description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data (Text and/or Image), and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying machine learning technologies, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products.
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • Extending companyâs data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

Qualifications
  • 3+ years commercial machine learning experience.
  • Solid foundation in machine learning, data structures, algorithms, and software design.
  • A strong understanding of machine learning theory.
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as scikit-learn, Google tensorflow, R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, Excellence in at least two of these is highly desirable
  • Great communication skills
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, Hive, Pig or PostgreSQL.
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase is a plus
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good scripting and programming skills. Expert at Python and/or Java.
  • Data-oriented personality
  • Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot is a plus.
title: Data Scientist 3

description:
The Senior Data Scientist is part of a team that develops and refines data-driven models that power ID Analytics’ products and services, improves data technology infrastructure, and communicates ongoing research and analysis to stakeholders. The Senior Data Scientist implements statistical algorithms and machine learning models, explores and understands new data sources, and regularly works with out-of-memory data sets. The Senior Data Scientist also keeps abreast of emerging industry trends and best practices in data science and helps drive adoption of new technologies.

This position requires working knowledge of business needs and the ability to work independently to design solution paths that achieve the needs of the customer without explicit guidance from business personnel. Additionally, this position will provide technical leadership to other scientists within the organization. Depending on the assignment, frequent client interaction may be required to complete deliverables.

Responsibilities:
  • Analysis, design, development, test, troubleshooting, and documentation of complex data systems that may involve one or more of the following: predictive score models, feature extraction, data-driven analysis, machine learning, decision making, and related utilities.
  • Completing written documentation and reports of results in the form of business reports, internal technology white papers, and statistical system documentation.
  • Technical leadership of other scientists and data analysts in problem design and building, evaluation and deployment of models, and other analytical projects.
  • Independent resolution of problems or coordinating score model design architecture, as well as designing solution approaches to complex applied problems.
  • Devising new approaches to solving difficult statistical modeling problems. This includes new model concepts and designs, such as different targets and objective functions, and new or different uses of data sources.
  • Critical reviews of data experiments to ensure accuracy, completeness, and feasibility.
  • Identifying and deploying new algorithms or combinations of algorithms in creative ways to achieve performance improvement.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
  • Master’s degree in a relevant technical discipline (Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics or similar field) with at least 4 years of job experience or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical discipline with 6-10 years of job experience. PhD degree in a relevant technical discipline with at least 2 years of experience preferred.
  • 2-3 years of experience using machine learning to build predictive models that solve business problems.
  • Proven ability to apply modern data exploration and visualization techniques to deliver actionable insights.
  • 2 years of experience with mainstream programming languages, such as Java, Python, and Scala, in a collaborative environment using software development best practices such as version control and testing.
  • 1-3 years of experience using cloud or distributed computing frameworks such as Hadoop, AWS/EMR, BigQuery, etc.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and oral) including the ability to communicate complex technical or statistical concepts to a non-technical audience.
  • Fraud and risk management industry experience in developing scoring models is preferred.
title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
The Senior HIM Analyst is responsible for maintaining and distributing accurate and timely hospital
statistics (i.e.: census and hospital occupancy) as well as the activities of the HIM Revenue Management Team. Performs quantitative and qualitative analysis on patient records in accordance with federal and state regulations, the Joint Commission, CHLA Medical Staff Office (MSO) rules and regulations, and
division-specific policies and procedures. Revenue management duties include retrieval of records and receipt of the visit information necessary for coding inpatient, ambulatory surgery, outpatient and emergency room visits for the coding staff, which will ensure accuracy and timely coding of hospital records. Position is also responsible for reviewing medical records, identifying and abstracting a specific data from within the medical record for data entry into Health Data Management (HDM). Maintains a current, thorough knowledge and understanding of the hospital electronic medical record (EMR). Promotes positive customer relations through prompt and courteous service in this fast paced, high volume, and patient/customer centered environment.

Minimum Education/Training Required : High School Graduate, Bachelor's Degree preferred

Minimum Experience Required :
At least three years in a health care setting in a role involving qualitative and quantitative analysis, and exposure to analyzing and fulfilling moderate to complex health care data requests, and to revenue and data quality management data requirement

Skills and Abilities Required : Demonstrated detail orientation; demonstrated strong written and
verbal communication skills; demonstrated independent problem solving ability and success; demonstrated self-directed and self-starting ability; demonstrated initiative-taking; demonstrated ability
to make independent decisions; demonstrated ability to work well with others at all levels; demonstrated creative and innovative thinking. Demonstrated high attention to detail and accuracy in a fast paced, open environment; demonstrated intermediate to advanced level MS Word, Excel, and Outlook skills.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality, including HIPAA confidentiality. Demonstrated ability to satisfactorily handle multiple interruptions and distractions with equanimity and without a reduction in
accuracy and productivity. Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed productivity and accuracy standards. demonstrated excellent interpersonal and patient/customer service skills. Prefer experience with and working knowledge of HIPAA. Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Suite, most importantly
Microsoft Excel.. Ability to attend ongoing PHIS training through CHA offered
courses, webinars and conferences as needed and approved.
title: Sr. HIM Analyst

description:
THE DEPARTMENT:

Enterprise Applications is a department within IT Applications and has responsibility to provide systems analysis, programming, some reporting, technical support, consultation and testing of the enterprise-wide system for the campus. Currently Oracle's PeopleSoft System is used by the campus for Financials, Human Resources and Student Administration. The unit assists in and tracks testing protocols related to patches and upgrades in PeopleSoft modules; supports the development of dashboards and database reports; works with departments, users and subject matter experts to improve functionality and troubleshoot issues as they arise; administers user security for PeopleSoft, tracks technology projects and tasks, coordinates resources to assure the timely delivery of services and project completion.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Senior Analyst/Programmer composes and develops numerous complex applications reports and queries from the PeopleSoft student information system to assist the office and other departments with data needs; designs, creates, and modifies SQRs, App Engine modules, both ad-hoc and regular reports via PS Query Structured Query Language (SQL); provides training and assists colleagues in learning Application Engine, PeopleCode, SQR, Bl Publisher, and Fluid Technology; serves as consultant to the Subject Matter Functional Users; develops applications or a reporting mechanism to them in data analysis and/or data decision making; and utilize the latest technology tools to simplify their data processing needs; develops, maintains, and utilizes assessment tools that measure staff performance, effectiveness of processes, timeliness of notification to students, and general office productivity. The incumbent takes both a strong Technical Support and Co-Lead role for PeopleSoft implementation and ongoing upgrades, modifications, enhancements related to Campus Solutions, Human Capital Management, and Common Financials System; in addition, the incumbent will utilize Integration Broker for Student Financials, Common Financials System, the separation of Campus Solutions and Human Recourses Management, and to 3rd Party Systems participates as a member of the Enterprise Applications Team in planning, prototyping and rolling out new upgrades; evaluates and tests systems and assists other offices in the same manner; may require the ability to evaluate and direct the activities of others; and assists in report development as needed during peak periods to meet the cyclical demands of the campus. The incumbent will takes a lead role in development, design, testing and implementation of an electronic communication platform for Financial Aid, Student Financials, Common Financials System, and the Enrollment Cluster for both students and staff; serves as liaison between Financial Aid & Scholarships, Student Accounts and Cashiering, and interconnected offices such as Registrar's Office, Admissions and Outreach, Orientation Services, IRAP and University Accounting Services; works closely with programmers and analysts to coordinate the interface with PC-based electronic data exchange programs and PeopleSoft, assists with the implementation of new PeopleSoft modules or the modification of those that do not meet current needs; designs and develops fully integrated systems that enable staff to easily exchange data between Cal Poly Pomona and external parties, and ensure the integrity of the data exchanged; and demonstrates leadership in the development of solutions that combine information and ideas in new, unprecedented ways that will be mutually beneficial to students and the University. The incumbent coordinates, schedules and tests regulatory upgrades to the Oracle/PeopleSoft Campus Solutions, Human Capital Management, and Common Financials System; ensures that the validation/setup tables are reviewed and updated in preparation for each processing cycle; troubleshoots data integrity problems or issues relating to incorrect calculations on student records; coordinates security access to new forms and functions to staff members; troubleshoots database and script failures, and develops improvements to existing forms and functions; develops database links to other systems such as Bronco Direct, the PeopleSoft Reporting Database, and Common Financials System; maintain user training and documentation on current systems; and develop database scripts as required to update data and maintain data integrity in the database. The incumbent works in conjunction with peers in Enrollment Services, Student Accounts and Cashiering, Human Resources and University Accounting Services to facilitate business process based on extensive knowledge of campus-defined systems including, but not limited to Oracle/PeopleSoft and other non-PeopleSoft Systems. Creates and maintains interfaces between multiple campus systems. Identifies causes of failure and corrects problems when interface between two or more supported campus systems fails. Serves as the primary technical resource for the investigation, evaluation, design, development, operation, implementation, and maintenance of process automation. Analyzes existing departmental information needs, and creates and modify SQRs, SQL or PS Query reports, BI Publisher Reports and Reporting Systems for trend analysis and decision-making. Analyzes and manages existing databases and develops new databases as needed. Develops interfaces between diverse systems using ODBC (Open Database Connectivity) and other connectivity tools. Leads the programming and testing of new applications, if needed, or modifies and enhances existing programs to ensure project success. Works closely with programmers and analysts to coordinate the interface with PC-based electronic data exchange programs and PeopleSoft, assists with the implementation of new PeopleSoft modules or the modification of those that do not meet current needs. Designs and develops fully integrated systems that enable staff to easily exchange data between Cal Poly Pomona and external parties, and ensures the integrity of the data exchanged. As part of the Enterprise Applications Team, the incumbent participates in job rotations and support cross training efforts; learns new technologies, tools and regulations required to support the Oracle/PeopleSoft Campus Solutions (CS), Human Capital Management Systems (HCM), and the Common Financials System (CFS); works closely with various System Leads and Subject Matter Experts to fully understand the Campus Solution, Human Resources and Common Financials System; there is a need to understand the data flow under the Oracle/PeopleSoft Suit; and it is imperative to understand the flow of information between across the Applications. Consistent with job classification, the incumbent assumes and carries out other duties and responsibilities at the discretion of the Associate CIO of IT Applications or the Director of Enterprise Applications; serves on committees, attends and participates in departmental and campus meetings/events/activities; participates in the CMS Teleconferences with respect to Financial Aid and Student Financials; utilizes advanced communication and listening skills through effective interpersonal interactions, and written correspondence with Department, Division, University staff, and external contacts in person, by telephone and via mail/email; consistent with job, operational, or project duties, communicates with management staff and other appropriate functional managers regarding imminent systems, data, or security problems, as directed may facilitate alternatives; uses sound judgment and decision making in order to find solutions and implement appropriate and timely resolutions; and perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Information Systems, Engineering or a related field with five years of relevant full-time experience OR twelve years of relevant full-time experience. Advanced knowledge of the work area demonstrated by an understanding and use of the advanced principles and theories; ability to integrate and apply work related knowledge to achieve innovative solutions, anticipate the impact of problems and solutions on other systems; investigate and research new systems and technologies, develop complex information technology systems and solutions; understand problems from a broad perspective; ability to explore, conceive and implement solutions and ideas in new ways; ability to predict and anticipate problems and create proactive solutions. Demonstrate communication expertise using persuasion and negotiation; ability to lead technical team efforts and assess skills within a team and working to build on individual strengths to maximize team results; ability to teach and transfer knowledge and skills to others.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Knowledge of the Campus Solutions, Human Capital Management, Financials and their interdepartmental and external relationships; familiarity with Application Engine, PeopleCode, SQRs, basic PeopleSoft Security, and BI Publisher. Experience with PeopleSoft v8 .5X and above, PeopleTools, relational databases and table structure; fluency in SQL. Knowledge of applicable modules of the Oracle/PeopleSoft Suite and the ability to perform as either a specialist or generalist; ability to be proactive and understand problems from a broad, interactive perspective and is able to develop solutions that combine information and ideas in new, unprecedented ways, provide technical support on implementation efforts for assigned projects and using advanced communication skills. Able to handle multiple assignments and projects simultaneously is desirable.

BACKGROUND CHECK:

A background check must satisfactorily be completed before a candidate can be offered this position. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for this position. The background check consists of the following: Employment verification, education verification, reference checks, and checks of the following systems and databases: National Social Security Number/Address Locator, Felony/Misdemeanor, National Criminal Database, Federal Criminal, Department of Motor Vehicles, and National Sex Offender Registry.

AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:

Cal Poly Pomona is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. The university subscribes to all state and federal regulations and prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity/gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, age, disability, genetic information, medical condition, and covered veteran status.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

Cal Poly Pomona hires only individuals lawfully authorized to work in the United States. In compliance with state and federal crime awareness and campus security legislation, including The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act, California Education Code section 67380, and the Higher Education Opportunity Act (HEOA), the Cal Poly Pomona Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available at: http://dsa.cpp.edu/police/securityreport.asp

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment. http://www.calstate.edu/eo/EO-1083.html
title: Senior Analyst/Programmer (Analyst/Programmer III) (60303)

description:
Supports the data and reporting environments that serve the Risk group. The data encompass auto loans and leases given indirectly to consumers through auto dealers as well as loans and lines of credit to given directly to automotive dealers. Will automate existing analytic and data processes, maintain the automation with maintenance programming and create new reporting and address recurring and ad-hoc reporting requests from external customers. Will highlight quantitative and qualitative risks with reporting.

Duties and Responsibilities
1. Data Warehousing & Reporting
• Extract existing data from data warehousing systems using SAS and SQL, analyze data for accuracy and consistency and summarize for consumption in reporting and analytic tools.
• Provide insight and analyze trends of applications, originations, collections, and productivity within each subject area with new reporting in Tableau and enhancements to existing reporting.
• Document existing state and changes to environment.
• Coordinate efforts with peers and senior peers to ensure data accuracy and availability.
• Address recurring and ad-hoc reporting needs from external customers such as HCS by retrieving reporting data from existing systems such as Tableau and reconciling to other known sources.
2. Project Management
• Coordinate with internal Information Technology (IT) groups and/or colleagues in the Analytical Center of Excellence to define, explain and execute upon business requirements

Knowledge and Skills
• Tableau or other similar data visualization/Business Intelligence (BI) tool.
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Ability to explain complex systems and data succinctly.
• Knowledge of typical finance industry concepts and metrics are a plus.
• Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills.
• MS Office suite.

Education and Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• 3-5 years of total combined work experience, preferably in a reporting/analytics function.
• 2-3 years of experience with SAS and/or SQL.
title: Sr. Analyst, Risk MIS

description:
PLAYSTUDIOS, Inc is a developer of engaging casual games for the world’s largest social and mobile platforms. Founded by a team of experienced gaming and technology entrepreneurs, PLAYSTUDIOS’ first free-to-play application, myVEGAS, combines the best elements of popular social games with established gambling mechanics. Players enjoy an ever-growing collection of slot and table games and the opportunity to earn an unprecedented selection of valuable, real-world rewards. In creating myVEGAS, PLAYSTUDIOS has partnered with MGM Resorts International and its portfolio of the most recognized resorts in the industry, including Bellagio, ARIA, Vdara, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, The Mirage, Monte Carlo, New York-New York, Luxor, Excalibur and Circus Circus. More recently, PLAYSTUDIOS has launched two more free-to-play applications, Konami and Pop! Slots, built upon the same real-world rewards platform and have both enjoyed great success in the market.

We’re looking for an experienced Data Analytics Professional to join the Business Intelligence team at PLAYSTUDIOS. At PLAYSTUDIOS we encourage a culture in which we’re always learning about our products, our customers & our industry. The BI Analyst will work closely with the Product, UA, Marketing & Management teams to develop data-centric insights into our business challenges.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop expertise in the play experience for all PLAYSTUDIOS games
  • Partner with business functional heads to design both operational and ad hoc reporting
  • Work with SQL, Excel, R, Python, Tableau, etc. on a daily basis to access and manipulate: Get it, Munge it, Analyze it, Report on it
  • Create ongoing insights related to business analytics, product performance, new feature releases, marketing operations, player behavior, & competitor analysis
  • Regularly present data insights to the management team
Required:
  • Advanced SQL competency
  • Solid background in medium-level probability and statistics
  • Exceptional analytical ability
  • Excellent communication/presentation skills - ability to work closely with departmental managers and with senior staff
Preferred:
  • Familiarity with any statistical package (R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, etc.) a strong plus
  • Familiarity with at least one scripting language (Python, PHP, Ruby, Perl, etc.) a strong plus

This is an exciting opportunity to join a world-class team and bring our exciting games to even more fans worldwide.
title: Business Intelligence – Analyst

description:
TrueCar is a fast-growing technology company created to be a catalyst for positive change in automotive retailing. We operate a transparent digital marketplace that benefits both buyers and sellers. With our up-to-the-moment pricing information and Certified Dealer network, we help consumers save money while they enjoy an empowered buying experience. At the same time, we benefit dealers by helping them increase sales volume and efficiency with an accountable platform to connect with in-market customers. Bringing this vision to life every day is made possible by our amazing team of employees. We consider everyone here at TrueCar a “driver” of something – whether it’s a project, a meeting, a team, an idea, innovation, inspiration, or excitement, we’re all helping to drive the industry forward each and every day.

If you’re an innovator, storyteller, and a complex problem-solver with a love of data, we’re currently looking for rising Senior’s to join our Analyst Intern program for 10 weeks this summer, with the hope of joining us full-time after graduation. The program is an exciting opportunity to both immerse yourself within a team and work cross-functionally with other departments and your intern class. Through hands-on experience and professional mentorship, you will develop your quantitative skillset and learn from some of the best in Data Analytics, Forecasting, and Client Management. Additionally, the internship program will expand your automotive insight and familiarity with specific analytical tools including SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, Microstrategy, and SAS.

ABOUT THE JOB:
Begin the intern program with a two week immersion experience to learn about TrueCar and brush-up on foundational skills and tools you will be using every day. Become embedded within a TrueCar team to work on a departmental project for 8 weeks. In parallel, work cross-functionally with your fellow interns to produce a collaborative project across departments to provide you with broader insight and exposure into the TrueCar business.

During the course of your summer you will be:
Working on an individual project to help advance your departments goals
Collaborating on an intern team project to expand your understanding of TrueCar more generally
Diving deep into analyzing, organizing, and presenting data
Creating analytical reports
Analyzing data and making recommendations
Working cross-functionally across the business
Learning how to effectively tell a story with data

WHAT YOU NEED:
A rising Senior getting your undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as: Business, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics, with a minimum GPA of 3.3.
An effective communicator, both written and verbal, with an ability to tell a story with data
Strong Excel & PowerPoint Skills
Analytically-minded with a curiosity and interest in working for a technology company
Interest in learning about the automotive industry
Able to work cross-functionally and manage projects
Experience with databases and data analysis
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm with a high attention to detail

description:
Position Summary (Woodland Hills, CA Office)

This position will report a mid-level manager within the RIS Variable Annuity Valuation Team, and will have regular interaction with other RIS Valuation team members and also with other business units supporting both the finance team and the valuation unit

Specifically, the role will entail the following:

• Assistance with the monthly, quarterly, and annual GAAP, Statutory, and Tax valuations of the AIG Life & Retirement RIS Variable Annuity business.
• Assisting with the set up and running of Variable Annuity actuarial models in GGY Axis and performing the respective SOX controls.
• Assist with the streamlining and automating of monthly processes such as data extractions, data manipulations and reporting templates.
• Works with others to prepare actuarial response and communication of results of actuarial research to business unit management.
• Assist with the compliance of internal and external audit standards, including Sarbanes-Oxley control standards.
• Document the systems/processes according to actuarial practice standards.

Position Requirements:
The Ideal Candidate Should Have

An undergraduate degree is required as well as 1-2 actuarial exams passed:

-Basic specialized mathematical knowledge including calculus, statistics, and probability; introductory level knowledge of actuarial mathematics
-Basic computer skills such as Excel, Access, and Word, with possibly limited knowledge of actuarial software
-Basic analytical/problem solving skills
-Basic business sense of financial, accounting, and economics aspects of business

Valuation experience or prior knowledge of variable annuities would be preferred, although not essential for this level position. In addition, the candidate must have:
• Excellent organizational and time management skills
• Strong analytical skills.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.
• Highly motivated and results-oriented.
• Desire to deliver a complete, quality work product

description:
Under direct supervision, assists with the implementation of the mobility management program; assisting targeted individuals with their paratransit and/or non-paratransit transportation needs. A key component of this position is performing extensive community and marketing outreach to increase awareness of the program and services. This position is funded through a 5310 grant.

This position is Salary Grade M: Min $51,667.20 – Mid $64,417.60 – Max $77,147.20 per year.

The application deadline for this position is Tuesday, February 28, 2017.

Responsibilities: This list is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification and is not designed to be interpreted as an exhaustive listing of all tasks required of employees assigned to this job.
  • Performs extensive marketing outreach and partnership building with human services agencies, organizations and other entities throughout the region to gain support and participation for mobility management programs.

  • Promotes the mobility management program through public presentations at service organizations, community groups and appropriate gatherings. Assists in planning, implementing and facilitating public outreach and communication activities including public forums, meetings, workshops, conferences, and special events. Coordinates with consultants in planning and implementing community outreach meetings.

  • Contacts riders and applicants that are not ADA-eligible or have a restricted eligibility to identify transit options to meet their mobility needs using any and all existing public resources to determine such transportation options including the Orange County updated Coordination Plan.

  • Assists in developing and implementing mobility planning services including travel training and other alternatives to enhance mobility among seniors and persons with disabilities.

  • Assists with the establishment of project and program policies and performance measures. Performs program monitoring and reporting.

  • Assists with identifying funding resources and developing plans and budget for mobility management projects and programs to ensure long-term sustainability.

  • Assists in the development of a comprehensive, specialized transportation database which includes detailed information on specialized services operated through the county. Creates a specialized services handbook for Orange County.

  • Monitors program funding compliance with state and federal requirements. Facilitates administrative recordkeeping activities associated with the mobility management program, including program files and documentation. Assists in the preparation and tracking of necessary reports, statistics and various communication metrics and internal reports/databases.

  • Maintains effective working relationships with internal departments and external audiences for the development of agency services and programs.

  • Drafts collateral program materials and coordinates production/distribution.

  • Monitors web and social media content for accuracy and relevance for the mobility management programs.

Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Human Services, Healthcare or related field with a preferable emphasis in working with the special needs, disabled and/or senior population. Knowledge of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Orange County demographics and transportation issues preferred.

Knowledge of:
  • Mobility and transportation issues of special needs, senior and disabled populations.
    The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).


  • Basic recordkeeping, data collection and management, analytics and reporting.

  • Computer applications and database software including Microsoft Office Suite.

  • Basic project and program management principles.

  • Principles and techniques of marketing and public outreach and participation programs.

  • Principles and techniques of communication, including written, visual, presentation and public speaking.

  • Various social media platforms.

Ability to:
  • Assist with the development of communication plans, materials and presentations.

  • Communicate effectively orally and in writing with customers, citizen groups and the public on sensitive issues.

  • Establish and maintain effective working relationships with members of the public, special interest groups and organizations, and internal staff.

  • Organize and maintain program/project documentation and records.

  • Assist in the creation and production of public information materials.

  • Use a computer and a variety of software programs to maintain data, compile reports, prepare presentations and create materials.

  • Work independently and exercise judgment and discretion with confidential, sensitive information.

Working Conditions/Physical Activities:

The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. OCTA provides reasonable accommodation to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Positions in this class typically require:
  • Work may be performed in a stressful, fast-paced office environment, depending upon assignment.

  • Requires ability to understand verbal communication and to respond effectively.

  • Positions in this class typically require: Reaching, Fingering, Grasping, Feeling, Talking, Hearing, Seeing, and Repetitive Motions in computer use.

Compensation and Benefits:

OCTA offers an attractive compensation and benefits package. The specific features of this package include: medical, dental and vision insurance; retirement; vacation and holiday pay; life insurance; deferred compensation plan; short-term and long-term disability plans; flexible spending accounts; educational reimbursement; flex time schedules; and ergonomic/wellness programs. Salary is dependent upon qualifications.

OCTA is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and ensures that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or veteran status.

description:
Marine Biologist I positions are responsible for conducting the City's Ocean Monitoring Program to meet the regulatory permit requirements for the discharge of wastewater to the Pacific Ocean via the Point Loma and South Bay Ocean Outfalls; perform ocean field sampling operations; ocean outfall inspections; laboratory sample processing and analysis; database and IT management; GIS analysis and mapping; taxonomic identification of marine invertebrates and fishes; bioaccumulation studies; toxicity testing; analysis of environmental monitoring data (e.g., water quality; sediment quality oceanographic conditions; invertebrate and fish community assessments); writing and producing regulatory or contractual reports; and perform other duties as assigned.

NOTE:
  • Marine Biologist I employees are presently assigned to one of four primary work groups, including: (1) Assessment and Reporting, (2) Information Management, (3) Ocean Operations, or (4) Taxonomy.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

You must meet the following requirements on the date you apply, unless otherwise indicated.

EDUCATION : You must meet ONE of the following options:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Marine Biology, Oceanography, or other Marine Science.
  • Bachelor's Degree in a closely related Life Science field (e.g., Biology, Oceanography, Zoology, Ecology, Environmental Toxicology, Physiology, Chemistry, Environmental Health) AND at least one upper-division college-level course and lab in Chemistry, Marine Biology, Oceanography or other Marine Science AND one upper-division college-level course and lab in Biology, Invertebrate Zoology, or Invertebrate Ecology. Individuals who lack the related college-level course and lab work MUST have a minimum of two years of full-time qualifying professional experience.
    • NOTE:
    • Additional qualifying professional experience working as a marine or environmental scientist in a professional laboratory (e.g., government, academic and/or research laboratory, private consulting agency) performing environmental/ocean monitoring work may be substituted for education lacked on a year-for-year basis. One year of full-time experience = 30 semester/45 quarter college-level units.
    LICENSE : A valid California Class C Driver License may be required at the time of hire.

    HIGHLY DESIRABLE :
    • Cross-over skills or relevant experience.
    • Graduate-level course work, Master's Degree or higher in any of the Life Science fields listed in the Education section above.
    • Course work in environmental monitoring, water quality, statistics, biostatistics, and/or zoology.
    • Knowledge of marine biology, ecology and oceanography, environmental chemistry, fish and invertebrate biology, taxonomy, and the bioaccumulation of contaminants in marine organisms.
    • Experience using ocean sampling equipment/instrumentation.
    • Experience in taxonomic identifications of marine fishes and trawl-caught marine macro-invertebrates.
    • Experience with benthic infaunal invertebrate taxonomy.
    • Experience in database administration and data management.
    • Experience using GIS, biostatistics, spatial statistics, and the analysis and interpretation of environmental data.
    • Experience in technical writing and report production.
    • Experience in various software packages such as Access, Seasave, SPSS, SigmaPlot, PRIMER, SYSTAT, InDesign, Dreamweaver, or Microsoft Sharepoint.
    • Experience using programming languages such as R, SAS, Stata, SQL, MATLAB, Python, HTML/CSS, JavaScript or Oracle PL/SQL.
    REQUIRED DOCUMENTS (MUST SUBMIT WITH APPLICATION) :
    • Proof of degree/transcripts, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.
    • Proof of transcripts showing completion of the required course and lab work, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.
    Required documents should be attached electronically to your application. If you are unable to attach at the time of application submittal, you must submit them as soon as possible via fax: (619) 533-3337; or to the Employment Information Center: City of San Diego Personnel Department, 1200 Third Avenue - Suite 300, San Diego, CA 92101. Include your name and the title of the position for which you are applying.

    SCREENING PROCESS:

    Please ensure all information is complete and accurate as the responses you provide on the supplemental questions will be reviewed using an automated evaluation system. If you are successful in this initial screening process, your application will be reviewed for applicable education, experience, and/or training to ensure all minimum requirements have been met. Successful candidates will be placed on a list which will be used to fill position vacancies during the next one year. For each vacancy, only those candidates with the most appropriate qualifications will be contacted by the hiring department for an interview.

    SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION:

    PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS : Employment offers are conditional pending the results of all screening processes that are applicable to this job, which may include but are not limited to the following: Confirmation of citizenship/legal right to work in the United States; completion of a pre-employment medical review/exam (which may include drug/alcohol testing); reference checks; and a fingerprint check. The fingerprints will be submitted to the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the California Department of Justice for a conviction record report. Certain positions may require additional screening processes which may include a polygraph examination and/or background investigation. All of these processes must be successfully completed before employment begins. A positive test for alcohol, illegal drugs, including marijuana, or inadequately explained prescription drugs, misrepresentation, falsification, or omission of pertinent facts in any step of the screening/selection process may be cause for disqualification and/or termination of employment. Nothing in this job posting constitutes an expressed or implied contract for employment with the City of San Diego. Applicants must notify the Personnel Department of any changes in their name, address (home, email), or phone number or they may miss employment opportunities.

    Rev. 1 â February 24, 2017 (New Recruitment Date)

description:
JPM Media Corporation has a strong reputation at Fintech field, 2017 we will start new opportunities for service and the tools we provide to our clients. Throughout 2017, JPM will launch ETF investing platform ETF.us to support this exciting new opportunity.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Spark: As data engineers, we want to move fast, and we want our code to move fast as well. we are increasing the performance of our data pipelines while simultaneously increasing the complexity of the jobs that run on top of them.
  • Machine learning: We use statistics to solve hard problems. Whether weâre running regression to better understand our business or clustering as part of a client-facing data pipeline, statistical modeling is key to our business.
  • Data quality: A model is only good if it is correct and built on recent data. We put a strong emphasis on data quality. We write unit tests to test the functional correctness of each module and meta-tests to guard against common programming errors. Throughout our data pipelines we run automated sanity checks on live data, alerting if any data is stale or values fall outside of expected ranges.

  • Advanced knowledge of the Spark/Hadoop ecosystem.
  • Advanced knowledge of Java. Familiarity with Scala preferred.

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Machine Learning: 3 years

title: Senior Data Scientist

description:
About the role We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support dotloop, a Zillow Group company. You will work closely with the product team and management to help the us make well informed, decisions based on data that influence the product roadmap and business direction. Some highlights of this role:
Huge impact: dotloop is data-hungry and we rely on analytical insights to support virtually all of our decisions. You’ll have an opportunity to quickly impact several critical aspects of the business and will play an integral role in the decision-making process.
High visibility: We're a flat organization that is growing quickly; because your work will influence important decisions, you'll communicate directly with Directors, VPs and the Founder/GM on a regular basis to present data.
Fun: Join the largest and most exciting tech company in real estate and help us transform the home buying and selling experience. We know you’ll love coming to work in the morning! This position provides you the opportunity to:
Ingest data from a variety of sources including MySQL, S3, and Amazon Redshift using SQL tools and Python.
Build dynamic & scalable production dashboards for the dotloop product offering, providing product, marketing, and strategy partners a window into the day-to-day operation of dotloop.
Partner with dotloop leadership to develop medium and long-term strategies aimed at achieving dotloop’s business objectives.
Respond to the daily needs of the dotloop business by fielding questions from leadership, translating them into an analytics framework, and providing actionable results.
Explore dotloop’s rich set of data, mining it to find insights that you can bring to your business partners.
Collaborate with dotloop’s data warehouse team to streamline inefficiencies in the data preparation process. About the team We are a fun, small team of engineers working in an agile environment. We work hard while keeping a good work-life balance. We believe in building a high-availability, scalable infrastructure.

Who are you?
Undergraduate or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. science, engineering, economics, finance, statistics, or analytics).
Interest in and willingness to wear different hats – data engineering, Tableau reporting, ad hoc analyses, and project-based analytics.
Proficient at writing SQL code against complex databases for the purpose of data extraction.
Experience translating business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and a real passion for converting the results of your analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of your audience.
Extensive Experience with text mining tools (such as SAS, R, Python, Matlab, Stata SPSS or comparable platforms). Familiarity with natural language processing, categorization models and computational linguistics is a plus.
Detail oriented, but able to balance pragmatism over perfection.
Passion for efficiency with a strong desire to automate costly business & analytics processes using Python or another multipurpose language.
Thrive on autonomy and want to take ownership of your interactions with business partners, your projects, your job, and your career.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams. Get to know us dotloop replaces your form creation, e-sign, and real estate transaction management systems with a single end-to-end solution, while helping you streamline your business with real-time visibility into your transactions. Over 3,500 businesses - including 40 of the top 100 largest brokerages and over 85 state and regional associations - use dotloop.

Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
A9.com, an Amazon company, creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies. Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, A9 Product Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day. Our Search Relevance team works to maximize the quality and effectiveness of the search experience for visitors to Amazon websites worldwide.
The Amazon search engine process billions of searches on hundreds of millions of products using models trained by robust machine learning algorithms on real customer data. Search ranking is a hard problem, with models that are difficult for humans to understand, experiments that are challenging to predict, and a wide variety of live search problems to troubleshoot. As a Data Visualization Engineer in Search Relevance you would be using state of the art JavaScript to build user friendly tools for Search Ranking. We use visualization technologies such as D3.js, dc.js, and Crossfilter, as well as statistical methods, to bring human intuition to complex models, provide insight to guide experiments, and help identify the causes of ranking problems on Amazon sites worldwide. Engineers on this team have the unique opportunity to build tools, then use them while working as data scientists. We’re looking for someone with strength in data visualization and front end programming, and interest in expanding data science skills through mentorship.

The tools you develop will be instrumental in helping the Amazon Search team resolve issues as well as shape our product search strategy. You will be given significant authority and ownership, but you will also be supported by a stellar team of engineers, data scientists, designers and product managers.

At A9, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon, one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California.

Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. At least 3 years of software development experience building web applications or services. At least 3 years of experience working with JavaScript as well as Java frameworks (i.e. Angular, React, or Vue). At least 2 years of experience with data visualization technologies (i.e. D3js, DCjs, Crossfilter, FusionCharts, or HighCharts). At least 2 years of experience with version control technologies such as Git or SVN, and web standards such as JSON. Expose to machine learning techniques and statistics.

Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. Passionate about building tools to help solve problems. A proven track record of building web applications or services with modern front end technologies. Working understanding of Search Engine technology (crawling, indexing, matching, ranking, etc). Experience working on Internal Tooling or Build Engineering teams at similar organizations. Excellent collaboration and communication skills .
