THE DEPARTMENT:

The department of Public Affairs, in the Division of University Advancement, is the central communications office for Cal Poly Pomona to internal and external public. Its portfolio of responsibilities includes strategic communication and reputation management, emergency communication, advancement communication, branding media relations, social media, visual and written storytelling across multiple platforms, executive communication and graphic standards. Public Affairs helps the university’s growth and development.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Public Affairs/Communications Specialist III serve as the primary editor for all digital communication platforms in Public Affairs and as assigned, more broadly in University Advancement. Take a leading role in conceiving, developing, and implementing digital content and new electronic communication platforms for Public Affairs content; and play a role, as assigned in developing videos (may include scriptwriting, storyboarding or producing) for storytelling and strategic messaging purposes. The incumbent will take a leading role in developing protocols and procedures to ensure that college communicators produce content that meets Public Affairs high standards; serve as the primary liaison between college communicators and Public Affairs; take on writing and other assignments as determined by the Director and/or AVP; maintain the Public Affairs style book and ensure that the department peers and college communicators receive regular updates on matters usage and style; and perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field AND a minimum of three years or related professional or technical experience. Requires knowledge of the fundamentals of public affairs and/or media relations; must be proficient with PC environment, the internet, word processing and simple databases; exposure to marketing and marketing research; strong written and verbal communications skills with a solid foundation in grammar and spelling; basic knowledge and understanding of media outlets including print, television and radio; ability to work with media for coverage of events; working knowledge of summary statistics as they relate to research; basic knowledge of applicable copyright and other laws pertaining to written materials, news media and confidentiality; working knowledge of applicable software packages; knowledge of graphics and graphics design including web development; must have knowledge of higher education and enrollment management issues, policies, and practices; have the ability to manage multiple projects; The incumbent must provide their own transportation to schools/districts within local EAP service areas and possess a valid California driver’s license and insurance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum five years of experience in public relations, communications, journalism or marking with demonstrated excellence in storytelling, content curation and editing. Superior oral and written communication skills. Experience in creating original digital content for the web and social media. Ability to set priorities and manage multiple projects deadlines. Demonstrated success in establishing productive relationships with peers, administrators and stakeholders, and in collaborating with them to achieve clearly articulated goals. Unwavering commitment to professional ethics and integrity. Ability to maintain confidentiality when required internally and across the divisions. A spirit of entrepreneurship manifested in suggesting, creating nurturing, and bringing to fruition new approaches to communication that advance the university. A clear understanding of Cal Poly Pomona’s strategic mission. Project coordination experience, experience working at a university in a senior communications role. Crisis and emergency communication experience; email marketing experience, social media experience and videography and/or illustration skills.

BACKGROUND CHECK:

A background check must satisfactorily be completed before a candidate can be offered this position. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for this position. The background check consists of the following: Employment verification, education verification, reference checks, and checks of the following systems and databases: National Social Security Number/Address Locator, Felony/Misdemeanor, National Criminal Database, Federal Criminal, Department of Motor Vehicles, and National Sex Offender Registry.

AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:

Cal Poly Pomona is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. The university subscribes to all state and federal regulations and prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity/gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, age, disability, genetic information, medical condition, and covered veteran status.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

Cal Poly Pomona hires only individuals lawfully authorized to work in the United States. In compliance with state and federal crime awareness and campus security legislation, including The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act, California Education Code section 67380, and the Higher Education Opportunity Act (HEOA), the Cal Poly Pomona Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available at: http://dsa.cpp.edu/police/securityreport.asp

CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT:

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment. http://www.calstate.edu/eo/EO-1083.html
title: Public Affairs/Communication Specialist III (60305)

description:
Position Summary:
The Policy & Research Analyst will report to the Manager of Political Voice and will work with community-based organizations, civil rights organizations, and government offices across the state to eliminate racial and economic disparities in political participation and government

responsiveness.

This work will include:
  • Advocating for public policies and administrative practices that expand opportunities for political participation and enhance government responsiveness, particularly in low-income communities of color;
  • Researching issues of political participation and government responsiveness, particularly as those issues are experienced by residents in low-income communities of color; and
  • Building coalitions to develop collaborative strategies to address disparities in political participation and government responsiveness.
Specific Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Analyzing public policies and administrative practices related to political participation and government responsiveness;
  • Building partnerships with and providing technical support to community and civil rights groups as they prepare and launch campaigns to improve political participation or government responsiveness;
  • Building partnerships with and providing technical support to government offices as they prepare and launch initiatives to make government more participatory;
  • Serving as primary liaison with community-based organizations and coalitions;
  • Identifying, initiating, and deepening relationships with community stakeholders, relevant government staff, and political leadership;
  • Participating in organization-wide planning, development, and communications activities, as needed, and ensuring adherence to Advancement Project goals and policies within the
project area; and

  • Other duties as assigned, dependent on organizational needs and employee skills.
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job function assigned satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to

perform the essential functions.

  • Sincere and demonstrated commitment to advancing social and/or racial justice progress for the highest-need communities.
  • 2-4 years of experience in civil rights and social justice, public policy, community-based policy advocacy and/or organizing (beyond summer or short-term internships).
  • Bachelor's degree required; graduate degree in public policy, law, or the social sciences preferred. Equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential job duties may be considered.
  • Experience and success working in partnership with community and civil rights organizations, including experience building and working in coalitions.
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, facilitation and presentation skills â experience translating technical analyses into compelling advocacy messages is especially preferred.
  • Ability to conduct policy analysis, research (qualitative/quantitative), and synthesizing complex information/data for policy and planning.
  • Demonstrated familiarity and confidence with reviewing and analyzing data and statistics on political participation and government responsiveness from a variety of sources preferred.
  • Demonstrated experience in leading and managing complex projects that are strategic in nature & scope.
  • Demonstrated experience in organizing large-scale events.
  • Proven ability to work with diverse communities, leaders and staff.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a small team setting.
  • Flexibility to adjust and contribute to continually evolving work situation and changing priorities.
  • Good computer skills, proficient with MS Office applications.
  • Excellent organizational skills with demonstrated ability to execute projects on-time and on-budget.
  • Bilingual English-Spanish a plus.
  • Must be able to travel locally and statewide.
title: Policy & Research Analyst 1 Political Voice

description:
Reporting to the operations team responsible for developing and maintaining a repeatable Market Assessment process to assist in identifying individual restaurant and/or franchisee operating performance.
Conducts timely and accurate business analysis and development of reports to assist the operations team. Provides quantitative and technical expertise to assigned business units/leaders and franchisees to ensure that all relevant operational and financial data are available to support business decisions.

Core Responsibilities
Maintain and manage system database, develop reports for individual operation, franchise and company-wide operational performance including challenges related to restaurant management. Contributes to the overall financial, operational and guest satisfaction goals of the organization by reporting both individual and systemic issues that affect these goals.

Manage individual and franchisee operations scorecards, provide analysis and insight on Restaurant and Franchisee performance objectives compared to company targets.

Conduct critical data analysis, clearly articulate findings, and concisely present recommendations to Operations management team.

• Partner cross-functionally with multiple departments to provide quantitative decision support for various initiatives.

• Projects incorporate working with large quantities of data and developing meaningful analysis complete with “why” results occurred and providing recommendations for future action. This requires identifying what are the knowable facts and what assumptions need to be made. Both internal and industry data are leveraged. Data and assumptions are then logically combined to construct analysis.

Requirements

Essential Skills & Background

• MBA or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, or related discipline, or equivalent professional experience.

• 4-6 years of experience in business analysis, financial analysis, management consulting, or a related role that involved analyzing large data sets to draw out actionable insights.

• Familiarity with business intelligence software (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, SQL) and/or statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).

• Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Working knowledge of basic statistical concepts.

• Strong time management and organizational skills; demonstrated ability to meet established deadlines. Ability to adapt in a dynamic environment where tight deadlines and changing priorities are not uncommon.

Preferred Skills & Background

• Experience building dashboards using a business intelligence tool.

• Working knowledge of restaurant operations and key performance indicators
Experience designing and analyzing tests that involve pre-post outcomes and control groups.

title: Research Engineer

description:
A9.com, an Amazon company, creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies. Our Ad Tech team builds the technology infrastructure and ad serving systems to manage billions of advertising queries every day. The result is better quality advertising for publishers and more relevant ads for customers. Our infrastructure supports millions of Internet users and handles billions of queries per day, all delivered in milliseconds. Our data platform processes massive data sets to develop business intelligence and analytics that are critical for the efficiency and profitability of our advertising business.
We are looking for a data science engineer with a passion for dealing with internet scale datasets to work on Amazon's Forecasting Platform for advertising. Our platform is used across Amazon by a variety of advertising programs including Display, Video, Mobile and Kindle. Our team builds end-to-end solutions including data pipelines, large scale index data structures, time series models, software services and large scale data visualizations. Our systems are based on a mix of AWS and third-party technologies, using those that make the best sense in a given scenario.

In the Ad Forecasting and Optimization team you will:
Work closely with a group of highly talented and motivated software and data science engineers who build systems and models used to analyze petabytes of data
Work on analyzing exchange bidding behavior, time series modeling, optimal inventory allocation and many other exciting problems posed by advertising business
Invent ways to overcome technical limitations and enable new forms of analyses that drive key business decisions
Apply machine learning and data mining techniques to measure and
Work side-by-side with product managers and software engineers in designing experiments and implementing end-to-end solutions
Present business impactful data insights to technical and business leaders
At A9, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California

Basic Qualifications:
MS Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related discipline
3+ years of experience of data analysis and modeling experience
2+ years of experience with a major scripting language (e.g. Python, Ruby)

Preferred Qualifications:
Practical experience in applying data mining and machine learning to real world problems, especially time series modeling
Ability to write code that aggregates and analyses large volumes of data
Ability to deal with ambiguous and under-defined problems
PhD in Computer Science Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related discipline
Strong CS fundamentals in data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis
Entrepreneurial “think big” mind-set
title: Data Sciences Engineer - Ad Forecasting and Yield Optimization

description:
RiskIQ is a cybersecurity company that helps organizations discover and protect their external facing known, unknown and third-party web, mobile and social digital assets. The company’s External Threat Management platform combines a worldwide proxy and sensor network with clients that emulate users to monitor, detect and take actions against threats. RiskIQ is being used by thousands of companies including F500s and leading financial institutions to protect their web assets and users from external security threats. It is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by growth equity firms Summit Partners and Battery Ventures.

Our Data Science team is at the core of advancing our technologies that will compose our next generation of internet and mobile security products. A successful candidate will be a highly motivated team member with a passion for solving the challenging problems our business faces. As a Hadoop Engineer, you will design, build, and scale our Hadoop ecosystem, which empowers our Data Science team to deliver game-changing intelligence from both existing and new/novel data sources. Relocation is available for the right candidate.

Your responsibilities will include

  • Participate in architecting and building scalable applications using elements of Hadoop ecosystem.
  • Determining feasibility and rapidly developing proof of concept code based on ideas that are produced from the Data Science team.
  • Partnering with our Engineering team to implement successful products into the RiskIQ platform.
  • Work with our DevOps team to scale our data infrastructure.
  • Creating new ways to extract interesting insights from existing research analysis.
  • Analyzing, designing, developing, and testing of your projects to meet deadlines and exacting standards.
Requirements

  • BS or higher in Applied Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, or related field
  • Senior Developer with 6 years overall experience in Java technologies and Big Data.
  • Proven ability to build large, reliable, scalable infrastructure
  • 4+ years of advanced, hands-on experience with the Hadoop eco-system:
  • MapReduce
  • Hive
  • MapR
  • HDFS
  • HBase
  • Spark
  • Strong SQL experience to analyze, transform, and integrate high volume, complex data sources.
  • Extensive knowledge of Data Infrastructure at both the physical and the logical level
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights and technical approach through conversation, documentation, and presentation.
  • Proficiency with the following:
  • Job orchestration systems (e.g. Oozie, Luigi, Airflow)
  • Advanced file formats (e.g. Parquet, Avro, ORC)
  • Stream processing systems (e.g. Spark, Storm, Flink)
  • Search engines (e.g. ElasticSearch, Solr, Lucene)
  • Desired experience with some of the following technologies:
  • Kafka
  • Cassandra
  • Redis
  • Machine learning experience
  • Amazon Web Services or other cloud-based providers/solutions
Why work at RiskIQ?

  • Fascinating work - Welcome to the dark underbelly of the Internet. We detect, expose, and investigate malware, exploit kits, botnets, affiliate fraud, advertising fraud, and illicit mobile apps, and much more. It is the golden age of internet crime, and we are at the forefront of defensive efforts to stem the tide. Internet security is a global growth industry, and the knowledge you acquire here will be a marketable skill for decades to come.
  • We’re a company on the forefront of a burgeoning industry - We've recently celebrated several new milestones headlined by 80% year-over-year growth revenue growth, the closing of $30.5 million in Series C funding, and recognition by Forrester in its Forrester Wave™: Digital Risk Monitoring, Q3 2016 report, which named RiskIQ a leader.
  • Top Leadership - Our CEO is a renown cybersecurity veteran known for his expertise. Our leadership group is poised and experienced with a track record in technology and cyber security.
  • Unbounded opportunity - We are small, but we’re growing. At RiskIQ, you’ll be provided with as much responsibility as you can handle—new career development opportunities constantly arise given our rate of growth Want to design a new data center from the ground up? Architect a big data backend to increase our storage and analysis capabilities? These challenges are yours for the taking if you prove you're capable.
  • Flexibility - You’ll have a large workload, but also the freedom to accomplish it on your own terms. RiskIQ has unlimited PTO and flexible hours.
title: Data Engineer

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Engineering Manager to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Manufacturing process and is tasked with new product introduction and increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments.

This individual will lead teams that provide technical leadership to new product introduction, production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts. Additionally, this person will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Finance, Production and other engineering groups to lead development of processes for new products and sustain and improve processes for existing products.

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Participate in process sustaining, definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities in the making of consumable products or support of processes/equipment used to sequence genomes.
  • Work on teams to develop and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.
  • Troubleshoot production line issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
  • Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.
  • Analyze process test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
  • Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
  • Provide leadership and direction to the consumables Process Engineering team to accomplish all team goals and objectives.
  • Maintains staff by recruiting, selecting, and training employees; maintains a safe, secure, and legal work environment.
  • Manage team development through training, coaching and career mapping; develops personal growth opportunities.
  • Lead continuous improvement and sustaining efforts for products and processes in support of cost and performance objectives.
  • Lead, work on and guide teams to transfer manufacturing processes between manufacturing locations.
  • Responsible for productive cross-site and cross-functional relationship between manufacturing sites.

Requirements:
  • Work experience in the biotech or semiconductor industries is desirable.
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully lead, coach and mentor direct reports required.
  • Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable
  • Experience working in an ISO13485 or FDA certified environment is desirable.
  • Experience in high-volume production in a high-tech consumables industry is desirable.
  • Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) preferred.
  • Experience in production support and/or process development is required.
  • Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques are required.
  • High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.
  • Experience with product development processes and project management skills is desirable.
  • Good interdepartmental communication, influence and documentation skills are required.
  • Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.

Education:
  • B.S./M.S./PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Biotechnical Engineering, or MS/PhD in Materials Science or Physical Chemistry with at least 6 years of relevant experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation. At least 2 year as a technical manager or 5 years as a production manager.

description: Sales Strategy & Operations Analyst What if you were empowered to help solve the most complex problems Nonprofits and Higher Education institutions face today? What if you had the best suite of marketing products available to help achieve that goal? What if you could work for a social enterprise that believes top line growth is central to giving back to the community? Welcome to your #dreamjob. Salesforce.org is a nonprofit social enterprise with a mission to empower its community of stakeholders to accelerate impact in a whole new way. Salesforce.org impacts thousands of organizations and the millions of people they serve by delivering the world’s best nonprofit and educational technology solutions at affordable rates. It also inspires employee giving by matching their donations and driving volunteer engagement in the community. And it leverages a unique self-sustaining model to generously re-invest the revenue generated back into the community through strategic grants focused on education and workforce development. About the position: This Sales Strategy & Operations role is a hybrid of traditional jobs in sales analytics and operations – market analysis, sales optimization and business operational support. This is a high performance team chartered with assisting CEO and CRO in driving the business forward. This involves providing a mix of sound statistical analysis combined with practical data management development. The individual in this role will be directly influencing continued growth and success of Salesforce.org by supporting our Global Sales Strategy and Special Projects group. Projects range from the strategic to the operational: KPI development, Go-to-market planning and revenue forecasting, Salesforce app administration, data quality projects, sales pipeline analysis. Deliverables include robust analytic models, custom performance analysis, scalable reporting infrastructure, and the packaging of data into queryable data sets. The candidate will interact with various areas of the organization and have exposure to senior leadership. The successful candidate will have a relentless curiosity, and possess a passion for creating innovative analysis and the flexibility to identify and execute on opportunities. Ideally, this person will have worked in a diverse role such as Digital Marketing Analytics, Sales Operations or Data Analysis and will feel comfortable accessing data across diverse platforms. An ideal candidate will also be comfortable working with technical and non-technical stakeholders, must be a team player, able to manage multiple priorities and deal with ambiguity. Responsibilities: Design and maintain key performance dashboards through automation Lead and maintain the data integrity of the sales coverage model Lead ongoing analysis of business performance. Support Salesforce CRM data enrichment, deduplication and reconciliations activities Assist in developing ad-hoc data analysis to present to Sales Strategy and COO group Support Salesforce process enhancements, modifications and best practices development Work cross-functionally to improve data quality through governance processes Be a leader in creating a data driven culture of decision making with stakeholders Requirements: 2-5 years of work experience focused on data visualization quantitative analysis, Excel and logical reasoning; experience using Salesforce.com and simple databases Basic understanding and experience applying statistics to business problems Process oriented with project management experience Preferred Salesforce Administrator certification Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft high quality project plans Be able to work independently and as part of a team in a fast pace, rapid change environment Ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environment Bachelor’s Degree required Ability to travel as needed If hired, a Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, must be completed at the start of employment. *LI-Y

description:

We solve challenging problems and boost business growth through a deep understanding of consumer behaviors with applied analytics techniques and business insights. description:
We are thousands of people working globally to help the world access, analyze and act on ever-increasing volumes of data, creating the foundation for new applications and industries. We see the potential for a world that’s more predictive, more productive, more personal. Our products and solutions marketed under the WD, HGST and SanDisk brands, are everywhere that digital information and content is found: in the cloud, supporting your mobile digital lifestyle; in business and personal computers; in external storage devices; in your digital video recorder and cameras. If you have a relentless drive to deliver, if you want to work in an environment where people and ideas thrive, come be part of the team that’s transforming the world’s connection to information.

University Recruitment is looking for highly self-directed people to assume these technical roles and immediately contribute to the development of our newest storage products. These full-time paid opportunities are designed to jump start your career, offering on-the-job and supplemental training and a robust mentorship program.

The Data Analytics Engineering team is building big data analytics platform that supports large scale processing of data and providing analytical tools to drive data driven decisions. In this role you will be part of the team that will build this platform and support infrastructure that will ingest and securely transfer large amounts of data from both internal and external sources to data storage networks within the company. You will develop complex ETL functions, database designs, and search engine functions. Additional responsibilities will be development of data blending and aggregation methods to reduce data complexity. These tasks will require working with IT teams to establish infrastructure that will meet both user’s analytics needs as well as cost targets.

Additional tasks may include:
Establish efficient ways to analyze data.

Monitor data systems to insure data quality and system performance.

Troubleshoot and mitigate data quality problems.

Establish and document data system maintenance plans for IT support.

Document, support and mentor data user community as to proper use of data.

Qualifications

Current student, pursuing a BS or MS degree in Electrical, Computer, or Software Engineering and graduating between December 2016 and June 2017

Minimum of 3.0 GPA

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Ability to read and comprehend complex technical specifications

Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

Strong team-player who can collaborate with colleagues

Strong background in Java and Python, preferably C++.

Knowledge of Linux OS is a must.

Technical experience in big data computing platforms such as Hadoop and Hive.

Knowledge of SQL databases is required.

Knowledge of cloud technologies is highly preferred

Experience with web application development

Experience in Tableau, SportFire, R-Studio is preferred.

Background in Math, statistics and Machine Learning methodologies is preferred.

Candidate must have good communion skills, both verbally and by written.

description:
A Top Tier Investment Bank is looking for a Senior level Quantitative Analyst and Model Validation specialist. The ideal candidate will have a number of years of relevant experience, including credit risk model development. A strong understanding of CCAR/DFAST regulations and modeling is essential for this position. The candidate will join a growing department with opportunity for rapid advancement and access to department Heads and Managing Directors. Specific details are as follows:

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Obtain and conduct data analysis required for stress testing model development.
  • Developing and executing primary and benchmark CCAR/DFAST stress test models for credit risk and PPNR.
  • Perform all required tests and measures of developed models (e.g., sensitivity, accuracy, volatility)
  • Extensive knowledge of loan-level PD/LGD model development
  • Utilize quantitative skills to analyze and summarize data, formulate findings, and provide recommendations. Research and recommend enhancement.
  • Assist others with conducting business research by gathering data, identifying options, and creating non-routine reports with detailed analyses.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
  • Master or PhD degree in a quant discipline like Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of CCAR/DFAST commercial or consumer credit portfolio stress testing. modeling experience in financial services industry or 4 years of other experiences in credit risk modeling area
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to explain complex and technical matters clearly, accurately and concisely.

Please apply below with an updated version of your resume if interested.

description:
---------------------
Senior Data Scientist
---------------------

WePay is looking for an exceptional data scientist to add to their machine learning team to detect payment fraud and merchant risk. This role will contribute heavily to WePayâs risk management value proposition and competitive advantage.

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowd-funding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers. WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.

WePayâs proprietary risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud. You will find a highly data-rich environment and powerful risk data architecture from which to build machine learning systems.

Responsibilities
----------------

  • Build machine learning systems and models for detecting payment fraud, merchant fraud, and merchant risk
  • Extract information like Entities, Entity Relationships and Events from large bodies of Text using various Text Mining and NLP Techniques
  • Design and Implement Knowledge graph capturing information from various 3rd party/partner data sources and relationships therein
  • Drive the complete lifecycle from data extraction through model deployment and evaluation
  • Collaborate closely with engineering and risk teams
Requirements
------------

  • 3+ years experience in applied machine learning / model development
  • 2+ years experience in Text Mining and NLP domains.
  • Strong Practical experience with various Text Mining/NLP techniques like CRFs, HMMs, Entity Extraction, Relationship Extraction, Sentiment Analysis, Text Classification, Clustering, Similarity analysis, Active Learning etc.
  • In-depth understanding of machine learning and modeling algorithms such as decision trees, random forest, neural networks, Graphical Models, SVM, etc.
  • Technical expertise in data extraction, data scrubbing, feature extraction, model building / training, and statistical analysis
  • Proficiency in databases (SQL, NoSQL), statistical tools (R, SAS, etc), and programming languages (at least one of following: Python, Ruby, Java, etc)
  • M.S. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Collaborative, team player who drives to resolving customer needs
  • Outstanding track record of innovation and success

description:
The Analytics Associate is responsible for the overall quality of the market data for an assigned metropolitan area or areas. You will provide oversight and direction for your market research team. You will compile and prepare accurate quarterly market statistics for review by Advisory Boards made up of the top real estate professionals in the market. You will use this data to produce quarterly Market Trends reports. You will conduct regular analysis to ensure the quality of your market data. You will also produce adhoc research reports and projects for internal and external clients.

Youll be a part of the Xceligent Analytics group and will attend weekly group phone calls and other group meetings.

Performance Duties:
  • Market Data Analysis.
  • Act as the primary advocate for the quality of the property data within the market.
  • Guide the market researchers data collection strategy, promoting quality and professionalism through regular conference call meetings.
  • Advisory Board Meetings.
  • Prepares statistics and PowerPoint slides for quarterly Advisory Board meetings.
  • Participates in Advisory Board meetings as needed, collecting information and insights from participants.
  • Property Database Quality Assurance.
  • Conducts regular QA audits, constantly striving for data quality improvements.
  • Makes changes to historical property data tables as needed.
  • Manages all aspects of researching and reporting on tenant move-ins and Move-outs (MIMO process.)
  • Participate in and/or organize weekly market data calls for the assigned market.

Marketing
  • Coordinate production and delivery of Xtra Xtra.
  • Coordinate local market data strategy.
  • Produce quarterly market trend reports.

Operational
  • Work with the Field Research Manager in overseeing the drive strategy
  • Oversee and prioritize special data projects.
  • Business Development.
  • Assist national sales team when needed in local market initiatives.

Expectations:
  • Requires some travel.
  • Leadership: demonstrates the ability to lead people and obtain results through others.
  • Strategic planning: analyzes work, sets goals, develops plans of action, and utilizes time effectively.
  • Communication: utilizes effective verbal and written communication.
  • Project management: effectively organizes, prioritizes and manages multiple projects.
  • Customer service: anticipates the needs of internal and/or external customers and offers solutions by demonstrating extra effort and maintaining a healthy attitude toward meeting customer needs.
  • Judgment: draws on core values, knowledge, and personal experience to make wise choices.
  • Effectiveness under stress: demonstrates the ability to think, function and lead effectively under conditions of mental pressure.
  • Force: demonstrates the ability to present and substantiate ideas that may not agree with the opinion of others.
  • Self-renewal: demonstrates a commitment to intellectual growth in ways beneficial to self, peers and the company.

Education/Qualifications:
  • Displays an understanding of the commercial real estate market.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to conduct and participate in professional business meetings.
  • Computer skills including experience with MS Excel.
title: Analytics Associate

description:
About the role The Agent Platform team is looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join the evolution in growing our Premier Agent App.
You will measure quantitative or trending data to bring together the user experience for both end-to-end workflows and feature specific product releases.
You will closely work with Engineering to implement, document, validate and monitor usage metrics through a variety tools including Google Tag Manager and SQL.
You should have a consistent track record translating usage data into product insights and opportunity recommendations communicating how our users interact with our products across desktop and mobile.
You will define key performance metrics including identifying how to influence critical metrics through product recommendations.
You will monitor performance and overall product usage coupled with key strategic initiatives motivated by product managers, product marketing managers, engineering and user experience to name a few.
You will independently identify trends associated with usage as well as new themes of usage through cohort analysis, behavioral tracking, user segmentation, funnel analysis, and statistical analysis.
You will develop analytics program measuring usage patterns across mobile and desktop.
You will establish data sharing programs ranging from formal presentations/discussions to up-to-date dashboards.
You should be highly adaptable and willing to propose solutions to meet organization’s data needs including identifying and implementing new solutions as needed. About the team We are a mid-sized, energetic and enthusiastic team innovating the next generation real estate agent software with the industry-leading platform for real estate agents - and this is just the beginning. With an unparalleled consumer reach to 140 million users across Zillow and Trulia, our app will be at the center of agents’ daily lives.
We value difference of opinion, urge independence and have the amazing privilege to put together teams of diverse, motivated and talented people who love working together. Who are you?
You have a minimum of 4 years executing quantitative analysis
You have advanced degrees (preferred); minimum BA/BS in statistics, computer science, math, physics, engineering or other technical/quantitative field
You have demonstrable independence designing and executing initiatives with minimal guidance
You have organization coupled with being a self starter approach
You have worked extensively with Google Tag Manager; preference for experience with Google Analytics, Omniture, MixPanel, Segment and other analytic software Get to know us Our Culture We're a fun team. We build awesome products, solve hard problems and keep a good life balance. Our culture is one of our biggest strengths. In our company, people treat each other with respect and compassion, and together cultivate a culture of team-work, learning, accountability and fun. There’s a commitment to understanding the whole person, helping to create a shared, unquestioning environment.

Our values permeate our core and are part of our daily life at Zillow Group: #ZGIsATeamSport, #ActWithIntegrity, #WinningIsFun, #OwnIt, #MoveFastThinkBig, #TurnOnTheLights Press coverage
http://www.zillow.com/agent-resources/news/industry-updates/introducing-premier-agent-app/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fFYA_R81MCg Our Innovation Zillow Group's growth and success as a company is a result of its culture of innovation. Many original ideas are created organically during day-to-day work, and our employees have a process for collecting them in a central system and vetting them as a team.

One of the most popular institutions within the company is Innovation Week, a company-wide week devoted to experimenting with new ideas each quarter. During Innovation Week, any employee can pitch to the larger team their ideas and recruit people to build it. Dozens of products, services, ideas and features have come to life as from Innovation Week. In fact, our original mobile apps were born as Innovation projects. Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to cultivating a versatile, creative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
title: Senior Product Analyst, Premier Agent App

description:
Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com.

The Business

Create your future. Join our Retirement consulting team in providing expertise in retirement and investment consulting to support global organizations in designing, managing, administering, and communicating various retirement plans. Whether a client has a defined benefit pension or a defined contribution plan, we work with them to determine the right approach to designing, funding, investing, governing and employee management that fits their specific goals.

Explore an opportunity. Gain direct exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyse data, draw conclusions, and share your brilliant results. In this role, you’ll experience a balance of expanding your technical knowledge and industry expertise, while benefiting from working in a close-knit and supportive team environment.

The Role

Love your work . You will assist consultants that are providing actuarial support on client projects through:
  • Funding, pricing, forecasting, and management of retirement programs
  • Assisting with annual pension (qualified and nonqualified) and post-retirement medical valuations for a variety of clients
    • This entails manipulating data, analyzing data, determining plan liabilities, reconciling plan assets, and determining funding requirement
  • Assisting with completion of plan reporting and filing requirements
  • Competitive benchmarking analysis of benefit plan designs
  • Carrying out experience studies of plan demographic assumptions
  • Performing plan administrative tasks such as completing benefit calculations, reviewing plan documents and SPDs, and producing benefit statements
  • Working with a wide range of associates at all levels within the local practice
  • Participating in numerous trainings to learn both the technical and business aspects of the retirement practice

Job Requirements The Requirements

About you.
  • Junior standing (sophomore considered with other relevant internship experience) pursuing a Bachelors or Master’s degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance or any other major with significant quantitative course work with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0
  • Successful completion of one or more actuarial exams highly preferred
  • Work experience that demonstrates strong technical, and/or client service and leadership skills
  • Passion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the client
  • Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel

description:
With a nationwide sales team and several manufacturing locations, B. Braun Medical has become a leading full-line supplier of healthcare products and services in the U.S. The company is committed to delivering innovative products and services with unmatched quality, superior technology, and cost-effectiveness, while maintaining environmental responsibility. Through its "Sharing Expertise®" initiative, B. Braun promotes best practices for continuous improvement of healthcare products and services. B. Braun employs over 4,500 people in the USA. B. Braun Medical Inc. began its operations in the USA in 1957. Initially, the company manufactured and sold disposable plastic syringes. During the 1980s and early 1990s, the company undertook several expansions and enlarged its product line of disposable medical devices. With the acquisition of McGaw, Inc. in 1997, including Central Admixture Pharmacy Services, Inc. (CAPS®), B. Braun dramatically broadened its product lines and services to U.S. customers.
U.S. Facilities and Operations:
Supporting product sales are a network of nationwide marketing and manufacturing locations. Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, is home to the U.S. Corporate Headquarters along with the marketing offices of the Hospital, Outpatient Markets (OPM), Renal Therapies, Vascular Interventional, International, and OEM Divisions. Central Admixture Pharmacy Services, Inc.(CAPS®) is also managed from this location. The nearby Allentown, Pennsylvania, facility manufactures Needle-free products, IV Safety Catheters, Anesthesia Systems, Introducers, Pharmacy Admixture products. Vascular products including Right Heart Catheters and Interventional Accessories are also manufactured in Allentown. The Irvine, California facility produces IV Solutions, Basic and Specialty Nutrition, Drug Delivery, and BTC products. Infusion Pump Systems are manufactured in Carrollton, Texas and IV administration and IV and Irrigation sets are produced in the Dominican Republic.
Your responsibilities
  • Position Summary:
  • The Receiving & Stores Supervisor supports the Supply Chain Group and the Manufacturing Groups by directing the daily activities of the warehouse, including labor scheduling, supervision, inventory accuracy, and proper utilization of space, equipment and manpower.
  • This position also serves as an interface and coordinator among Storeroom Operations, Purchasing, Production Planning, and Manufacturing. The Storeroom is accountable for the safe, efficient, and economical operation of the warehouse and equipment.
  • Responsibilities: Essential Duties
  • Develop and direct programs to ensure the efficient and cost-effective operation and utilization of all storeroom resources.
  • Plan and schedule all storeroom functions and services including receiving, storage, picking, cycle counting, maintenance and administrative activities to ensure manufacturing requirements are met in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Plan long range labor needs based on warehouse throughput and input from management. Make recommendations to management on programs to improve operations.
  • In conjunction with the Safety Department, develop, implement, and direct programs to ensure the safety of all personnel, equipment and property and establish safety goals, metrics and monitoring systems. Assure compliance with OSHA and MSDS regulations. Report all work related injuries and incidents.
  • Plan and direct activities to meet or exceed 5S and Pharmaceutical Elegance expectations.
  • Plan and direct monthly department meetings.
  • Develop and update all monthly department statistics.
  • Interact with management to establish goals.
  • Interact with Purchasing, Planning, and Manufacturing to ensure on-time execution of production plans.
  • Interact with departmental employees and Human Resources to resolve conflicts.
  • Interact with Quality Assurance to maintain prescribed quality levels.
  • Interact with Facilities Group to maintain required levels of security, sanitation and maintenance of facility.
  • Develop a space utilization plan to meet prescribed cost and service standards as well as long term company goals for conversion of warehouse space to manufacturing space. Monitor the layout plan to ensure it continues to meet company Standards and goals. Develop and implement an effective product locator system and update as necessary.
  • Direct the operations of the warehouse supervisory personnel to achieve prescribed objectives. Develop and maintain a productive work team by creating and implementing effective training, rewards and recognition programs and performance evaluation programs. Apply sound communication and motivational techniques in supervising, counseling and disciplining subordinates. Utilize performance evaluation system for recommending promotions, wage increases and terminations.
  • Develop procedures to ensure efficient operation and utilization of all warehouse equipment. Develop and implement a program of equipment maintenance. Coordinate repairs for equipment as needed. Adjust the quantity and types of equipment as needed to meet business needs and minimize costs.
  • Create and manage programs to maintain inventory, equipment, and facility to meet GMP requirements. Assure compliance with appropriate government regulations. Monitor and enforce GMP, ISO and safety compliance. Ensure operations comply with all OSHA, EPA, DEP, ISO, & FDA requirements, in cooperation with the EH&S; Department.
  • Maintain a cycle count program to ensure inventory accuracy. Meet annually with outside auditors to review cycle count accuracy.
  • Develop and implement an effective receiving operation that minimizes cost and ensures prompt and accurate reporting and handling of all receipts.
  • Develop and implement procedures to maintain the quality of stored materials and usage of materials in FIFO order. Develop and implement procedures to pick and stage materials in a timely cost effective manner.
  • Ensure the accurate and timely preparation, processing, distribution and retention of all reports and records regarding receiving and warehouse operations.
  • Prepare departmental budgets. Monitor and analyze annual budgets in order to meet financial goals and recommend and/or implement programs to reduce expenditures.
  • Expertise: Knowledge & Skills
  • Warehouse management and inventory management systems; Storeroom policies and procedures; Management theories; Company policies; ISO, FDA, and OSHA regulations; Warehouse equipment; Warehouse storage systems.
  • Troubleshooting, interpersonal skills, employee development and management, customer service, self-organization, and discipline, effective communication, time management. Organize workload, follow up with commitments, customer service oriented, manages staff, take initiative to resolve problems and issues, build consensus, effective communication.
  • Position regularly interacts with other company facilities to coordinate warehouse activities and material movements. Interacts with other facilities to recommend warehouse improvements and programs in space utilization and cycle counting.
  • Ability to use computer and related software (MS Office).
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all departments within organization.
  • Ability to manage staff and organize the efforts of all personnel.
  • Ability to prepare/organize presentations, reports, etc. for upper management.
  • Should be organized and detail oriented.

Your qualifications
  • Expertise: Qualifications - Experience/Training/Education/Etc
  • Required:
  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • 5+ years in Operations or Warehouse Management
  • 2+ years in supervision
  • Forklift operation may be required.
  • Desired:
  • Experience in a regulated environment
  • Experience in lean techniques
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
  • Braun offers an excellent benefits package, which includes healthcare, a 401(k) plan, and tuition reimbursement. To learn more about B. Braun and our safety healthcare products or view a listing of our employment opportunities, please visit us on the internet at www.bbraunusa.com Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities /Women/ Veterans/Disabled
  • Through its “Sharing Expertise®” initiative, B. Braun promotes best practices for continuous improvement of healthcare products and services.

What we offer

description:
Temple City CBAS Center is currently looking for Social Worker. The Social Worker is a critical part of the Community Based Adult Services (CBAS) team and acts as the primary contact for potential CBAS participants/family members; CBAS Centers and Community Partners for access to care issues. The Social Worker will complete an initial assessment and use this information to determine potential CBAS applicants’ needs. The position proactively identifies culturally sensitive areas of concerns in order to ensure appropriate access to the CBAS Medi-Cal benefit. The Social Worker also acts as a resource for potential CBAS participants, their family members, case managers, and community partners to address medical, behavioral, and psychosocial concerns. The right candidate is compassionate, patient and willing to work with senior population.

Position Responsibilities

- Contacts potential CBAS participants, family, and/or significant other(s) to assist in determining significant health history, background information after a CBAS Inquiry has been received.

- Collaborates and communicates with the CBAS Centers, physicians, and other health care providers to support and accomplish goals identified.

- Accepts referrals for case management and serves as a CBAS liaison to community agencies and organizations.

- Provides social work consultation and education to potential CBAS participants, family, and/or significant other(s). Acts as an advocate to assist in the coordination of the client’s identified psycho-social needs, utilizing community resources and support when appropriate.

- Participate in pro-active identification for additional care management needs. Initiate appropriate follow-up and the coordination of services of those members accepted for CBAS.

- Maintain documentation of communication and statistics required that impact the CBAS referral or workflow process.

- Develops and maintains a network of current community resources and services

- Other projects and duties as assigned.

Required Skills

- Communicate verbally and in writing complex material to others regardless of experience level.

- Think analytically to evaluate alternative courses of action for process/program development and problem solving.

- Develop creative/innovative approaches to challenges and opportunities.

- Adeptly utilize and access computer programs

- Manage multiple complex projects at one time.

- Effectively engage and participate as a case management team member working collectively toward a common set of defined goals.

Required Experience & Education

- Bachelor’s degree in Behavioral Sciences (Social Work, Sociology or Psychology) with at least 2 years’ direct experience with CBAS/ADHC program.

- Master's in Social Work or other behavioral practice desirable.

- California driver’s license and vehicle, or other approved means of transportation may be required for some assignments.

- Ability to meet if needed with members/families and perform a psychosocial assessment.

- Experience in working with members in a multi discipline care team setting.

- Mandarin Chinese speaking strongly preferred

Job Location:

  • Temple City, CA

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required language:

  • Mandarin

Salary: $18.00 to $28.00 /hour

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required language:

  • Chinese
title: Bilingual Mandarin Speaking Social Worker (MSW)

description:
Under supervision, to perform complex collection duties related to advanced phases of debt management for the investigation, research, pursuit and securing of payment and/or satisfaction of delinquent and non-delinquent debts owed to the County and other entities.

The current vacancies are located at the Department of Revenue. Work Hours: 7:30 am to 7:00 pm on weekdays. Some staff are required to work a 4/10 schedule (4 days per week, 8/8:30 am -7 pm). Schedules are determined by bid process, based on seniority at DOR.

The list established may be used for other vacancies as they occur.


TYPICAL TASKS
  • Collects debts by contacting and interviewing debtors by telephone, correspondence and in person;

  • Locates and interviews debtors, individuals and entities; reviews and discusses debt status and payment options; obtains and verifies information;

  • Interprets and explains forms, statements, correspondence, documents, legal obligations and the possible legal penalties for non-payment;

  • Persuades debtors to make voluntary payments and to establish payment plans without recourse to legal action;

  • Furnishes information to the public, departments and agencies regarding laws, regulations, policies, procedures or processes, without providing legal advice;

  • Conducts skip tracing using a variety of sources to obtain and verify information relating to a debtor's whereabouts, demographics, employment, earning, property, liabilities, assets and ability to pay;

  • Reviews documents, records, forms and other reports for accuracy, completeness and compliance with applicable rules and regulations and makes corrections as needed;

  • Confers with leads and/or supervisor regarding any legal actions advised, under consideration, planned or in process, and takes actions as directed; May recommend taking legal action where delinquent accounts cannot be collected by other means;

  • Maintains and monitors a designated group of records of accounts to review, update and summarize payment information and collection activity status;
  • Effects the collection of accounts which may include field pursuit activities and pursuit of collection, and court action;

  • Composes, prepares or generates a variety of collection-related information, statistics, correspondence, forms, sensitive or legal documents, logs, reports and notices;

  • Determines debtors financial condition and ability to pay based on pre-set criteria or formulated from case-by-case analysis;

  • Furnishes information to the public, departments and agencies regarding laws, regulations, policies, procedures or processes, without providing legal advice;

  • Negotiates and renegotiates payment schedules;

  • Analyzes accounts to recommend adjustments, uncollectable status or proper settlement, if appropriate;

  • Consults with legal counsel regarding legal procedures required to effect collection of delinquent accounts;

  • Searches County records to obtain pertinent data and possible sources of revenue;

  • May pursue collections through other sources of revenue such as client insurance and litigation;

  • Appears in court and testifies on facts relating to individual cases;

  • Obtains information on the transfer of ownership of real and personal property;

  • May offer orientation, work guidance and answer procedural questions for coworkers;

  • May serve as courier to pick up and deliver court, medical and other documents;
  • May be assigned as a Disaster Service Worker, as required;
  • Performs other related duties as required.
EMPLOYMENT STANDARDS Sufficient education, training and experience which demonstrates possession of the following knowledge and abilities:

Training and Experience Note: The knowledge and abilities required to perform this function are acquired through possession of a high school diploma or equivalent and three (3) years experience gathering financial information to schedule account payments, enforce payment through legal means, negotiate settlements, reconcile debt accounts, financial interviewing and/or skip tracing.

Thirty (30) semester units completed at an accredited college may substitute for one (1) year of the required experience.

OR

One (1) year of experience as a Revenue Collections Clerk in Santa Clara County.

Possession of a valid California Driver's License prior to appointment and the ability to qualify for and maintain a County Driver's Permit.

Knowledge of:
  • Basic laws, regulations and codes relating to the legal collection of funds;

  • Investigative processes necessary in collections of delinquent accounts;

  • Methods and techniques used in determining financial assets and in effecting revenue collections;

  • Office practices and procedures, including filing systems, financial record keeping, referencing sources and preparation of business letters, correspondence and reports; telephone procedures and etiquette;

  • Computer applications such as word processing, spreadsheet accounting systems and/or database;

  • Customer service skills, including communicating effectively with the public and assisting irate and distressed people;

  • Basic mathematics;

  • Correct English usage, grammar, spelling, vocabulary and punctuation.
Ability to:
  • Perform journey level collections assignments involving independent judgment and initiative;

  • Evaluate the financial condition of individuals;

  • Utilize skip tracing protocols to find debtors assets, location and other information to pursue debt collection;

  • Use standard office equipment including a computer for data input and retrieval;

  • Complete forms and schedules and documentation correctly, accurately and legibly;

  • Make mathematical computations of moderate difficulty;

  • Establish and maintain clear, accurate and comprehensive records of accounts;

  • Interpret the legal procedures and prerogatives involved in the collection of delinquent accounts;

  • Deal tactfully but firmly with the public;

  • Work under high demand, stressful conditions with a diverse population ;

  • Establish and maintain, effective work relationships with employees and the general public;

  • Handle and safeguard sensitive and/or confidential information.

VETERANS PREFERENCE INFORMATION: Any veteran who has submitted a copy of their DD214 form, and received a discharge of other than dishonorable, from the armed forces showing service in any branch of the United States military will be given a preferential credit of five percent (ten percent for those identified as disabled veterans), after attaining a passing examination score for a numerically scored examination, as applicable by Memorandum of Understanding.

THE EXAMINATION PROCESS: The examination process may include one or more of the following: application review, application appraisal, preliminary competitive rating, performance test, written test, and/or oral interview examination.

This recruitment may require completion of Supplemental Questions in order to evaluate your education, training and experience relative to the required knowledge and abilities for the position you are applying for.

Your responses to the questions may also be reviewed and scored in a Competitive Rating evaluation process based on pre-determined rating criteria. Your answers should be as complete as possible, as no additional information will be accepted from applicants once the Competitive Rating evaluation has begun.

*New Hires shall be subject to a pre-employment criminal background check.

DISASTER SERVICE WORKERS: Under California law, all County employees are designated as Disaster Service Workers (DSW). In the event of a catastrophic event, County employees may be expected to fulfill emergency action assignments. As DSW's, they may be assigned to assist in any disaster service activity that promotes the protection of public health and safety and preservation of lives and property.

INFORMATION ON PERS CONTRIBUTION: For new members, salaries above a limitation imposed by federal law (that limit per IRS is $117,020 for 2016): (1) neither the County nor the employee makes contributions to PERS on the portion of salary that exceeds the limit, and (2) the portion of the salary that exceeds the limit is not used by PERS to calculate the retirement benefit. If you were a member prior to January 1, 2013, the limit is $265,000 for 2016.
title: Revenue Collections Officer

description:
Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program

Lockheed Martin is looking for world-class talent in Operations Analysis to join our historic Skunk Works team in Palmdale, CA. The team is seeking a candidate who can develop and use engineering-based techniques, advanced analytical methods, and critical thinking to inform and improve decision-making and quantify value proposition for advanced concepts and technology applications. We need a candidate who is passionate about working on cutting-edge design concepts; comfortable with ambiguity; thinks strategically and creatively with proven analytical and engineering problem-solving skills; and thrives in a high-performing team environment.

The selected candidate will be responsible for modeling and analysis of military systems to quantify the impact of operational concepts (CONOPS), air system design, payloads, and tactics; as well as perform analysis to support requirements definition, concept of operations evaluation, operational and cost effectiveness studies, and military utility assessment. Responsibilities will include researching military systems performance and operations, modeling military systems and scenarios in digital simulations, designing and executing trade studies, quantifying Measures-of-Effectiveness (MOEs), analyzing simulation results to draw meaningful conclusions, preparing reports/briefings and presenting analysis results. The successful candidate must demonstrate effective communication and interpersonal skills as the position will require frequent interactions and collaboration with leadership, project leads, other team members, engineers in other disciplines, and customers. The ability to travel on occasion is required.

Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Must be a US Citizen this position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelors or above degree from an accredited college in related engineering discipline
• Proficiency to apply engineering principles to analyze performance of weapon systems
• Demonstrated analytical thinking and ability to solve complex technical problems
• Experience with trade study execution, data analysis, and delivering analysis results
• Proficient in scripting/programming; MATLAB or Perl/Python experience
• Must have an active Secret clearance with a current background investigation within the last five years and ability to obtain Top Secret and SAR program clearances

Must be a US Citizen this position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Desired skills
• Aerospace or mechanical engineering, applied mathematics, or Operations Research degree preferred
• Knowledge of surface and airborne military systems, operations, and Integrated Air Defense Systems (IADS)
• Military operations analysis experience
• Hands-on experience with discrete or Monte Carlo simulations of military operations (Suppressor, AFSIM, EADSIM, ESAMS, Brawler) including engagement, mission, and campaign
• Proficiency with C++/JAVA /XML
• Experience in modeling advanced system capabilities and behaviors in simulations; object-oriented design knowledge a plus
• Design of experiments, statistics and/or optimization knowledge; including JMP experience
• Proven customer engagement experience; with demonstrated skill to develop & deliver effective presentations
• Experience leading project to deliver analytic products
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Word
• Active Top Secret Clearance preferred

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Job Location(s): Palmdale California
title: Operations Analyst Senior

description:
Requisition ID: 132416
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device – SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.

We, at the Innovation Center Silicon Valley, create prototypes, technology frameworks and new business solutions with strategic customers, start-ups and leading research institutions. We’re looking for a passionate data scientist to lead the identification and exploration of whole new focus areas and to engineer Enterprise AI solutions based on the most recent research results in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.

Background
We are part of SAP’s Innovation Center Network which is headed by SAP’s Chief Innovation Officer Juergen Mueller. We are an interdisciplinary team from around the world with skills and experiences ranging from architecture, consulting, data science, visual & interaction design, research, to software sales and engineering and we are looking for a passionate leader & builder with a proven track record in applied machine learning.

Purpose
If you are an experienced data scientist who is looking for an exciting opportunity to explore whole new areas, to apply machine learning to complex business challenges and specifically to enable SAP’s users to interact with systems using natural language in a variety of ways. This role combines (1) experience with machine learning, (2) practical knowledge of working with scalable platforms for processing of huge data sets, (3) the ability to teach machines to understand natural language in robust ways, (4) building and maintaining innovative new products from the ground-up, and scaling from minimum viable product up to shippable production code. Be part of a team that rewards taking risks and drives new product ideas and development in the.

Responsibilities
  • Guiding development teams applying cutting-edge research insights in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing to challenges of SAP’s customers.
  • Contributing to the efficiency, effectiveness, and improvement of ICSV data science best practices as a thought leader, as an advisor to the leadership of the Innovation Center Silicon Valley as well as SAP’s Chief Innovation Officer.
  • Influence & multiply knowledge and skills across SAP’s product development organization with over 20,000 employees.
Requirements
  • At least 5 years of experience in deep learning / machine learning / data science development projects for innovative products.
  • M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or related field
  • Deep knowledge of ML/DL frameworks and NLP technologies
  • Statistics, predictive modeling, operations research, informatics and tools, e.g., SPSS, SAS, R, Python
  • Track record of developing novel learning algorithms and/or systems
  • Software development experience with Java, C++, JSON, Python, XML
  • Cloud-based experience with PaaS and IaaS, as well as Cloud-based, agile, development environments.
  • Strong enthusiasm and interest for new technologies and business models of the next generation
  • Ability to visualize data and present core insights in a clear and compelling way
  • Excellent written and communication skills in English language
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment with a lean product development process through rapid iteration
Location & Travel
  • Palo Alto, ~10% travel
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: C areers@sap.com ). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
